Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller110412
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, within easy walking distance to the busy Spanish steps down the hill but also close to the muesums and restaurants of the Repubblica area and to the Trevi Fountain and Centro Storico. Stayed in a Classic room, quiet, well furnished and maintained, good size for a European hotel however slightly small if used to US standards. Helpful and friendly front of house staff plus excellent housekeeping and turndown service. Nice quiet lounge/computer area tucked away in the upper lobby, handy for checking email and printing or just reading. Hotel is located on a quiet street but is handy to cafes/restaurants for breakfast, drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful way to start a vacation. My husband really wanted to stay here and I was worried because I thought it might be too far away from everything. Was I wrong! We were treated like royalty by everyone we encountered. The rooftop bar had a great happy hour and spectacular views. Our room was plush and modern. The huge tub begged me to take a bath! iPod radio, mini balconies, pillow top bed mattresses. Robes, slippers, turndown service and chocolates just enhanced the experience. I threw my coin into Trevino fountain so I know I'll be back and have no doubts where I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “sofitel Rome heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: abbnells
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel last May2011 it is a magnificent hotel our room was out of this world it was a ground floor room ,the bed was bigger than my lounge at home , we had every facility afforded to us dressing gowns slippers toiletries water , the staff were fantastic , it was near enough to visit everything in Rome on foot right behind the hotel is a beautiful park teeming with wild life , lots of Bars restaurant's cafes etc , Rome is a wonderful city ask at reception for a map and walk the city you wont be disappointed stay at the Sofitel if you can it is Heaven

Reviews.Title: “Very good experiance”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie C
Reviews.Content: 7 mins walks to the Spanish steps, all shops around. Rooms very nice and quiet. Staff very helpful and nice too. Wifi everywhere. Nice restaurant all around. Must stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Villa Borghese lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: rweissred
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights in Rome and stayed here, conveniently located 10 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and less than 2 blocks from Via Veneto, Metro stop and other sights. The hotel staff were EXTREMELY helpful and welcoming (we changed our dinner reservations 3 times one evening and they just smiled and joked with us). The room was large and the maid service impeccable. The lounge on the top floor gives a spectacular view. Only negatives were that we found better restaurants (mostly through Trip Advisor) than the concierge's recommendations and the internet access is poor...free for one connection to a slow WIFI service. Hotels have got to start realizing that people travel with iPhones, iPads and laptops. Also the bathroom, though large, has really no place to plant your stuff. We needed really FOUR connections! Otherwise really great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a visit to Rome! - With a fantastic roof top bar & restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Familiemannen
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel with my wife and had with me a group of company colleagues + wives and we had a great time! The hotel is situated on a hill and from the roof you have a fantastic panorama view of the city center. They have a new top floor with three suites and an outdoor restaurant / bar where they can open up the roof and remove the walls (folding doors) so it's transformed to an open outdoor experience, we just loved this top floor restaurant and bar! The hotel has a great central location and the fact that it’s on a hill is no problem, just a few minutes and you are downtown. The hotel is also just a short walk from the “Gelleria Borghese” which was just spectacular! Amazing paintings and my favorite, sculptures by Bernini and others. Probably the best sculpture gallery in Rome. The suites have beautiful terraces’ with great views, and the deluxe rooms were great. We highly recommend this hotel, we will stay her when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robynCliftonbeach
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write about this Hotel since we returned April 2011. Just want to say its a lovely hotel and the staff were great its in a quiet street but still not far from Spanish steps and via Veneto i'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in Rome and we had a wonderful experience with Sofitel. The people were so helpful and friendly. The room was relaxing and nice. I would highly suggest this be your hotel of choice. It was also a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Our Special stay at Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: Bob K
Reviews.Content: What can we say, it was wonderful. The staff was so gracious, and helpful. We took our 90 year old Mother (she's Italian), to Rome, Italy for the 1st time. She had her own room, and loved it all. The Breakfast served in the Hotel was spectacular. The staff was warm, helpful, and could not do enough for us. The rooms were very nice, roomy for Europe, great appointments. We throughly enjoyed the rooftop bar, and restaurant. The views were incredible. Food and service wonderful. We will be going back. Its a great location in Rome, and close to the Spanish steps. Great neighborhood Restaurants in walking distance. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mltripadvisotr
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Sofitel while in Rome. The staff was exquisite to us and they did whatever to make us feel very welcome and even on the last day, when we had already checked out, and I went back to the hotel as I had hurt my foot,they did their best to make me feel comfortable while I was waiting for the taxi to go to the airport. The room was lovely and spaciuos, so the bathroom. The level of cleaness was excellent, they were coming in the room twice per day to clean and tyding up.Top notch also the roof terrace, we had a couple of drinks in there that were lovely.The location is perfect near Trinita' dei Monti and Villa Borghese. This hotel really made the difference to our stay, I cannot really find a thing to fault it.I would really reccomend it for a romantic week-end.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make it 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Cuschoolie1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great property. It's within walking distance to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, and a metro stop. If you're taking the train from the airport, it's very easy and inexpensive to take the metro to the hotel. Inside, the property is well appointed and the room we had was very clean and in great condition. Clean and comfortable bedding, well stocked and appointed bathroom as well. My only gripe about the room was the shower. It's got a weird half shower door that swings open. Maybe I'm just not used to that style but I found it a little odd and water did tend to get on the floor. The rooftop bar / restaurant is definitely worth the trip up to the top floor for the view....but definitely not the service. We waited 15 minutes for someone to come greet us, however no one came. We were the only two there and at least 5 staff members that we could see. We took a couple pictures from the outdoor patio and left. Probably was for the best as we found a great little cafe up the road where the entire meal cost less than a couple of cocktails would have in the on site bar / restaurant. What really made the stay 5 stars vs 4 stars was the front desk and door staff. The front desk folks were always accommodating and gave us great tips on which sites to see, the best and cheapest ways to get there, etc. I felt like we asked way more questions than your average traveler and they were always happy to help. If you can afford to spend extra on your lodging expenses, this hotel is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a competitive price”
Reviews.Author: Poopycat
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location in Rome, not too far from the Spanish Steps and a Metro station. Upon arrival, the bellman and front desk staff were effusive in their welcome. The bellman remembered me and greeted me every time he saw me. The front desk area was a bit cramped and not terribly private, but that's no big deal since I was going to be sleeping in my room, not the lobby! The room itself was impeccably clean. Kind of dark, and I would have appreciated a more comfortable chair that I could have flopped into after a long day of sightseeing. Very nice, spacious bathroom, particularly by European standards. Seems silly, but once you experience some of the restrooms in Rome, you will be happy to see a nice bathroom at your hotel. I ordered room service twice during my stay, and it was all right. Not great. The person who delivered the food was the only member of staff who wasn't particularly polite. He knocked on my door while he was on the phone with another guest, and hardly said two words to me. Overall though, certainly a hotel worth considering when you are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Globaladventure
Reviews.Content: This is a great example of a hotel that offers friendly, helpful and genuine service throughout. I was truly bowled over by this wonderful Team, who could not do enough to make sure we had a wonderful stay. OK - the hotel is quite old in decor and the restaurant on the roof is over priced. But it shows that they are making do with what the company have given them and are certainly ensuring that guests leave, having had a great experience. The location is superb - close to the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese, in a elegant part of the city. The hotel is historic and although rooms are a little dated in decor, they are however in good condition and offer everything you would expect from a five star experience (complimentary WiFi, Bose Stereo, Hermes Amenities in the Bathroom etc...). There is a great Bar/Restaurant on the roof - with stunning sunset views over the city. Pity the restaurant prices are ridiculously high. Breakfast is served in the lower ground floor and is an excellent selection (but you pay Euro 30 for it). If Sofitel invested in an update to the decor, this would be one of the best options in Rome. In the meantime - go for the wonderful staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL 5 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SimonandNikki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the five star sofitel hotel in Rome which was an absolute delight. It was our first wedding anniversary and therefore we wanted this trip to be very special and the hotel did not let us down with superb beautifully dressed rooms which looked totally independent and not part of a 'chain'. The hotel service levels, from all manner of the hotel team, were exceptional, helping to book tickets and having macs to use in the hotel lobby. We decided on our first night to use the rooftop terrace restaurant, which we later found out had just been voted the best rooftop terace in europe. Prices in the restaurant were a little on the heavy side but we chose the 7 course extravaganza which was exquisite, and after all we were in central rome. The chef would pop out occasionally and discuss the food and the background to his training which was very interesting. All in all a wonderful experience in this hotel and we would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azureas Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and staff friendly. Some remarks however: - Advice from the staff about good restaurant were not exact. - As well the concierges confirmed us that Castel Sant'Angelo were open Monday although this is not the case. Luckily, before to go there, we phoned to the castle museum and a voice mail informed us that it was well closed on Monday. - With a young child (6) the place is perfect for the Villa Borghese gardens but a little far, by feet, of the city center. - Breakfast is splendid but e little expensive (30€/p). Nevertheless we keep a very very good memory of this hotel (the room was splendid) and about the staff in general. We will return with great pleasure !

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: peter_glazier
Reviews.Content: Exellent, excellent and again excellent. The staff at all levels are to be congratulated on their friendliness, hospitality and efficiency. The rooms were large and very confortable and as usual Sofitel beds and pillows can´t be surpasssed. Breakfast was included for my wife and I and we paid for my grandaughter. EUROS 30,00 is a little steep. Otherwise only positive memories especially overlooking the city and Borghese gardens from the roof top bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JamesRobson
Reviews.Content: First time in a Sofitel and was expecting plain and corporate. Was far more luxurious and seemed like a stand alone hotel rather than a chain. Superb breakfast and great views from top floor bar / restaurant in the evening. Breakfast is served in the basement but is surprisingly well laid out. That being said I don't understand why they do not do breakfast upstairs. Negatives is rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view”
Reviews.Author: martina038
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights with the whole family. Our 3 rooms were quiet, well equipped and located close to each other. The hotel is situated on a quiet street close to the Villa Borghese and the main attractions of the city can easily be reached within a few minutes walk. What we most appreciated was the breathtaking view from the restaurant "La Terrasse Cuisine & Lounge" located on the top floor of the building. As we visited Rome during the summer, the weather was nice and warm until late at night and we just couldn't resist to have dinner every night on the terrasse of the hotel just to benefit from that incredible view over the city. The food was very good and the service excellent. Also, the breakfast served downstairs in the old stables is just extraordinary! We'll certainly book the Sofitel also next time when we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great! We love Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Alexey1509
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel for 4 nights in December and January. The location of the hotel is great! Just few minutes walk from the very city centre, on a very quiet street. The stuff is VERY friendly and helpful! The rooms are a bit old, especially carpets, but in Rome everything's seems to be quite old! :) We loved our stay anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! This stay at Sofitel in Roma was our fourh stay in Rome and in this hotel) Perfect location just near Spanish Steps! Very friendly staff! Beautiful rooms and VERY comfortable bed with pillows menu)))! Im recomending this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance in a great location”
Reviews.Author: neelio45
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in Rome is a fantastic choice for business and leisure travelers who ar seeking elegance and five star service in an understated boutique hotel. The rooms were immaculate, the staff attentive and the servic and views from the rooftop bar, spectacular. The location is ideal for walking out to local sites or to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: shirlz99 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in close walking distance to alot of the attractions. Our room overlooked Villa Borghese. Hotel was in a nice quiet area, breakfast was also good. Free internet was also provided in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Romantic Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: bobbulo
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel that maintains the Sofitel standards. We liked it because it was in a quite location, not on the main streets but just a short walk from the Spanish Steps. Our room was very luxurious - though not large. And this is one of the hotels that still has an evening bed turn-down service (at least our room did). The hotel on the whole is very well run and the staff are very attentive. The views from the rooftop restaurant are beautiful both during the day but especially in the evenings. The meal portions are what you would expect from a hotel of this calibre (very well made but small) - having tried one of the restaurants around the corner from the hotel (Il Picolo Mondo - I was not impressed) we decided we'd continue eating at the hotel if we were nearby. Apart from the Vatican, you can pretty much walk to most of the important ruins (colloseum about 20 minute walk) The only downside that comes to mind is that there's no gym/pool facility in the hotel. They have an agreement with an establishment somewhere nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Rome Villa Borghese meets all the demands and needs of either a business or a leisure traveller, when visiting Rome. The first impression you get when arriving at the lobby is very pleasant. The front desk staff, acted very professionally and classy, and the lobby itself was beautifully decorated. When i got up to my room, i noticed that it did not have the view i was expecting. When i shared this with the reception, they immediately provided me with 3 different rooms to choose from, as i did. I have to say that they acted instantly. The room was elegant, very clean, and the bed as comfortable as it gets. The breakfast was what you would expect from a five star hotel. Covers every possible taste, in a luxurious environment. The Terrasse Restaurant up in the seventh floor is rumored to have the best view in Rome. Well, guess what: it does. I also want to stress out the politeness and helpfulness of the waiter (Mirko) who satisfied my every request and with whom i had a very nice chat. Great food, excellent atmosphere... The check out was not as speedy as though it would be, because of a messed up computer system, that overcharged me. Fortunately it was quickly resolved, i payed the proper amount, and was on my way. This incident in no way overshadows this magnificent hotel and the great human resources that it possesses. I will be visiting again, and i strongly recommend it to anyone who can afford a little luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but hike from the metro”
Reviews.Author: mljstravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and room near the top floor had a charming view across Rome to St Peter's in the distance for the standard room rate. Only hitch - finding the hotel from the subway. Barberini metro is much easier than the Spanish Steps. But most people here probably arrive by taxi anyway! Breakfast from the local cafes in the street is much quicker and far cheaper and better coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, attractive, well run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JezMelb
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two separate occasions in May and June this year. We liked the location - a short walk to the Spanish steps and near Villa Borghese. We found it to be quiet and a bit removed from the crowds which suited us perfectly. We still managed to walk everywhere we went except for the Vatican. The rooms were in good condition (bathrooms showed some wear and tear) and were quite different sizes on the two occasions we stayed. As with a lot of European hotels they tend towards the smaller size. Service was good and the breakfasts excellent. The roof top bar had super views.

Reviews.Title: “Dream in Rome”
Reviews.Author: robertaferraz
Reviews.Content: We chose Sofitel for our honeymoon start in Rome. We stayed for 5 nights and had a blast. The hotel is charming and the service couldn't be better. You do have to go up a hill when coming back, but it's worthy. The restaurant on too has an amazing view of Rome. Highly recommended for those who want to experience a different Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Drloughnan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011. Room was fantastic! View was to die for! And the rooftop bar made for one of the most wonderful sunsets we have ever experienced! Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: EBWest
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most comfortable hotels I have ever stayed in. Feather beds, Egyptian cotton sheets, Hermes toiletries, quiet and private room, extravagant breakfast buffet and a roof-top restaurant overlooking Rome with views that make the trip unforgettable. Service was professional and welcoming. We were sorry to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chirri_05
Reviews.Content: The location is great, walking distance to (some 10 min.) to Piazza Spagna or even to the Fontana di Trevi. Hotel as such and room was very nice. They only called me in the middle of the night by mistake advising that there was a car waiting for me...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kimberlina34
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and what a lovely hotel. Excellent luxury room - newly decorated. Huge walk-in closet with safe and mini bar. Separate lounge area with a sleeper sofa. Nice bathroom with rainshower and deep tub. Big king size bed with lots of pillows. 2 flat screen tv's. Bose docking station. Nice linens. We had room service coffee and cocoa each morning - fast and delicious. Rooftop terrace for a surprise Thanksgiving lunch. Excellent turkey dinner and desserts. I loved everything about this hotel. The service was lovely. A quick walk to the Via Veneto and Spanish Steps. Room on 6th floor was dead quiet. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better, not a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeMilly
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in a luxury room with either a view of Rome or the Gardens at the Sofitel Villa Borghese after our cruise ended in Rome, and had reasonably high expectations of a 5 star hotel in a large hotel group. It wasn't a great start as when we arrived the room wasn't ready and two hours later after asking Reception, we were told it had been ready for over an hour and 'my colleague should have told you'. The room was large and comfortable but the paint was peeling in the bathroom and it needed some work, and our view of Rome wasn't there and our view of the 'Gardens' was a rear empty courtyard with 3 trees in it. There was one free bottle of water in the room of about 350 ml's, hardly enough for two glasses of water per person, therefore you needed to purchase the mineral water from the bar fridge. Just a bit on the mean side, but okay not really a big issue. The shower was unusual, it was an old style hand held shower in a bath, but they had installed a rain shower head at a later stage. The funny thing was that where they positioned the shower head, you virtually had to stand on the end of the bath to get under it, so one foot in the bath the other on the top of the bath. Also the pressure was so poor that getting conditioner out of your hair was difficult, the water temperature was lukewarm and ran hot and cold and it was strictly one towel each per day. Not really what you expect from a 5 star hotel. The room service wasn't a success either, after the first day I felt like something simple so ordered a hamburger. All was fine other than the room service lady seemed offended by the intrusion and the bread roll was so stale it was a biscuit and crumbled when touched. The public areas were limited to a breakfast room and the Terrace Bar and Restaurant, which was nice with great views, but overall the hotel was a bit poor on alternatives compared to the Intercontinental down the road. The location is great but the obvious nickel and dimming spoils the experience, not really a 5 star hotel more a 3 star. There are other better options available in the same area for much the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: keymoney
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to base your stay visiting rome. The rooms are very comfortable, decorated in traditional Italian style. Great views from the restaurant on the top floor. This is the place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good for Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: JerseyLB
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinium A-Club Member and honestly I don't know if this people are traveling often but this hotel is definately not a 5*...and for sure not a Boutique Hotel! (compare to Philipp Stark design) Very disapointed for a Sofitel, staff are nice, room was ok for value but view over thi pipes in the courtyard....not very romantic. Bar and restaurant...terrible!! very dated looking.(Go to the Hotel de Russie for a drink and you will see what is a nice bar and service)., Bar staff are so-so and on top of that it was Marrocan music and evening for 3 days! great if you are looking for an Italian atmosphere. Wifi was not working always correctely and room service coffe was cold and not nice for Italy. The good point is a good restaurant 2 min walk from hotel, Vladimiro.

Reviews.Title: “Another Quality Sofitel, sooo close to full marks.”
Reviews.Author: Penguin_Family_1
Reviews.Content: Sometimes, paying extra to stay in a good hotel really is worth it. Every Sofitel I have stayed in so far demonstrates this. Rome meets the high standards. The staff are excellent. Polite, attentive, multi-lingual and extremely helpful. Restaurant recommendations and reservations, taxi bookings, tourist guide bookings - all from the front desk, as though nothing is too much trouble. As with most italians, they don't just do what you ask, they give you a detailed personal opinion to help. Check in and straight to the bar on the top floor. Lessons in making cocktails from the bar staff. (They were not too busy....) Great balcony by the bar. Excellent bourbon old-fashioned on the house for new arrivals. Breakfast staff also polite and friendly, but need to speed up a bit. Best hotel breakfast omelette for a while though. Breakfast would be better if it was in a room with a view, not the basement, but the selection and quality of produce is good. Good room - strong but quiet air-con, amazingly comfy bed, good minibar without those annoying automatic pads on them. So you can go to shop down the road, stock up on cheap booze and put it in the fridge! One small problem with the leaky sink was fixed within minutes. We had a problem opening the safe and this was also fixed within minutes by security. We only think this misses out on excellent because the water pressure in the bathroom was a bit low. If you want a bath you need about 30 minutes to fill it. Admittedly it's a big bath. The hot water wasn't too hot for the first couple of days but suddenly improved. Nice Hermes bath products. It looks as though a "lounge bar" is being added to the hotel on the ground floor. Good news. This would put the icing on the cake here. Another quality result from Sofitel and sooo close to being excellent. The staff are certainly excellent, the rooms very good. Really pleased with the service levels. PS hotel mercedes to the airport is only 5 or 10 Euros more than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Dogsbythesea
Reviews.Content: Great location! Our room was beautiful, with a balcony overlooking the street, very quiet and comfortable. The breakfast was the best I've seen in Europe!! The entire staff was friendly, courteous, polite and helpful...really 5 star service! This is a top notch operation, you won't be disappointed. We loved Rome and will visit again! Thank you Sofitel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely time at the Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: crusinKate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Borghese for 4 nights 9/5 - 9/2011, it was a beautiful hote, and the restaurant on the rooftop was magical, the service was perfect the food five star.. our room was very lovely, it was in the back of the hotel, there was an outside sitting area, it reminded me of living in NYC when I was a kid back in the 70s... the concierge was very helpful.. our stay included the morning europ style breakfast on the lower floor, of all the hotels we stayed in thru Europe this had the most extensive buffet breakfast, as an American I was pretty tired of cold cuts(!!!) for breakfast and lukewarm milk.. this breakfast had wonderful asian style breakfast that I thoroughly enjoyed. The location was perfect. The Spanish steps are a hop away.. Rome was magical and my most favorite city of the 4 we visted (london, paris, rome and venice).. I highly recomend this hotel, and remember to visit the restaurant on the rooftop, the service and food was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: traveler d
Reviews.Content: Do Not book here!They take extra money from everything without even know it!

Reviews.Title: “25th anniversary- wow!”
Reviews.Author: 25thanniversary2011
Reviews.Content: Staff excellent. Beautiful hotel. room excellent. bed wonderful little expensive but worth every dime! can walk to every thing very close to spanish steps. food wonderful excellent breakfast buffet 30.oo Eur per person. room spacious. wonderful bathroom with all amenities. worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Rome”
Reviews.Author: pitbuell
Reviews.Content: A very elegant hotel with beautifully appointed rooms, the king-size bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Centrally located so it was easy to get around. The roof top terrace restaurant afforded a lovely view of the city and the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Roma Experience”
Reviews.Author: dabmrb Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location; beautiful room and view from our balcony; great rooftop terrace bar and restaurant; very convenient location to all of Rome's sites (8 minute walk from the subway stop). All staff were superior in their helpful and very friendly attitude attitude. Expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel service and locattion”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Roma Villa Borghese is an excellent hotel located at the center of Rome just two minutes from the Spanish Stairs. This is our second time there and we enjoyed the superb service and the facilities which perfectly fitted with the atmosphere of our visit in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Another Sofitel Success Story”
Reviews.Author: dingotraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my third Sofitel hotel experience and the best so far. I have previously stayed at their St James location in London and at their Washington DC location just off La Fayette Square. Everything however at this Sofitel just seems to come together from the service to the rooms to the location.The rooms at the Roma location are an excellent size and the place is just the right spot.Just around the corner from the Spainish Steps and not too far from other sights such as the Trevi fountain. Rooms are well appointed and a good size. Great breakfast served daily downstairs keeps you going till dinner. Nothing was a problem for the Front desk staff. Overall a truly enjoyable experience. Would definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Occasion hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful for a special occasion, otherwise somewhat expensive as you are paying for items rarely used such as a Bose ipod dock or large screen tv. Rome is a city to be visited not be locked away in a hotel fancy hotel room. The room was spacious and comfortable. The staff attentive and helpful but unobtrusive. The views of St Peter's and Rome could be enjoyed from rooftop restaurant ' La Terrace'. It was somewhat cool the evening we were there and the restaurant manager immediately offered us blankets to shield us from the cold when we stepped outdoors to take in the views of Rome by night - a thoughtful touch by her. The service was excellent and the food as one might expect from a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LondonLoveroma
Reviews.Content: We Cannot wait to go back to Sofitel, the terrace & views from it are simply devine whether it's night or day, overlooking the Villa Borghese gardens & the city of Rome. We received the most amazing service and our wedding celebration meal was held for 20 guests on the terrace, all of which were extremely complimentary on the service & as mentioned before, the views. We enjoyed a 2 night stay in the hotel ourselves and really cannot find fault with anything, the room was clean,spacious & extremely comfortable and due to the location was very quiet at night. The breakfast had a wonderful selection of pretty much everything you could wish for and a lovely breakfast room. Just as impressive as the view is the food, our 7 course wedding meal was absolutely suberb & some of our guest's have already suggested we should renew our vows (next year, and we only got married 2 weeks ago !) just so as we can all celebrate it again at Sofitel. In the year leading up to our wedding we viewed various hotels in Rome, all of course with roof top terraces & Sofitel was, the moment we saw it "THE ONE"

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed by this so called "luxury" hotel except for the breakfast and toiletries provided”
Reviews.Author: bittenbytheTbugz
Reviews.Content: Am astonished by the number of excellent reviews on this hotel. I spent 3 nights here in Sept 2011 and wasn't very impressed by the hotel at all, save for the winsome buffet spread at breakfast and the Hermès toiletries provided by the hotel, which smelt and felt absolutely divine, both of which are admittedly the best I have come across amongst all my hotel experiences around the world, and I have stayed at a far number of hotels through the years. To begin with, for what we were paying for, the hotel could have been in a better location. While I definitely wouldn't call the location bad, I didn't consider it to be ideal as well. Spanish steps and the main shopping belt was a good 10-15 min walk away and with heavy shopping to lug, that distance certainly wasn't something I appreciated. Another grouse was the lack of space on the hotel grounds. There were no beautiful outdoor courtyard, gardens or even a pool for guests to enjoy some sun and fresh air. And for a hotel that calls itself a "luxury" hotel, I certainly was expecting much more from the fittings, furniture and layout of the hotel. The corridors were tiny, while the fittings and furniture used in the rooms didn't look anywhere near the posh I imagined a luxury hotel to have though I have to say a big plus point was the unexpected spaciousness of the hotel rooms. To sum it up, I would stay here for the excellent breakfast, wonderful toiletries and spaciousness of rooms if I wasn't so particular about location and having a pool and nice grounds in the hotel to catch a breather and some sun. Unfortunately I am big on both, and also hard to please when it comes to delivering on value - something which I felt this hotel fell short of as well. For what you end up paying for, you might as well top up a little more for a better, bigger hotel in a better location with nice hotel grounds. Unless you don't intend to leave your room in Rome. Which is of course highly unlikely unless it's a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: JRoChicago1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome last week and my boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at the Sofitel. We stayed a week at the Sofitel and enjoyed our spacious very clean room. The hotel is located in a quiet area that is hidden away from tourists. There are tons of coffee shops and restaurants in the area. And of course, our favorite spot to end our day was the roof top bar and restaurant. The views from the top were beautiful. The food in the restaurant is really good, we enjoyed an amazing dinner the last night when we did the chef's special. Close to spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Eccelente!”
Reviews.Author: Zoeycat
Reviews.Content: Just left Roma and the Sofitel 2 days ago, and it was tough to leave them both. I really don't have a lot to add to others' raves (wonderful is wonderful), but nevertheless I will add my two cents. We had a beautiful, large, CLEAN room. The bed was super comfortable. We were a little concerned when we saw that for bedding there was only the top-sheet and a heavy duvet. We've had problems in other hotels (and cruise ships) where the sheet isn't enough and the duvet is too much -- you can't get the room cool enough to use the duvet and I hate sleeping in a warm room. The a/c in this room worked; I think you could set it low enough to wake up with icicles hanging from the lamps if you wanted to. Speaking of lamps, there were great little individual, adjustable reading lamps at both sides of the bed - a nice touch. The shower temperature was consistent, with plenty of hot water and fluffy towels. Hermes amenities. Breakfast was included in our package and was delicious, other than that we did not eat in the restaurant (too many little sidewalk cafes within walking distance). The front desk personnel were friendly, VERY helpful, delightful people. Great location; very quiet. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about the Sofitel Villa Borghese.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: mmsull2
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a beautiful hotel located near the Villa Borghese and Via Veneto. The lobby is elegant and understated, and the staff is professional and accomodating. We arrived at around 9:30 a.m. after a long flight from Denver. Unfortunately, since we arrived so early, our room wasn't available. We used the restroom to freshen up as much as we could, and left to grab breakfast and see the Spanish Steps (only a couple of minutes away). When we returned around noon, our room still wasn't ready, but they did have a different room available. After we arrived in our room, we were pleasantly surprised. It was large for Rome standards, and very well appointed. The bathroom was large and functional (Hermes bath products - a major plus!) The location is quiet and slightly out of the hustle and bustle of the touristy area. It was great for us because we don't mind a little bit of a walk, but if you have a concern with a lot of walking, this may not be the hotel for you. Overall, Rome is a very walkable city, and that was something we took full advantage of!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: catsticks
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Sofitel, which is in the Villa Borghese/Via Veneto area of Rome. Upon arrival at this lovely, elegant hotel, we were warmly greeted by all the staff. Our room was fantastic. The location was nice and quiet at night and the staff were excellent in anticipating and fulfilling our requests. We have absolutely no complaints and would recommend the Sofitel to anyone! Make sure you check out the rooftop restaurant for a meal one evening - spectacular vistas and very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Rome Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: raymondwilk Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a relatively quiet area off the top of the Via Venato up from Barbarini Square. It is a clean comfortable hotel with very friendly professional staff who make you feel welcome. The room we had was very large with a sitting room separate from the bedroom with a large marble bathroom as well. The room that I had did not have a view it looked out on a internal light well but for security reasons i was reluctant to open the window as access was possible from the light well to the room. It is a bit of a hike to the nearest metro stations either the spanish steps or Barberini but there are buses that go up the Via Venato fron Barberini and stop at the end of the street that the sofitel is in. (Via Lombardia). We decided not to take breakfast in the hotel as it is quiet pricey and cheaper options are available, even in Via Venato. A very nice touch was the welcoming complimentary drinks in the roof terrace on the 6th floor of the hotel. The terrace has a magnificant view over the surrounding areas and it is certainly worth a visit. We would stay at the Sofitel again when in Rome it is very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Aries387
Reviews.Content: Location was great and the service was good. I would rate it a 4 star not a 5 star. Room was nice and clean. Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant let the hotel down.”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalExPat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel in mid-September. The weather was fantastic and the hotel is perfectly positioned to walk to most of the main sites, the Spanish Steps being only 5 minutes walk away and Trevi fountain being only 20 minutes. We also walked back from the Colosseum which was no problem for us but do be aware that it is cobbled streets and quite hilly so flat shoes/flip flops advisable. Hotel provides you with a bottle of water. Take this in the morning, and you can fill up from one of the many fountains around the city. All water fountains are drinking water and are always cold. The hotel itself is traditional in style. It has fantastically comfy beds. There is free Wifi in the rooms too. Toiletries are all provided by Hermes so you'll smell nice! Room lighting is good and you don't need a degree to turn it on or off!! Front desk is very pleasant and checked 3 of our 4 person party in at different times with no problems and provided us with a map of Rome and circled all the important sites, good eating and shopping areas. The breakfast buffet downstairs had a good spread of healthy options along with teas and juices, or you could pay for plates from the breakfast menu. The roof top bar and restaurant has wonderful views and is worth going for drinks in the late afternoon as the sun goes down. However, although the restaurant food is very good, the wait for food is completely unacceptable. We had booked a table for 8.30pm, we weren't seated till 10.00pm and saw no food till gone 10.30pm. There were only 8 tables being served, and they gave us a game to play while we waited to be seated, which shows this must happen quite a lot! Having made it clear to the staff when we eventually sat down that 1 person in our party was Gluten-Free (could not eat flour), when they brought out pre starter food, they gave all 4 of us the same plate. After about 10 minutes, a waiter came rushing over and took the plate from that person and said they had something better! In other words, realised that they had given them a plate with flour in, and didn't say anything. There was no apology and no explanation until members of our party physically went inside to speak to the manager saying that it was unacceptable. When someone eventually did come from the kitchen, they said, quote, "Oh, it's OK! It only has 10% flour in it if you have eaten it!" So we would advise you to not eat in the restaurant, but to go for drinks and take in the spectacular views.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melbtraveller09
Reviews.Content: Located in a rather quiet, slightly out of the way neighbourhood, but an easy walk to key attractions like The Spanish Steps, this is a lovely hotel. Rooms are very comfortable (though could use a little maintenance - peeling paint etc) with those Sofitel beds which truely are amazing. Very helpful and friendly staff. The rooftop terrace bar is the perfect place to wind down with an afternoon drink and catch your breath after a busy day walking around Rome - great cocktail list and fantastic bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & worth the price”
Reviews.Author: slonnett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Italy this summer, and after weeks of poring over reviews and maps and soliciting all the advice we could, we decided to make Rome our first stop for 3 nights before heading to Siena then Sorrento. The Sofitel looked lovely in the photos, inside and out, and I have to say: it definitely lived up to them! Upon our arrival to Rome, we were hopeful that this hotel would be up to the standards that its price tag promised - especially after so many people had informed us that the standards of luxury are so different in Italy as compared to the States. We chose the Sofitel after considering several other hotels that have prime locations to see all the tourist attractions like the Trevi Fountain and the Piazza Navona, and this proved to be a great choice. We were up on the hill near the Borghese Gardens, and we were within walking distance of all the things we wanted to see and do. Because the Softiel is atop a hill, the view from the rooftop terrace was amazing & definitely worth it, but it also means that returning to your room after a day of marathon sight-seeing can be a bit of a climb, but as we sipped wine at sunset overlooking St. Peter's and the Villa Medici, we agreed that the Sofitel was an excellent choice for us and sooo worth the climb up that hill every afternoon!! Outside, the building is a lovely warm gold and all the architectural details are intact. There are modern touches at the entrance, like two wrought iron orbs with gas torches on them that are lit at night. We arrived around 10 a.m. in the morning and were greeted warmly by the doorman who, after an easy check-in, immediately tagged our bags for holding so we could walk around the city until check-in at 3. All the staff were smiling and happy to greet us and spoke English. When we returned early (around 2), we were glad to learn that our room was ready, and we took the elevator up to the 2nd floor. All the common areas are very clean and well-appointed, VERY elegant - and the same is true for the hallways and stairwells. There are crystal chandeliers, beautiful painted moldings and comfortable, elegant seating groups in the lobby areas. There is also a series of provocative artwork in the lobby with some nudity, but unless you were with really observant kids, I wouldn't worry... I wasn't offended or anything - it all lent a very artistic, tasteful and contemporary touch. The room was not giant (as expected), but for a couple with luggage, it was more than ample space - and the best part: the air conditioning was already running and the room was nice and cool! This was great, because we were there in late June/early July and daily temps were in the low to mid 80's every day. The window treatments, carpets, bathroom fixtures, and bedding were all lovely and clean. The safe, TV, lamps, etc. all worked wonderfully - no problems whatsoever. Our bathroom had a nice deep tub and shower with a movable glass panel that kept most of the water off the bathroom floor - all the fixtures worked fine - no issues with the plumbing & ample hot water. I took two wonderful, hot baths during our stay because my body was weary from all the walking and climbing we did every day - it was a Godsend for tired legs and feet, and I was really glad for this unexpected bonus in the room. We were able to borrow an iron from the room staff, and there was an ironing board in the room, so that worked out fine. We learned later, as we continued on our trip, that irons are NOT always available from the hotel (let alone standard in the rooms), and that it is common for a hotel to offer a laundry service for a fee if you need something steamed or pressed. This led us to get creative with some water and a blowdryer at some of our other hotels along the way because we didn't have time to send our clothes out the day before if we had just arrived and needed a dress or shirt pressed for dinner that night. So, either bring a travel iron or go rumpled! Overall, I would highly recommend staying at the Sofitel. We were extremely pleased by the room. The hotel has one of the best views from their rooftop terrace (where they also have a really cool & swanky bar area), the rooms are clean, cool and comfortable, and it has a great location. Would return here in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient but quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Foodita
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our four day stay at the Sofitel in Rome. Sofitel always have high standards and I would choose this chain over others when I can. The hotels never seem to have such a 'corporate' feel but retain an element of intimacy. The staff are always impeccable. Sofitel Roma Villa Borghese has been our favourite so far. We were so comfortable in our room with views over the vatican and they kindly placed our daughter right next door, she also had wonderful views and quite frankly couldn't believe her luck. The rooms are traditional so if you are looking for modern minimalism then it is not for you. The beds are wonderful, you can actually order them for your home, I slept so well here - perhaps it was all the walking. The roof top terrace/bar is very stylish and it is lovely to sit and have a drink early evening whilst the sun goes down. Yes, prices are expensive, but everything is expensive in Rome and afterall it is a 5* hotel. We were only able to have one breakfast due to our reservations at the sites and the menu was a little limited for us as we did not want to have the full buffet just something small. They were very accomodating though and allowed us to order from the room service menu. The staff make this hotel. Reception is always charming, Luigi on the door is such a character and we enjoyed his banter, concierge helpful and interested in what you are doing. We loved the location, it is a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and all the shops and restaurants that are in this area. It is not so near to the old rome sites but taxis are reasonable and the metro is nearby. I would think in cooler months the walk would be pleasant. The great thing about the hotel is that it is in a quieter neighbourhood, we needed that after the crowds and hustle and bustle of Rome. (The hotel is 5 minutes walk to the museum Villa Borghese - unmissable but if you want to go book your tickets in advance - that advice goes for everything in Rome - it makes life so much easier).

Reviews.Title: “Borghese”
Reviews.Author: LawsonsScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and had a superb time,the hotel very well located for Spanish Steps and other tourist attractions.The hotel was very good and had a great view from lounge/terrace on top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Great View and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bmase58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Tucked around the corner from the top of the Spanish Steps this hotel gives you a little bit of everything. We walked or took the subway everywhere from here so the location couldn't have been better. The rooftop restaurant/bar has wonderful views and was an amazing place to enjoy a Cuban cigar looking out over at St Peter's dome and the rest of Rome. The food was good, the drinks were great and the views were amazing! (make sure you make a reservation for the outside tables if its good weather) The rooms are very well appointed and the bathroom was large and luxurious. One negative was the wifi worked okay but you have to manually switch it to the free one or they charge you $25 for a "high speed" connection, the front desk wasn't accommodating with my mistake and stuck me with the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to End Our Italian Holiday”
Reviews.Author: SharpLily
Reviews.Content: I lived in Bologna for a year in college and have made several trips to Rome since, but when planning our trip to Italy (my husband's first -- Rome, Florence, Venice, Bologna) I still did a huge amount of research for hotels. We stayed in two separate places book-ending the trip -- The Hotel Minerva (near the Pantheon -- also amazing) for the first 2 nights and the Sofitel Villa Borghese for the last 3. I honestly cannot say enough about it. The highlights: -Roomy (we're used to NYC standards), impeccably clean, comfortable room -Good-sized bathroom with huge tub (Hermes bath products!) -Amazingly friendly and helpful staff (we were welcomed with a bottle of Prosecco and a hand written note since it was our wedding anniversary) -Concierge was knowledgeable and made reservations for us at absolutely delicious restaurants in the neighborhood (we love good food :) -Daily breakfast spread (which was included in our rate, but may not always be, so check if you decide to book) was fantastic. The hotel is a teeny bit off the beaten path (especially from our perspective, having stayed at the Minerva right in the heart of the city earlier in the week) but it's definitely in walking distance to many restaurants, shops and the metro. Plus, as it's *right* on the park (Borghese), it's quiet. We really loved The Sofitel Villa Borghese and will absolutely stay again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: TRJRM
Reviews.Content: We were expecting more from our stay at Rome's Sofitel. We stayed for 4 nights while on a family vacation. We had to book 2 rooms and got rooms next door to each other. My children were in one room and we were in another. One of the rooms had a loud air conditioner noise that they could not fix right away so they gave us another room down the hall so my husband and one child had to sleep there which left me alone in my room...not ideal. The prices in the hotel restaurant/bar were ridiculous. We got back to the hotel late one night and the local bars were closed and we wanted gelato so we went to the hotel rooftop restaurant and even though it was not closed yet they obviously wanted us to take it back to our rooms to eat it which we did....it was over 60 euros for 5 small scoops of gelato. It was so overpriced. The concierge booked us a private tour of both the Roman Coluseum and the Vatican, one each day. On the second day, we had booked a 3 hour tour and after about 1.5 hours the tourguide told us that he had to leave after just 2 hours. We were not told by the Sofitel that the guide could only do 2 hours. Frustrating. The worst part of the stay was that they were doing painting in the area right outside our rooms. They got there early in the morning and the smell of paint was all in our room. Since we had our kids next door we were walking back and forth between the rooms and had to walk around scaffolding and paint buckets....totally unacceptable if you ask me. They should have painted areas that had vacancies or purposely not booked rooms near where they had to paint. We just felt that the hotel was not up to par at all. They did end up taking one night's stay off our bill b/c we had to leave our room that one night b/c the room was noisy. I would not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in quiet district”
Reviews.Author: Moveround
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Villa Borghese for 4 nights un June this year. I researched all the hotels we stayd at on Trip Adivsor and was very happy with this hotel. The taxi driver from the station to the hotel overcharged us badly and conceirge was most apologetic and very helpful with our luggage. This brightened our day. We had a late lunch in the Terrace restaurant and our waiter was most helpful. We also had dinner at La Terasse that evening. The view was incredible at sunset and we have many lovely photos of the Vatican etc. Breakfast was amazing, all anyone could ever desire. It was very hot while we were in rome and so we spent much time in our room which was not very large. I celebrated my 70th birthday while at the Sofitel and we had dinner that night at the Cafe de Paris in the via Veneto. The walk back up the hill from the Trevi Fountain and other attractions was steep but OK. We explored the lounge and other areas of this beautiful old world hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Binal4
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel welcome and were so helpful in planning an itinerary. Thanks to them we saw the whole of Rome within three days, at a leisurely pace, and walked to all the attractions, which was perfect. The hotel is situated near the Spanish Steps, and all the other attractions are in walking distance, if possible do walk around the city, you will discover so much more and appreciate all the sights, and the ice creams and coffee and snacks along the way! The hotel itself is well located, the staff are faultless and the rooms were good. Make a point to enjoy a sunset on the roof terrace, you get an amazing view of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeanneey
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome after a four nights stay at the Sofitel. It is a very nice hotel in a great location. It's only 30 minutes from the hussle and bussle of Piazza Navona (by foot) and it offers the most beautiful views over Rome from the top floor bar. We were lucky enough to have our room in the upper floor (6th) and the view from it was astonishing. The room is not very big but is nicely appointed with all the bits you expect from a 5 star hotel. Reception staff and breakfast staff were very professional and friendly. The breakfast is particularly good for Italy with a large choice of cold and hot dishes. One downside, the staff at the bar "The Boston" was very rude and not friendly at all. Altogether it was a lovely experience and we will definetely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: francesca9371
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, perfect location next to Villa Borgese (few minutes walking distance) and to the city Center (Piazza di Spagna). Wonderful staff, ready to take on every need and to help you out. Wonderful bar and terrace with a fresh and calm restaurant (the only weak point: not too much choice of specialities in the menu). Wonferful breakfast. The only missing atout is the pool, but maybe it will come :-))) I would definitely stay there again. It was our first trip with a baby (6 months old): we were offered a teddy bear and lots of amenities for our little one, so nice and touchy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: oanaatodiresei
Reviews.Content: lovely place to stay.The view from the lounge/bar (La Terasse) is excellent. The food is also good in La Terasse I would definitely return @ Sofitel Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, trad hotel in greast location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mcg1001
Reviews.Content: I like Sofitels as a chain and the Rome version is a good example. Well-situated (not far from the Villa Borghese and the Spanish Steps) the rooms are tastefully decorated with a hint of old world charm. Unfortunately half the rooms centre on an inner courtyard, but this is not uncommon in European cities. We stayed in a luxury room, which seemed to be twice as large as the standard rooms. It was extremely spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable. Free LAN Internet. Wi-Fi free for 24 hours. Beautiful marble bathroom. There was a problem with our room service order, but when reported it to the front desk, the order was quickly comped. There were a couple of small problems during the stay, but the staff promptly solved those that arose. The concierge was helpful in making dinner reservations (difficult in Rome in August!) The view from the lounge/bar (La Terasse) is excellent. The food is also good in La Terasse, we lunched there on our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but hotel's area and style not for us”
Reviews.Author: prettymongoose
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay for our family of three. We'd already stayed four days at Hotel Campo Di'Fiore (which we loved) and gone on a 7-day cruise before returning for a last night in Rome. From the outside, the hotel looks like an elegant palazzo. Inside, it's a blandly elegant hotel that could be in any mid- to large-size city. The positive: Our room was vast, beautiful, and quiet with an adjacent sitting room containing a daybed for our daughter. We even had a small balcony. The bathroom was luxurious and supplied with Hermes toiletries. The bed was decadently soft with pillows you'll want to smuggle home. And if you're a fan of muscular, American-style air conditioning, you'll be thrilled. Nowhere else in Rome did I feel that familiar blast of "at the mall" cold. The concierges were unfailingly polite and helpful. The negative: Let's talk about location. The neighborhood is quiet but it's quiet in a deserted kind of way. I got the feeling I was in a business area as there wasn't much in the way of food shops or even stores and restaurants. It's an easy walk to the Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, and the Corso but as I soon discovered, these are my least favorite parts of Rome. If congregating with throngs of your fellow tourists is your thing and posing with someone in a gladiator costume makes your day, you'll love the Spanish Steps. And if you can't wait to compare Rome's Hard Rock Cafe with the one back home, there's one on Via Veneto. On the Corso, you can even cruise all the same designer shops you know and love and discover that the exchange rate makes their prices even that much more expensive. Soak it all in over a "tourist menu" lunch at any one of the interchangeable cafes. Me? I'll be over in the Ghetto or Trastevere with the Romans. The breakfast buffet looked lovely but at 30E per person (that's $45 each), I wasn't buying. Drinks on the roof terrace were lovely but similarly priced. My daughter's pineapple juice was 8E ($12). At least was it fresh. Finally, when you want help from the concierge be prepared to wait, in person. During our visit, there was always a small crowd in front of the desk. If I called from our room, I got continuous busy signals. Summary: If you want charm, character, and an authentic immersion in Rome, stay elsewhere. (I recommend Hotel Campo Di'Fiore.) If you want your creature comforts and easy access to Prada, you could do worse than Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cadugan
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Villa Borgese is a really good hotel. The staff were always helpful and considerate. The room was small but perfectly adequate with everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel; it was clean, well tended and the turn down service was nice. The location was OK - it was a little walk from the major sites such as the Trevi Fountain or Piazza Navona, which wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't mostly uphill. There are a number of restaurants near the hotel, although be aware that those on Via Veneto are very expensive, even for Rome. Given this, I would still recommend this hotel, the room and the service were both great and it made for a very good stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with a perfect location....”
Reviews.Author: Jesupian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay near the Spanish Steps, and the Sofitel was a wonderful choice for relaxing after busy days of shopping and sightseeing . We enjoyed the relative quietness of the immediate area, while all the shopping and tourist sites were a short walk away. The staff was consistently warm and professional during our four day stay. The breakfast offered by the hotel was amazing, fresh squeezed juices and pressed coffees for starters, while the breakfast room staff were very accomodating and the service was perfect. We tried the brand new roof top restaurant/lounge for drinks in the evening, and the service was fine, a bit slow, but the views were spectacular. Loved our time there, and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days. We had two adjoining "family" rooms. The check in was easy despite a group of tourists checking in at the same time. The front desk was always helpful and their English was excellent. The rooms were great. The king size matress was so comfortable I'm considering buying one. The restaurant on the roof was excellent. If you're going to have dinner and watch the sun set, don't forget your sunglasses.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. Very helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms and a good location. I did find it to be a bit pricey however. The upstairs (La Terrace) restaurant has a phenomenal view - however the service was somewhat slow but still much better than any of the surrounding neighborhood restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Would gladly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dubbs605
Reviews.Content: Good location. Easy walk to via veneto and five minutes from the Spanish steps. 1st class service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkCarly
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Husband surprised me with a trip to Rome and this hotel made the trip even better than I could of imagined. Hotel location is perfect, in a quite little street which is perfect after a hectic day of sightseeing around Rome with the crowds! About a 5 minute walk to the Spanish steps and a 15-20 min walk to the Pantheon and Piazza Novona. Rome is a very easy city to walk around so we didnt use a taxi once during our stay, loved going back to this hotel after a day out. Roof terrace has amazing views over Rome - very expensive for a drink though - we paid 15 euros for two small diet cokes - but the whole terrace atmosphere and view is very beautiful. We had a deluxe room which was massive for a city hotel, huge bed which was very comfortable plus a little seating area and table and then a massive bathroom. the room was spotlessly clean, although was a little surprsied as there was some marks on the carpets/ the bathroom looked a little worn in places and for the class of hotel I didnt expect this.Also no tea/coffee making facilities in the room so every morning we had to order Room service for a tea and coffee. However do not let these minor points put you off. This is a very classy hotel overall, very classic Roman feel with a modern twist on decor which we really liked. Hermes toiletires in the bathroom and turn down service every evening offering fresh towels etc. We have stayed in some stunning hotels around the world and this hotel definately is up there with them. We didnt eat in the hotel, the restuarant was in the basement and did seem a bit dark and soul-less down there - but there are sooo many places to eat in Rome you will not starve! Overall if I went back to rome I would not hesitate to stay at this gorgeous hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Warning on this hotel's reservation policy!”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGoldie
Reviews.Content: All I can say is - what a disappointment! I've been fighting for my money for over 3 months. I wanted to simply reserve a room for August, not book, and guess what? They flat out charged me the full amount even though I cancelled my reservation! I never even authorized them to charge! Now I am in a huge dispute with my credit card, I've written to the headquarters in France, and I've even called Italy, and get the same run around. Such unhospitable behavior. And this claims to be 5-star. Hilarious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a short walk from some key tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: GoodServiceTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel, Rome for two nights. We found it was a nice way to get away from the noiseness of the hotels closer to attractions such as the Trevi Fountain. It was probably a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the Spanish Steps, we found with a good city map it was easy to get around. The rooms were a good size, air-conditioning was wonderful as temps were over 35C++ when we were there and the staff were very helpful with questions and recommendations for local restaurants and made reservations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not again!”
Reviews.Author: Nb22
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredibly small, its not even realistic. When traveling you are living out of a suitcase, when you spread your luggage out to remove items it'll occupy 99% of the room. It is very uncomfortable. Nothing special. I would not recommend, look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel. Great Service. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Vegas_OC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a wonderful trip to Italy. We stayed at three of the hotels recommended on TripAdvisor, so I wanted to make sure I gave some feedback to others. Rome -- We stayed at the Sofitel Villa Borghese. Beautiful hotel located right by the Spanish steps. This is definitely the high-end part of Rome with many other glamorous hotels and shopping areas located nearby. If I were to do it again, I probably would get something a little further south (near the Piazza Navonna, Pantheon, Coliseum, etc.) as this is where we spent most of our time. Not terrible, but it probably added 20 minutes to our walking time each way -- though perhaps not a bad way to burn off all of the calories from the pasta and gelato. The hotel was very nice. Rooms were reasonable. The bathroom was nice with Hermes toiletries. This hotel actually had excellent service. All of the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. One night my wife asked if there was a pharmacy nearby because she needed some medicine for the blisters we got, and they actually gave us some out for free. On another occasion, I asked for a wake-up call for an early flight. About 45 minutes after the call, I got a reminder call to ask if everything was OK and to let me know my taxi would be ready in a few minutes -- this was a pleasant surprise. They also exchanged $$$ for Euro at a rate that wasn't terrible compared to most places I found in the city. Not sure why the hotel only gets 4 stars. We stopped by the Eden for drinks and the Hassler for dinner, and I think the Sofitel was comparable. Perhaps the lobby wasn't as grand as some others. But all in all, I think a pretty nice place. The price was a bit expensive at 400 Euro / night, but I think that is typical for Europe. When in Rome make sure to hit Caffe Greco (by the Spanish steps) and Caffe San Eustachio (Pantheon) for coffee as well as Giolitti and Della Palma (just north of the Pantheon) for gelato. Also found a fantastic little restaurant between the Pantheon and the Piazza San Ignatio that is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “mold in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: cali4niaview
Reviews.Content: fine location but hotel in need of serious renovation for category. mold in the bathroom, carpets smelled, facing some trashbins (very limited views), generally cramped

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ru84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week for my partner's big birthday. The location is great, Rome is much smaller and easier to walk than I remembered. We could check in early and check out late. The room was fantastic - we were on the 6th floor, so we had a private terrace with a table and 2 chairs and a sofa. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop terrace on the 7th floor - dinner there was amazing but not cheap; but you can go there for drinks. We went there nearly every evening for cocktails as the sun went down over Rome. On Wednesday there was a DJ playing up there - really good. We wanted to go out for a plush dinner on the birthday evening, so we went to the other 5 stars - de Russie, Intercontinental, Hassler - to have a look at their rooftop/outdoor restaurants -which were not great. At least the Sofitel's is so that you can sit outside, not sit inside looking out. The other hotels were quite brash - lots of cabinets in the corridors selling glittering objects. The only slight downer is that no one wished my partner happy birthday! I ordered a birthday cake for dessert in the restaurant; a friend sent a bottle of prosecco to our room., but the hotel ignored it. I was in Hong Kong for my sister's 40th and the hotel gave her a bottle and cake. I just assumed that the Sofitel would be as attentive, especially as we are in their loyalty scheme. And there was a complicated way of getting wifi. But putting that aside, this is the only 5* hotel in Rome which we saw and liked.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been 5 stars, not 4”
Reviews.Author: WatsonsFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome, and a 5 night stay at Sofitel Villa Borghese. Situated 400 metres from the Spanish Steps in a quieter part of Rome - and this is a good thing, as Rome can be full-on, manic and very tiring. The Hotel is expensive, but very glamorous: while when we were visiting it had a fantastic exhibition of Patrizia Savarese art in the lobby. A real treat. The staff were extremely helpful and polite throughout, arranging guides etc for the excursions we wanted to take (Vatican etc). Our room (314) was very tastefully done, had Hermes accessories in the bathroom and was well appointed. The bed was huge, easily 7 feet wide, and as comfortable as it is possible to get. Luxury. Room could have done with a kettle and coffee ( I always say that, everywhere I go) but overall, we loved the room. The one negative, and for us it was a biggie, was that we had booked for dinner on our arrival, for our last evening, in the Hotels Terrace restaurant (which had a magnificent view). We'd asked specifically to be outside, on the terrace, as the dinner was for our 'silver wedding anniversary' and we felt it would be more 'romantic'. 7.30pm was our preferred time. Arriving at the restaurant at 7.25pm we were told that a Japanese party of about 15 had checked in that day and that they had booked for a party/get together, on the terrace: So we now had to wait until they had finished around 8.30 ish. Abruptly, we were TOLD that someone had rang our room at 4pm that day, but that we weren't in so it was our fault for not being updated. (Yes, we were in Rome, on holiday - we were out sightseeing, surprise surprise!!). But, dont let this incident put you off. The hotel is a class act, in general, and though pricey, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a great start to our holiday.....”
Reviews.Author: Iluv2travel2011
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Italy in May 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel. The room was spacious with a little outside balcony. The staff were so helpful, anytime we wanted advice or directions they were very accomodating. Luigi was our favourite, each day he greeted us with a big smile and reminded us to beware of pick pockets with our bags secured in front of us. It is just around the corner from the Villa Borghese park, we hired a little four person bike and rode around the park laughing and joking along the way. There a restaurants and shops nearby and you can walk anywhere as it is a central location. It was probably more expensive than a lot of hotels but certainly worth it for our experience!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Yet”
Reviews.Author: lsl135
Reviews.Content: The final leg of our second trip to France and Italy was topped off by the excellence of the Rome Sofitel Hotel near the Gardens. A genuinely courteous, friendly and professional staff that provided impeccable service from the door man to the front desk to the turn down service. The room was incomparable, exquisitley appointed and very large by any standards. The location was perfect for touring, especially for walkers. I would compare this hotel to the George V in Paris as far as qaulity of service and overall ambience, just not as big and less eating options. The hotel was a memorable part of our visit to the Etenal City. Will definitely stay here again on next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, will certainly be back!”
Reviews.Author: KushLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in Mid June with family- Room- I booked a Luxury room and it was fabulous! spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast was fabulous, the best breakfast I've had in my years of staying in hotels in Europe. Everything was fresh and mostly organic. However, 30 Euros per person is still very expensive. 20 Euros would be more reasonable. Location- The hotel is 5 mins away from the Spanish steps so that was great. We walked a lot in Rome and found the hotel to be very well located Staff- The staff were excellent. Antonio was very helpful and was always there to greet us. Luigi was also lovely and always gave us tips on how much we should pay for a taxi to the Vatican, Airport etc and would speak to the driver to ensure we would not be overcharged which was very nice of him. The receptionists were also very helpful, giving us some great recommendations for restaurants. p.s I highly recommend a restaurant called Peppone which is only 5 mins from the hotel on Via Emilia was yummy home style Italian food. We loved Rome and the hotel was the made our visit even better!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotell
Reviews.Content: Albeit a bit expensive but worth the money. The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were gorgeous and classy. I am hard to please and have high standards and this hotel met my expectations. The location is ideal as the hotel is within a couple minutes walking distance from the spanish steps. Infact, I didn't have to take cabs and was able to walk to most of the restaurants. So I give this hotel a 5 star rating as far as class and location.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like royality!”
Reviews.Author: Pammiebug
Reviews.Content: The people at the Sofitel are so nice! As two women traveling alone we were put at ease by the kid glove care we received from the staff. We were also impressed by how well everyone spoke English, Italian, French and German. The staff seemed genuinely concerned that every need was met and every question was answered. Luigi always made sure our purses were zipped up and properly secured across our bodies. Our room was comfortably furnished, with more room than one usually finds in European hotels. The hotel is located on a quiet street within walking distance of shopping and excellent restaurants. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: jkb66
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Roma Villa Borghese hit the mark on nearly all accounts. We booked this hotel nearly six months in advance after a reasonable amount of research. As a result of the early booking, we got a pretty good rate compared to other similar hotels in the area. We were a bit worried it wouldn't be up to standard but we were relieved it was everything we were looking for. The room was above average size for Rome/Europe and was very clean and well appointed. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. As others have mentioned the rooftop bar has a tremendous view of the city and is a great place to relax on a nice evening. We chose not to include breakfast with our room as it seemed overpriced and we were glad we made that decision. There were plenty of good options for a quick breakfast (which is all we were looking for) on any of the nearby streets. The location of the Sofitel was great -- less that 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps and in a very nice neighborhood near the Via Veneto. The hotel was very quiet and we never felt unsafe or uncomfortable. Overall we couldn't have been happier with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDTripper32
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Sofitel. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but a tad small.
