The room size was not terrible because we were hardly ever in our room and taking in the sights of Rome. The bed was very comfortable. The rooftop bar was very romantic at sunset and had lovely views. The hotel location was fantastic. It is a 7 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and right next to the Borghese gardens. We walked everywhere so location was very important to us and it was nice not to have to pay the elevated prices for hotels located at the Spanish Steps. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The doorman was especially nice as there was a transportation strike on one day of our trip and he went above and beyond to get us a cab so we would not miss our tour of the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: richlester
Reviews.Content: just 1 block from fabulous shopping on via veneto,2 blocks from the massive and beautiful villa borghese,4 blocks from the spanish steps in a neighborhood chock full of unbelievable restaurants(most not heavy tourist places!!).the hotel rooms are spacious and luxurious and the staff super friendly and helpful(i got a great pasta carbonara recipe).close to many desirable destinations yet on a nice,quiet little street. great family or romantic destination.and the breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved Sofitel Roma”
Reviews.Author: Doratheexplorer41
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous trip to Rome, Italy. We stayed at the Sofitel in Rome, our third Sofitel(Sofitel in Rio and Sofitel in Lisbon), by far the best so far. Great central location, beautiful hotel with top of the line staff, friendly, warm, and very professional and fluent in English, especially the front desk staff of Angelo, Annalisa, William(in Spanish), and Luca. Lovely rooms with great housekeeping service. Chose to take our meals outside the hotel with plenty of cafes and ristorantes close by and less expensive. Hotel pricey but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Obturator
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance to Piazza de Spagna and the Villa Borghese, the Sofitel offers impeccable service with a boutique-hotel style experience. The rooms are on the small side, but they’re well appointed and comfortable. There’s free wifi, which is a huge plus while traveling. If you’re not planning on spending too much time in your room, then it’s the perfect place to stay at to recharge your batteries at night after a long day of walking around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service ruins my stay...I found out about a taxi strike tomorrow by accident...no help at hand.”
Reviews.Author: Gullo1
Reviews.Content: Tomorrow there will be a Taxi Strike. I am leaving for Florence and expected to take a cab to Termini. I asked about alternatives and they suggested a $100 US private car...for a $10 cab ride. When I asked whether they would proactively provide shuttle service for customers they shrugged and said "no, nothing we can do". Basically inferring stuff happens and they could care less about their guests. I will be schlepping my bags about 15 blocks to the Metro since I refuse to pay robbery rates for a 10 minute ride to Termini. This lack of initiative on the part of Hotel Management will certainly lose them many customers tomorrow when the rest of the folks checking out find no Taxi's and no service alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations dashed”
Reviews.Author: GabbyinDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had such high hopes for this hotel and we were at first not disappointed. Our room was clean and spacious with a gorgeous view of the Vatican. The concierge and doormen were all extremely helpful. When I made a comment about how wonderful our room was, the man who showed us to it said something to the effect of "ma'am, please, this is the Sofitel!" as if he could not fathom my surprise! But then, on our third day, I made the mistake of leaving out a pair of earrings on the desk. They were not even remotely expensive but they were one-of-kind and had extreme sentimental value to me. Upon our return to the room that afternoon I made a beeline to the desk and they were indeed gone. I looked high and low and told myself that of course I could be crazy and perhaps I had misplaced them. But my husband had confirmed that he too had see the earrings out before we left and thought about putting them in the safe and had gotten distracted. And we were even leaving the cleaning staff monetary tips every day! Suffice it to say I was heartbroken but my husband has worked in the hotel business before and told me that it was basically my word against the staff's and that I had no recourse even if I did complain. I decided to let it go and chalk it up to my own stupidity for leaving them out in the first place. But then, after checking out from the hotel and returning home to America after continuing our tour in southern Italy, my husband discovered that the Sofitel had charged his credit card TWICE for our stay - once at the beginning when we checked in, and once at the end when we left. They had both posted to his account and were not holds. My husband called and was given the run-around by every single person he spoke to and was basically told he was lying and that they did not double charge and that he had to prove it. He is now going through his bank to have them deal with the Sofitel and get our money back. I am outraged that a hotel that counts itself as being a luxury establishment, would treat its patrons so poorly once they had departed. The rates here are not cheap and it's a large amount of money that we are still in the process of getting returned to us. Based on this, I would defintely NOT recommend the Sofitel and when my husband and I return the beautiful city of Rome in a couple years, I will most definitely NOT be rebooking here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay---will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: AlaShug
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel overlooking Borghese Gardens, just a few minutes' walk from the Spanish Steps. Excellent service. Rooftop restaurant overlooking the city with especially nice views of St. Peters. High-speed internet free in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: MrsWalsh06
Reviews.Content: Very good location Excellent, clean rooms Luxurious, fluffy beds Pleasant staff (although the front desk did argue with us about whether or not their driver was at the airport -- HE WASN'T) Breakfast was good but the price was too high -- breakfast staff was lovely Glorious view of the city and Vatican from the rooftop bar Every other hotel we stayed at in Italy was a let down after staying at the Sofitel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Brief but good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very quick overnight stay while transiting. Staff were prfessional and efficient. Breakfast of a high standard. Rooms very clean (if a fraction too pink) and loved the Hermes bathroom products. Room had no view. However as my stay was so brief, it's not really a complaint as I was provided with a good size room. Wifi access not immediately apparent and implied you had to pay (whereas less expensive hotels have this readily available for 6 hours free per day). Found there was some limited free access, but think this should have been clearer to guests - esp at a high-end hotel. Couldn't work out how to get regular TV channels wto work, but didn't spend ages trying to work it out either. All up would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - location has issues”
Reviews.Author: abrama1
Reviews.Content: We stayed with colleagues for a few days in May 2011. The location of the hotel near to the famous Spanish steps is great (when going down) but remember (as one reviewer has commented) you would need to tackle in the evening. For this reason not really suitable for disabled, very young or elderly people - unless of course you can take a cab each time. Speaking of cabs they don't freely roam (no pun intended) as they do in New York, London or Paris for easy hailing. The main reason for this review is to make guests aware that there is a scam going around on the same road as this hotel whereby a con artist claims to ask for directions - then moves away - whereby two accomplices dressed in blue uniform come out flashing Police ID cards and asking for you to turn out your pockets in order to divest you of your money insisting the previous person is a known drug dealer. Thankfully they didn't take any from us but afterward discovered this has happened to previous guests who were not so lucky and had money taken from them. These artists are known to the hotel and the police but no warning is issued from the hotel. - So here's your warning.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Rome without a Doubt!”
Reviews.Author: marlowstevens
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel from the incredibly friendly and helpful staff, to the incredible room and comfort. The food was excellent. This hotel is without doubt the best in Rome...at any price.

Reviews.Title: “May Visit to Roma”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was very good. Generally, the hotel was clean. The room did need some repairs in the bathroom and the room could have been vacuumed better. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Loved the olive bread.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,great location, very nice rooms. QUIET area.”
Reviews.Author: coldupnorth48
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of days here, post cruise. Great staff, friendly and helpful. Room was what we ordered ( Superior ( larger) and very quiet. ) No view from the room, but it was more imp. for us to have it quiet. Older bldg with classical,traditional styling but all updated finishings and fixtures. Everything worked well, except they use the typical partial wall in shower and the water goes on the floor. Why is this so popular in Europe??? Shower curtains would even be better. But nice rainshower head and also a hand-held. Very accommodating staff. Didn't eat here, but several restaurants and cafes very close-by and much cheaper than the close-by Via Veneto area. Had drinks in the roof-top bar. VERY pricey, but the view is lovely. Don't miss the nearby Borghese Gallery, but get reservations first! Hotel is in perfect location, near all the "Must-Do's". No ice machines,but free bottled water. Comfy beds, with nice linens and feather tops. Not hard, like many in Europe. We used the Rome Limosine Plus service from the port and our driver , Pietro ,was simply great! Gave us info and was a very good driver. Also had him take us to airport. Prices were very reasonable, esp. from the port. We saved a lot and would definitely recommend them for transportation . www.romelimosineplus.com ( Discount for Trip-Advisor members.)

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value for money”
Reviews.Author: cdn07
Reviews.Content: Well located near the Spanish Steps and 10 minutes from most of the highlights. Large room for European standards, clean and with good sound isolation. Service was perfect, specially the concierge and Primo who was very attentive of our needs. Two remarks: overpriced breakfast, 25 euros per adult is very expensive and secondly why do the Hermes soaps disappear after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “My earrings got stolen”
Reviews.Author: gommina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good, on a perfect location, within walking distance from the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese and Via Veneto. The rooms are spacious enough and the bed very comfortable. Bathroom needs updating, though, my bathtub was quite old. Breakfast excellent and the staff there extremely kind. One major complaint: I had a pair of gold earrings that were stolen from my room. The room does have a safe and I had put the rest of my jewelry there. Right before going out I realized I had left this pair of earrings on my nightstand. I remember thinking "this is not the kind of hotel where things get stolen" so I just left them there. But guess what? When I came back the earrings were gone. I reported it to the reception, they made some efforts trying to find them, but of course they didn't. I appreciated their efforts, but I was very disappointed as this is not the kind of thing you would expect in a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsshaw
Reviews.Content: We visited the Villa Borghese for a New Year's break. We arrived on New Year's Eve and stayed 4 nights. The first impression was of a traditional, grand yet modern, and attractive hotel. Despite being part of a chain, the hotel combined individual service, Roman style and, almost always, friendly efficiency. The hotel is ideally located to the north of the City Centre, just off the Via Veneto (which we soon realised is rather overpriced and touristy compared to the rest of the city). It's also just next to the Villa Borghese park. You can walk easily around the city from the hotel, and you are about ten minutes away from a metro stop. The building is lovely, a wedge shaped late 19th century former apartment block, and the lobby and staircase are lovely and classically decorated. The Christmas decorations were tasteful and very artistic, it's clear that the hotel management go to great lengths to get the look and feel of the hotel right. I would say the average clientele are fashionable and cultured thirtysomething European couples, yet the hotel isn't that expensive despite being in such a prime location. It's also quite unpretentious, and the service is personal and excellent. We asked the concierge to organise a restaurant on New Year's Eve, and over the course of several email exchanged prior to our arrival he booked is into a local, traditional restaurant. He also gave us excellent recommendations for the nights we were in the hotel, as well as advice about what sites to visit. I suppose this is pretty much what you would expect from a 5* hotel, but the phrase 'nothing was too much trouble' is appropriate. The room was well equipped, with a lovely bathroom, classical decor and a huge and comfortable bed. There are no real negatives, on New Year's Eve itself, the hotel wanted to charge us 60 Euros each to go onto their roof terrace to watch the fireworks- the roof terrace is awesome and has a panaromic view of Rome. We thought this was a bit much, given we were guests of the hotel, but as every seasoned traveller knows, all hotels will seek to maximise their revenue on special occasions and public holidays. However, the organisation of this was chaotic, and they forgot to offer the champagne and canapes promised. They did, however, quickly agree to forget about this cover charge. On another occasion the terrace was booked for a private function, and rather than turning us away the barman gave us free drinks in apology for the fact we couldn't go onto the terrace, not that we wanted to on a January night, we were more than happy on the comfy sofas, I think this attitude sums up what the staff are like here, they will do their utmost to make you, their guests, happy. I think we'd definitely consider this hotel again if we were returning to Rome, and perhaps we would consider another Sofitel if this hotel is representative of their brand. Overall, this is a really lovely hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “top service”
Reviews.Author: sjk49 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: facilities were excellent, service was first class and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. we wished we had stayed with Sofitel on our previous visit to Rome. truly first class! theonly criticism we could find was that the room was a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PHF2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Sofitel Villa Borghese for the 2nd time and would come back any time if our finance allows... The rooms are not huge, but we don't mind the size as long as all other things are OK. The bed (queen) was spacious and comfortable (my husband is almots 2m tall and we had so much room), room service was very friendly, reception staff helpful and accommodating, we slept very well as it is very quiet. We changed hotels after an awful experience in another place and the Sofitel staff did everything they could to get us checked-in as early as possible. This is the second time we stay here and both times they recommended and booked restaurants for us that were excellent, but not too expensive. The location is great, walking distance to Spanish stairs, Villa Borghese, historic center and more. The bathroom had a bathtub, not curtain, but a glass protection. This was the only thing that did not meet the quality standard. The protection was not insulated properly and water was leaking down to the bathroom floor from the shower. This had two effects: 1. The outside wood of the bathtub got rotten and developed mould and 2. the bathroom floor was flooded every time you took a shower - no matter how careful you were. The room was cleaned twice per day though and the towels were replaced in the late afternoon so that we always had a dry bathroom floor and fresh towels the next day. The breakfast is a bit pricy and not included, but all 5-star hotels I have stayed in so far were similar. We had our breakfast in the room the first day, but on the 2nd day we decided to use the buffet. The buffet has a huge variety of choice and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travellingfamily5
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Sofitel in September of 2010, travelling with four girlfriends. Last time I was in Rome I stayed closer to the Forum and this time wanted to be closer to shopping and restaurants. Beside looking for location I also wanted a 5 star hotel (which I thought would at least guarantee that the hotel would be compatable with a North American 4 star - which was true). I also wanted comfortable beds since the last hotel I stayed in Rome while lovely had very uncomfortable beds. I found it all at the Sofitel Roma Villa Borghese. The location was great, just a few blocks away from the Spanish Steps, we were able to walk comfortably to the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. We took a taxi to the Forum/Coliseum but ended up walking back. The hotel rooms were large including the bathroom, we had two rooms one standard for two people and a superior for three people. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms that we stayed in did not have alot of natural light but didn't matter much because we were only in the rooms at night. Breakfast was fine, lots of choice. The rooftop restaurant/bar had just been renovated and was beautiful. We had drinks two nights and ate dinner there one night. There were some minor service issues at the restautant but probably because it had just reopened and seemed to have new staff. We enjoyed the view but dinner was extremelyy expensive but we splurged. Overall a good experience at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, stylish, comfortable and good food.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Spock_NCC1701
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days at a business meeting. I'd echo other reviews - the restaurant has great views, the table service is excellent and the food tasty (although there was rather too much at our set meals!). The bed was great, not too soft or hard, the room had a quality TV and a Bose iPod dock. The dock was a boon - I could listen to my home radio station via the free wifi and use my regular alarm! It's those home comforts that make business travel bearable. There is a choice between rate-limited wifi at 256K and paid wifi at about 2Mb. Our meeting room had the fast wifi thrown in, which was useful. The meeting room was good, with a good choice of coffees and teas and a decent projector. No issues there at all. If I was being picky, I'd say that I would have liked in-room coffee making facilities, the smoke alarms in the rooms have flashing LEDs which kept me awake for a bit, and the shower could use descaling (but was otherwise fine). That IS being picky though. Location is great but I didn't get much chance for sightseeing. I'd go back for a holiday there quite happily.

Reviews.Title: “Totally positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Doobie95
Reviews.Content: Moderately sized room. Great bathroom and bath amentities (Hermes). Excellent service and friendly staff. Catching cab from main strip not too problematic. Walking distance to metro, American Embassy, & lots of moderate to high priced restaurants/bars (including Harry's). No negatives to note about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice for future trips to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Porthos77
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very friendly especially by Rome standards. The hotel room was large, and the bed was very comfortable, again, especially considering Rome and European standards. The concierge was very helpful in booking all our dinner reservations, spoke much better English than I spoke Italian, and made the stay very pleasant. I'm going back to Rome in May and can't imagine staying anywhere else. Not a bad value if you compare it to the other hotels in the area. The view from the hotel rooftop at night is breathtaking. It is close to the Spanish steps but pretty far from everything else. It didn't prevent me or my 62 year old mother from walking to and from the Vatican or to and from Campo di Fiore though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful luxurious hotel in fab location!!! - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MauritianTraveller
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go to Rome for Valentines weekend and stayed here at the Sofitel. Firstly from the airport (Fiumincino) it is quite far out and I would NOT recommend taking the train and metro as we did which took 2 hours and a lot of effort...it is better to just take a shuttle for about 35 euros for 2 people from the airport (train is 14 euros per person and metro 1 euro). The hotel was breathtaking on arrival and we were greeted with amazing service. We were given a map and all the sights explained, restaurants recommended and a card with the address of the hotel. It is located in a quiet road near Via Veneto (an area of expensive restaurants) with sights such as the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps nearby. The room is lovely, smells gorgeous and has all needs met including little things like toiletries, shower caps, hair dryer etc and also every evening we were given delicious little chocolates. The bed is huge and so so comfy!! The terrace bar on the roof has a gorgeous view but be warned it is pricey with 2 drinks costing 20-30 euros. In Rome everything is pretty pricey we found. The sights can all be done by walking to them using the map. I would recommend a tour for colosseum+palatine hill (20 euros per person inc admission fee), tour of vatican city (35/40 euros per person inc admission fee), seeing the trevi fountain by day and night, relaxing with a drink in the piazza navona or pantheon, and generally walking around. Food places I recommend are MoMo restaurant in Trastevere - brilliant pizzas and yummy desserts and very good prices, Gusto in Piazza Augusto - again great pizzas and lasagna and San Crispino ice cream place near trevi fountain. Loved this hotel and loved Rome....would recommend it all!!! P.s. Dont buy your souvenirs like limoncello, wine or pastas in Rome.,...its much cheaper in Duty Free and also wide variety

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; would stay again”
Reviews.Author: beatarmy81
Reviews.Content: We reserved a ’luxury’ king room, non-smoking and it was exactly that. Very nice and clean. End room with nice view to Villa Bourghese. The bed was huge and very comfortable. Towels, robes, slippers, etc. all top rate. Everyone very friendly and helpful. The sitting chairs in the room aren’t very comfortable though. Food and drink are pretty expensive - but so is Rome in general, particularly if you are from the U.S. with the exchange rate. My advice is to ’get over it’ if you are going to Rome and enjoy this fabulous city to the limit. Have drinks at sunset on the roof bar - a must if the weather’s nice. The hotel s within comfortable walking distance of all major central Rome site. One day we took the Metro to Circus Maximus and spent the day strolling, shopping, eating, and drinking vino back to Sofitel, stopping at many sites and piazzas. Probably about a 5 - 6 km day, which was just wonderful. I would definitely stay at the Sofitel again, and highly recommend it. One note: We did the Rome in One Day tour and cannot recommend it. The morning tour guide was not good (afternoon was excellent), and the included lunch was the worst meal we had during our 5 days in Rome. Just a poor value. Book a personalized tour through the hotel concierge when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location and very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: JLHS15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, clean and in a great location. You can walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. The rooms have wonderful decorations, are spacious and the balcony was great! Would highly recommend the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Classy.”
Reviews.Author: PLHsu
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cozy, charming and relaxing place to unwind after a crazy shopping day in Rome or a very challenging walk around museums, Sofitel Roma Villa Borghese is your home away from home. Priceless location, very well decorated room, very kind staff and delicious restaurants. I hope I will have the chance to come back during spring/summer to check the amazing rooftop terrace!

Reviews.Title: “if you enjoy breakfasts with a magnificent view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at walking distance from Trinità dei Monti. Go down the stairs and in a few minutes you are in the main shopping area of Rome. Via del Babbuino and fabulous antique shops are also at walking distance. The hotel is nice and clean, rooms are quiet, a bit small but very comfortable. Mine had a nice view on Villa Borghese. The hotel terrace is stunning: you can have a great breakfast and enjoy one of the best views of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding way to visit Roma - no shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Camesawleft
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located just out of the busy centre, but very handy too many big sights (Trevi, Spanish steps etc). The hotel staff upgraded us to a very nice room looking over the adjacent gardens, beautiful style, classy finish. They even put Prosecco in the room to welcome us, probably as it was our honeymoon. We've kept the welcome postcard that the manager handwrote! Friendly staff, some good restaurant tips, bus tours etc. Classy but not stuffy. Views from the restaurant/bar were fantastic. If I had to pick a fault, I'd say the breakfast is a little overpriced, and then they even wanted to charge additional for an omelette - which I then declined. Don't think there was a gym, which would have bugged me if I'd had the time and inclination to do a workout. But that's it - no real drama. We had no complaints, and we thought the hotel did more than enough to ensure we'd stay there again. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and excellent service from a wonderful staff makes this a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NanaJ0
Reviews.Content: There are not enough words to describe the excellent and wonderful staff at this very elegant and gracious hotel. This was my first trip to Rome, #1 on my Bucket List and the experience was made spectacular by the hotel staff! I came down with Bronchitis during my stay and the generous and concerned Concierge, Angelo and other front desk staff were very helpful and called a doctor for me. I was able to enjoy Rome and Florence due to their quick response for my care. Plus, the rooms were lovely and the beds very comfortable. My daughter and I enjoyed our view from our room and the spectacular breakfast buffet. They even brought it up to our room one day when I was feeling worse than normal and did not charge us room service. The view from the rooftop restaurant is spectacular, especially in the evening as the sun is setting. Did I say spectacular again? How else to describe it? Not enough words in any language to describe it! Thank you Angelo, Mario, Primo and all others for your wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “I can't say how nice this stay was in one sentence.”
Reviews.Author: 4stars1959
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have chosen a better place to stay for our first visit to Italy and first stay in Rome. All the staff were fluent in English and went out of their way to make our stay very memorable. The hotel is within walking distance to many major attractions. I don't have any negative comments and plan to go back again. I'd recommend the hotel to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “I have a stiff neck from thier sloped mattress”
Reviews.Author: Dina33
Reviews.Content: The first day I arrived the hand towel had a hair around it, soap bar out of the box had something brown on it, the bathroom wood was water damaged and ugly to look at and the mattress was sloped it felt like I'll be falling off during my sleep. I told the reception they sent me the housekeeper to have a look, but nothing was done except they sent me some apology letter with some chocolate which is not enough. They should've either changed my room or my mattress at the very least. I have told everyone who asked me to stir away from this hotel I DO NOT RECOMMEND it. Plus the shabby wall decor and moldings. I did not expect that from a Sofitel hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's not worth the view.”
Reviews.Author: Dean080
Reviews.Content: There is a good view from the retaurant on the top floor,but the food is very poor .We had arrived in rome that evening and wanted something to eat ,tried the hotel restaurant ordered the steak medium rare it came 45 mins later the steak was cremated. should have known something was wrong as we the only ones there. The steak was 34 euros to my shame I didn't send it back as I didn't want to wait another 45 mins. The hotel itself was pretty good and in a good spot. There are lots of really good restaurants in rome ,try those instead of the one at the hotel. Life restaurant near the spanish steps is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jakeiszues
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a business meeting. most notable is the available and helpful staff. The rooms are typical size for Europe but very nicely decorated and exceptionally clean. The bathroom was a nice size, modern but had a few minor cosmetic issues. The breakfast buffet was nice. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Powers17
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel straight from the airport around 9am (overnight flight in from NYC). Of course we did not expect a room to be available to check into so early, so we left to explore the streets. When we came back around noon, a room was in fact ready for us, which was really nice given how exhausted we were from the flight. The customer service continued to impress us; we received a lot of sight-seeing recommendations and restaurant recommmendations from the front desk. The lobby is stunning, and our room was beautiful, exactly what you see in the pictures on the website. Very classy hotel. Unfortunately breakfast was not included in our basic room rate, as it was in the other hotels we stayed at during our Italy trip. The wifi in the room was not free, but there is free internet access in the business center. In terms of location, the Sofitel is in a fancier neighborhood, a lot of restaurants within a few blocks, and about a 10-15 minute walk to see the sights (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, piazzas, etc), with a small hill on the way back. There were a lot of hotels that were closer/on top of the famous sites and squares; if you prefer not to walk then skip the Sofitel, but if you want some luxury and don't mind the walk, this is a great choice for hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karmaplus_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 5 days and had a beautiful room and excellent service from all staff. I cannot say enough about this excellent hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on the 6th floor....don't stay here at all”
Reviews.Author: ItalyTrip2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of a 5 week journey around Italy. We were really looking forward to a little luxury and some rest. Other reviews talk about having a wonderful time drinking in the roof top bar. Unfortunately for us we were staying in a room right underneath. We were unable to fall asleep thanks to the noise from tables and chairs scraping on the ceiling above us. I had to keep calling reception night after night to get some relief. Looking back now, I should have requested we move rooms but the thought of packing and moving room one more time seemed overwhelming. I would have expected the hotel to try and make amends but nothing was mentioned about the inconvience even we we checked out. We were not offered a room change, a complementary breakfast or even a drink. A true disinterest in the comfort of their guests. Also worth mentioning that the curtains in our room were removed the second day of our stay. What was that about??? This stay ended up being a huge disappointment. It will be hard for us not to hold it against the Softiel brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: JDUAlberta
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel that is in a quiet location only 2 blocks from the Via Veneto. I stayed there for a week and absolutely loved it. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious by Rome standards with beautiful traditional decor but good amenities like a flat screen TV. The rooftop restaurant and lower level breakfast restaurants are a little pricey but the food is excellent. The view from the rooftop terrace is just beautiful. The staff are great. For example, I needed breakfast in my room at 6 AM on two days and breakfast service starts at 6:30. No problem! The concierge just alerted the kitchen and my breakfast arrived promptly at 6 AM. The only limitation was that they could not provide a cooked breakfast at that time. I also got great recommendations for local restaurants. For me, it was worth every penny and I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel worth the money Rooftop Restaurant the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amelia03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at this lovely hotel. It is worth the money especially when we have the spectacular view from the rooftop restaurant and bar. We had dinner twice in the restaurant and the food was great. The cocktails were to die for despite being a little pricey but worth it. Our room, the basic delux room with 2 beds together was fine, we have a lovely view from the window onto a busy street but we could live with that. The only downside to the room was that we have an interconnecting room which was locked at the time, however, we could hear the people next door drying their hair etc waking us up at 6am!!. Overall the staff were very good, the room was always cleaned when we returned. We would definately return to the hotel and recommend it to others too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff! My new favourite place in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Swissdiver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel on a week-end. The hotel being fully booked, I had to use my A-Club privilege to get a room. They delivered, without charging the rack-rate which is appreciable and appreciated. Hotel is located in the heart of Roma, minutes from the Spanish Steps and the Via Venetto. Check-in was quick and efficient. We were given a room (no upgrade, but again, hotel was fully booked) with a view on the neighbouring park. As often in Roma, the room was not that big and without coffee/tea facilities. But it was nicely decorated and the bathroom was big enough, with nice amenities. Good bed and good sleep. The roof top is a must visit place, the view over Roma being phenomenal. You can have their a full meal or just a drink. Staff was great at all level. In short, my new best place in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: CPIIIShasta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel three days prior to our Italy Cruise and I have to say that it was one of the better hotels that we have stayed in Italy. We had a room with a king size bed and it was very large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Olympicchampion
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights with my girl friend at the hotel Sofitel Roma Villa Borghese. In comparaison with the other Sofitel hotels we know was this stay rather disappointing. Nothing negative to say about the location, very close to the center in a quiet area, or about the cleanliness. The room was well decoreted but very small, the bathroom tiny. The breakfast was very poor, with artificial fruit juices and an indecent quality of the "fresh" fruit. Impossible to eat at the restaurant on the top floor, it's far too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel that really added to our Rome experience”
Reviews.Author: Athrawes58
Reviews.Content: The hotel is between the Spamish Steps and the Via Veneto but is in a quiet street by the park. The rooms and service were excellent-we felt very well looked after! The rooftop bar was wonderful with views to the Vatican, and the breakfast buffet was the best we've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Hartzwin
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very cozy, very clean with excellent decor. The service was very good and the staff went out of their way to be helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal hotel in a great area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TitusPicasso
Reviews.Content: In a city full of hotels, I would highly recommend the Sofitel. The hotel was clean with a bright and helpful staff. The location was ideal, a short walk from the Spanish Steps and in a neighbourhood with some good restaurants. The area is very quiet. There is a stunning, outdoor rooftop bar/restaurant with amazing sunset views. At night they light it up with candles. It's really beautiful. We only had drinks but the food we saw being served looked quite good. The breakfast buffet is expensive but it's an incredible spread. We ate there just once and it was a real treat. Other breakfast options are available locally. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDscot
Reviews.Content: Good service & location,excellent room and friendly staff only complaints breakfast not included and no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service seems to be the rule here...”
Reviews.Author: WilliamDunn01
Reviews.Content: We were a family with a pre-teen boy 13, check in was poor. No welcome, only was asked for passports and credit card upon arrival. Bellman was acting overly exhausted from delivering bags to room I believed that was his way of trying to get a healthy tip. I told him that if your this tired from carring bags you may want to look at a different job. The room was small but expected as is the case in europe hotels, but nicely furnished and clean. We stayed 3 nights and houskeeping was very poor even though we left 5 euros daily in the hope of getting better service but no chance. We had to ask multipule times for extra towels as every time you take a shower it floods the floor. Also amenities were never refreshed soap, water etc. The front desk was absolutly hopeless when it came to reccomendations for dinner or entertainment in the area, was a struggle to get one reccomendation for dinner. As an American you come to expect a certin level of service when your paying 5 star prices at a 5 star rated hotel, this was not the case at all. Also if you are planning a trip to Rome, be prepard to get ripped off at every turn. It was such a shame to end a 3 week vacation in Italy in Rome. The countryside towns are great and the people are fair and honest, not the case in any of the big cities ie; Florence, Rome and Venise. I'll give you a few examples, the cab ride from the train station meter stated 13 Euros when paying was told 23 euros, at dinner everytime there were items at prices that were not posted on the menu, ie; my son ordered a Coke and they charged us 10 Euros for it and when I was reccomended a dish from the menu by the waiter they tried to charge me for the most expensive dish that I never had. It was so bad in the cities that I vowed to never visit a major city in Italy again which is a real shame as the natural beauty and history is amazing. The people really ruined a great trip due to greed.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel near the Via Venito”
Reviews.Author: jawjahboy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a nice, quiet, clean room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location near the Via Venito is great. Good restaurants and plenty of shopping abound in the area. The Spanish Steps and the Piazza Barberini are both within a reasonable walk. All in all, we had a very pleasant experience at this hotel and feel it was well worth the extra bucks as compared to what other hotels would have cost. If you are in the mood to upgrade, this hotel would be well worth serious consideration. Also, if you go, don't miss the view from the rooftop bar, especially at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been fine except for combo of difficult location and unctious doorman”
Reviews.Author: rosi68 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really quite a lovely hotel with very nice rooms and professional staff with one exception. Rooftop dining was a real treat for both food and view. Never quite figured out why casual bar and restaurant were oddly shuttered with no explanation. Because of the hotel's location, the front door personnel was crucial. Unfortunately, the gentleman was a self important, finger wagging, caricature of a doorman. I dreaded each time we had to approach him for a taxi. Although I tipped him appropriately, though reluctantly each time, he felt it necessary to open the trunk of the car I had ordered for our airport ride, to show me how nicely luggage was stowed. For the first time in my life I ignored a hotel employee, leaving his open palm empty. Oh, and one more thing, don't bring your Ipad. No wireless available.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: RiodeJaneiroduque
Reviews.Content: Been at Sofitel Vila Borghese for 4 nightas, septtember, 11 till 14. Excellent hotel, with great restaurant at 7th floor. We strongly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jssp
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Great views from our room 2. Comfy beds 3. We were afraid that the bathroom would be tiny, but were happy that this was up to par 4. Close to Hertz - as we had to return car and wanted to be close to hotel 5. Could walk to some sights - spanish steps/trevi fountain/villa borghese 6. Close enough to the subway 7. Roof top bar 8. We were able to walk from Colosseum to the hotel, it is a good 20 odd minutes walk Cons: 1. Restaurants around neighborhood were not that great 2. Terrible room service food Note: If you need a taxi, walk up to Via Veneto - about 1/4 mile away and get it from there. If you request hotel to fetch you a cab, the meter starts ticking from the time the taxi is called from taxi stand.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromCT5259
Reviews.Content: After two weeks of traveling through Europe our last stop was Sofitel Rome. We were surprised with a free room upgrade. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room very clean. We never saw the cleaning staff but every time we left the room we came back to fresh towels, turned down bed, Italian cookie on our pillows. The hotel very close to Spanish steps an walking distance to the metro Barberini stop. We loved the roof top terrace with views of the vatican. Only downside, opposite side of city from Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Shoreliner93
Reviews.Content: Our room was located in a neighboorhood with a number of office buildings etc. but was an easy walk to the Spanish Steps. Nicely appointed hotel and room. Comfortable beds. Though common in Europe, our room was a bit small. The bathroom had one of the half shower doors, so we had a few floods. Staff were friendly and helpful but formal for Italy. Breakfast was way overpriced, so we opted for a coffee shop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “You can not find a better hotel than this”
Reviews.Author: violets7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing-staff, food, view, rooms-everything! The staff was so helpful and kind. The rooms were luxurious and no detail was overlooked. The restaurant was magical. It was a bit chilly and the beautiful hostess came over and wrapped me in this cozy wrap-pure perfection. The beds were so comfortable, and the location was fantastic (moments away from the Borghese gardens, spanish steps etc). I would stay here again in a heartbeat or any other sofitel now.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, quiet evenings”
Reviews.Author: ImAtTheBeach27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Rome Sofitel for one week at the end of August/beginning of September 2010 and we thought it was great! We found the staff to be helpful and friendly throughout our stay. The room wasn't at all large but a decent size for the two of us. Evenings were very quiet so we were able to get a good night's rest. The rooftop bar was expensive (18 euro for one drink) but we treated ourselves one night because of the great views. Overall, I don't think I would call this a 5 star hotel but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay overall, but one little problem”
Reviews.Author: Prozach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Villa Borghese for five nights at the beginning of September 2010. The hotel is located at the southern edge of Villa Borghese. The location is very convenient to Gelleria Borghese (7 minute walk) and to the Spanish steps (7 minute walk), where there is also a Metro station. Given that all the major attractions in Rome are quite close, you can reach most of them in a pleasant walk. If you prefer taxi rides, those are relatively cheap from this location(max 11 euros) to any major attraction. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Analisa and Rosanna helped us with reservations to dinners. Mario and Luigi at the front door were always helpful. Our room was on the small side in US terms, but reasonable in European standards. The beds were clean and the room was refreshed in the evening. The one problem in the room was the bathroom. While the bathroom was clean, one of the wood panels was rotten and hollow. Some flying bugs were coming out of it. Not good. The hotel staff did take care of the problem promptly, but they sprayed the room with some foul odor that had to be vented out. I would expect such problems to be taken care of way ahead of guests' complaints. So, that was the only bad mark to all the other good marks for the hotel. One final thing is that they, like others, charge exorbitant amount for Internet (15 euro for wired in room-service). They do have a free access to the business center for casual e-mail checking.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Papimorenito501
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Rome for one night after coming back from Venice. We wanted to end out little Eurotrip on a high note and the Sofitel didn’t disappoint. The room was amazing. We definitely felt that were in a 5 star hotel. From the welcome message on the Flat screen, to the Hermes toiletries, we were not disappointed. The hotel is about a 10 min walk to the Spanish Steps and luxury shopping and dining nearby. It’s a walkable distance to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon. You would also be able to reach the Piazza Navona and Vatican from here on foot (we did), but you likely are better off taking a metro or two or one of those hop and off buses! We ended our stay with good food and an amazing view from the restaurant/lounge on the roof! Don't miss the view, if only for a glass of wine. Luxury hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Limo Service like being in Formula one car”
Reviews.Author: Dogsey
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at Weston Hotels but we stayed at Sofitel everything was great. We always use Limo services from and to Hotels. The one provided by Sofitel ruined our stay to the fact my wife was crying after nearly the second accident, driver said he didnt speak english evenutally slowed down but was doing 110kh in 60kh zone and nearly hit two cars will never stay at Sofitel . Sofitel need to look at this service. We left at 9 pm 30th August our room No was 223 as I said staff and hotel were great but the life of my wife and myself are very important and it wasnt to the driver he thought it was funny and laughed at us, then later tried to say sorry with fairly good english. We would rather pay more for better service, we never have this problenm at Weston Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Service second to none”
Reviews.Author: Ferarri945
Reviews.Content: The service received was excellent and was five star from the concierge to the restaurant. I speak French and English and a little Italian but they looked after me like a king. What more can I say than superb.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Friendly Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Shaggz411
Reviews.Content: Our Background: Young married couple (late 20s) that enjoys travelling well. Spent 3 nights in Rome. Our Goals: Price Range – 200-250 euros/night. Conveniently located to historical sites. Hotel Strengths: Fairly priced, attractive interior, clean rooms, comfortable beds, good location (Spanish Steps), very insightful and pleasant staff, free internet in business center, rooftop bar Hotel Weaknesses: Located at top of steep hill, no free wifi (that said, free wifi is tough to find in Rome) Other hotels to consider: St. George Roma, Exedra, Hotel Raphael, Grand Hotel de la Minerve Comments: My wife and I had a positive experience at the Sofitel. Based on simply observing the outside of hotels in Rome, most appear small and in need of upgrades. While not 5 stars by U.S. standards, the Sofitel is a full service hotel that is likely more luxurious that most Rome hotels. The prices were competitive at ~225 euros/night for a deluxe room (in late July). The staff was extremely pleasant, helpful and could hold a conversation in English. They were also helpful in providing tips on how to beat the crowds, providing restaurant and shopping recommendations, travel tips, and also in suggesting locals-focused entertainment. The hotel also has an attractive, but overpriced rooftop bar. The Sofitel is located a few blocks north of the Spanish Steps. The Spanish Steps are a popular tourist site and near high-end shopping. It is a short taxi ride from many other tourist sites and near public transportation. The hotel specifically is located at the top of a hill though and it can be quite exhausting to climb the hill after a long day. We found ourselves taking a taxi back to the hotel every time after our initial trek up the hill. A comparable priced hotel with similar amenities located near the Pantheon or Piazza Navona, the center of the most popular tourist attractions and a flat area, would probably be a better choice, but overall you can’t go wrong with the Sofitel. Quick Rome Highlights: Sightseeing – 1) Vatican Museums and St. Peter’s Basilica (Reserve a tour, will save you hours of waiting in line and is insightful), 2) Pantheon, 3) Trevi Fountain, 4) Colosseum. Restaurants – 1) La Palazzeto near Spanish Steps, 2) Pierluigi near Campo de Fiori. Nightlife: Anywhere in Trastavere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- not Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: jscottd
Reviews.Content: This hotel enjoys an excellent location within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps. The staff is friendly and professional. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Here are a few observations. 1: No complementary coffee. 2: No help with attractions or entertainment events. 3: You must ask for a non-smoking room. 4: The rooftop is small with a poor view. 5: No gym/spa. 6: Only two computers for internet use. 7: The lobby is old and dated with a bland style. Overall, this is a nice hotel in a wonderful location but this is not a Five Star property. The best I can give this hotel is four stars. However, I would note that Rome hotels in general are not to the same level as NYC or London. You will enjoy this property, but do not expect a Five Star/ World Class hotel. Don’t bring travelers checks because the exchange merchants in Rome will rip you off. Best to use your credit card with a 0 fee exchange commission. Check your credit card rules before coming. In Italy - NEVER buy anything without asking the price first.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room with a great balcony and view.”
Reviews.Author: ProvidencialesTCI
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the end of July. Had a room on the 6th floor (612 to be exact). Great view and very spacious room, especially by European standards. The rooftop bar is very nice as well, although like most things in Rome, outrageously priced. Worth a spurge at least once though. Location is excellent as everything is within walking distance, but it should be noted that by walking distance, I mean relatively long walks. If you've brought your walking shoes and you don't mind working up a sweat in the July sun, you'll be ok. Overall, we would recommend this hotel, especially for the price, which it appears like most places, is heavily discounted due to the economy. BTW, you can park your car out front for free on Sundays, and other days, street parking is far cheaper than using the valet, which cost 40-55 Euros per day. Not sure why the range in price was given.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel just across Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: jorgecapirone
Reviews.Content: A few blocks from Piazza Spagna and the famous Piazza di Spagna stairs, this Sofitel is just the place to be in Rome. The staff is friendly and internationally trained. You can easily walk to Via dei Codotti, the world known Caffe Greco and Piazza del Poppolo. Most luxury shops are located on Via Margutta, where you can shóp at ease. The hotel features a beautiful terrace on top of the building from where you can easily view most of the city. Villa Borghese gardens are just across the street. Ideal location and great service too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Great location, staff and rooms. Very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: SMac64
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Luxurious lobby and rooms. Rooms large, great beds, good air conditioning, large bathroom, high celings, clean and updated. Top notch. Nice rooftop lounge overlooking the city. Neighborhood is very nice and high end, just next to the Villa Borghese. 5-10 min walk to spanish steps, 15 min to Trevi Fountain, 20-25 min to Pizza Navona. Easy to use as a hub for tourist Rom. Good places to eat in neighborhood, but tend to be more pricey. Staff is very friendly and very knowledgeable. They did screw up my car pick up at Roma Termini, but apologized and gave a large discount for transporation to the airport at the end of my trip and went out of their way to be helpful to us all week. Great choice for Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: VibeManager
Reviews.Content: Found this place on Trip Advisor and just got back home to the U.S. Beautiful rooms, excellent service and wonderful espresso! The rooftop restaurant is a dream. The only bad thing that happened is that Italy lost the World Cup while we were there (but that's not the hotel's fault, right?).

Reviews.Title: “This is not the Sofitel you're used to in America or Canada. There is no concierge.”
Reviews.Author: pinkyBrattleboro
Reviews.Content: This is not the Sofitel one is used to staying at in America or Canada. There is no concierge. If you ask them at the desk about certain main attractions they will either ask the doorman or try to look it up on line. I asked for the manager at one point and I was told he is on vacation and there is no one to replace him..only the front desk people. They gave me a room that had a broken air conditioner, promised to fix it and of course never did. I returned a week later for one night before my flight back to the states and they gave me the same lousy room with the broken AC again which they claimed was fixed but was not fixed. They told me they were booked and I would have to keep this room. The rooms are very clean and the location is good. It is a 5 minute walk to the beautiful spanish steps.They never told me that there is a full breakfast being served on the lower floor level. I only knew about the terrace cafe. If you need any guidance in Rome don't depend on Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay here - no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: kgm610
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Rome was fantastic. I travel frequently and stay at top-notch hotels. This property exceeded my expectations. The air conditioning was great, the beds incredibly comfortable and the shower was perfect (these three things are always important to me in a hotel). A variety of restaurants are nearby, and the location was away from the crowds of tourists and in a very nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KellyVolFan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, just a block from tour bus drop off point, a short walk to the Spagna or Bernini metro station and a stone's throw from the best breakfast place in Rome - La Fraize. We stayed in this hotel for a week and were delighted with the hotel staff, the location and the room. The room was large by European standards and we were in a superior twin. The beds were pushed next to each other to create a king size and were very comfortable. We also controlled our own air conditioning which was great. It was nice to come back to a chilled room after seeing the sights all day. The front desk staff were great and Mario helped us navigate all the nuances of the city from the Roma pass, to directions to the metro, what to wear to the Vatican and scheduling a car for us to the airport upon our departure. Also, the rooftop bar was finally opened after being renovated for months and it was a hot spot for the entire area. The hotel just a few blocks from Via Veneto which offered great shopping and the Hard Rock Cafe. I will return to this hotel if and when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with prime location; great service, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: billfisher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Borghese for 3 nights. Found the room to be excellent and staff was attentive to all our needs/ The concierges were able to answer any and all questions and make good suggestions for guides and spas. Easy walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and Pantheon. Just off Via Veneto.// Incredibly comfortable bed, fantastic linens and a spacious well-equipped bathroom helped to make a nice place to stay. A nice breakfast was made better by an attentive staff. The view of the Borghese Park greenery from the room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, really nice”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithfirstborn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the internet on their special advance purchase rate knowing from previous experience that you usually get what you pay for in Rome. After a long flight from Australia we wanted somewhere really nice to stay in Rome so we could get a few good nights rest before heading off touring. The Sofitel was perfect. The location could not have been better, even the walk up the hill was enjoyable and the proximity to Via Veneto and the surrounds was great. We ended up returning to the Sofitel at the end of our trip as well and then had to extend our stay due to the delays caused by the volcano! In all we experienced three different rooms in this lovely hotel and they were all beautiful. Although the first one didn't have much of a view it was absolutely huge and very quiet - perfect for us. On our return 2 weeks later we had a massive room with a balcony and a lovely outlook and on our third try we stayed in a standard room which had a spectacular view over the city. All the rooms were lovely and certainly worth the money you spend. The staff were also fantastic in helping us arrange some tours and also trying to find out information about our travel disruption. We would certainly return to the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Bed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dkehan
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a wonderful hotel in the heart of Rome. The service was above and beyond, the staff was so friendly!!!! The best bed we ever slept in while in Italy, so soft and so many pillows! Very Classy decor with a nice size room and you can control your own AC. Loved our stay and would stay again if we revisit Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned charm and great location”
Reviews.Author: Trisha21
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed that the roof garden is being reconstructed. The corner room we had was beautiful and so was the view over the Borghese Garden. We did not like the fact that there was no closet for our luggage. Breakfasts were ample and we had lunch in the dining room that was excellent. The bar is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kareem-shalaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my last trip to Rome, I was staying there with my wife during our first trip to Italy and this is a summary for my experience there: Pros.: Location is great the hotel is very near to most of the city attractions like:spanish steps, quadro fontane, vatican city and two underground stations in addition to two car rental agencies. The hotel is in "via lombardia" which is a very quiet street and luckily there are a lot of parking spaces available especially in the evening " a very important thing if you're hiring a car in the very congested Rome. The rooms are clean, cozy and quiet. The staff is friendly. Room service is OK. Cons: Compared to hotels where I'm living "Dubai"; this hotel would definitely get a 4 star rating not a "5 stars" one, its not that luxorious hotel. Wall papers are old and decoration in general is a little bit "sad". Business centre is very poor; two PCs with a very slow internet connection. To summarise; Sofitelvilla borghese is a nice combination of location, value for money, comfort stay and nice staff

Reviews.Title: “trip of a lifetime with my son”
Reviews.Author: makers33
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Hotel in Rome was a terrific place to stay on our trip to Rome. The staff was great. An especially nice person was the doorman, Ezio deLuca. He helped us out a lot. He was very kind. It was a great hotel. a nice place to come back to after touring around the city. very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quiet, good sized rooms, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: BlasGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April 2010. Rooms are good size for Rome with good sized bathrooms and huge comfortable beds. Staff were all extremely welcoming and helpful. Food is pretty expensive but there are plenty of restaurants close buy though these part of Rome is not cheap. Location is good 5 mins to Spanish Steps, and 10-15 mins to historic centre.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: steady
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just stayed here over Easter weekend for 4 nights. We arrived early in the morning and they had the rooms available. We received a wonderful friendly greeting from the front desk. They gave us maps and were helpful with directions, to book tours, etc. We had two rooms and they were lovely-spacious, clean, and quiet. Sofitel Roma is located off a quiet side street, near Villla Borghese, 5 minutes to Spanish Steps, and close to Via Veneto. It had a lovely lobby, soothing music, plenty of places to sit with a drink, read, or catch up with others. We slept with the windows open-it was pretty quiet until I heard some church bells and birds singing. The beds were comfortable, windows were double-glazed, bathroom was great (except tub was a little deep, bit tricky to get out of). We had breakfast twice - great quality, choice, staff serving very professional and friendly. We had a package deal (for families: pay for one room, second is half-off, and children eat breakfast for free) Upon leaving Sofitel, we rented a car at Europcar (through Auto Europe)-great experience too) and it is only a block away and easy exit out of Rome. But the highlight of the Sofitel, for me, as well as my children, was the kindness and friendliness of Ezio (doorman) and Luigi (Bellman, I guess) Loved seeing their smiling faces in the morning and Ezio always had a couple of tips for us on how to do Rome well - (what bus to take, trick to avoid lines at a sight, etc.) When my children were talking about what they liked best about our trip to Italy, these were the things that made the list: hiking up Mt. Vesuvius, gondola ride in Venice, St. Peter's Basilica, and EZIO! Believe it or not. Highly recommend Sofitel, would definitely stay there again for quiet, location, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: GrlNxtDr
Reviews.Content: This is a typical roman hotel which means threadbare carpets, smelly smoky room, chipped and cracked furniture, no gym, no room service along with noisy construction going on during the day..... thankfully the company was paying for this dump. Most disappointing was the rooftop bar La Bella Vista was closed until the summer months even though it was brilliant spring weather.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernSoutherner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in March. The hotel is on a quiet street off Via Veneto and about 5 minutes walk (downhill) to the top of the Spanish Steps. The public areas of the hotel are top quality and the staff are all attentive, helpful and friendly. We were greeted at the hotel by the staff who had obvbiously been made aware on the booking that this was our honeymoon and they offered congratulations. There was a card and bottle of Prosecco waiting for us in our room from the manager which was a lovely touch. Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the Borghese Gardens and was furnished to a high standard. The only criticism of the room is that there were no tea and coffee making facilities. On arrival there was a small bottle of water in the room, but this was never replaced after the first day. Toiletries were also not replaced during our stay, but as they hadn't run out this wasn't really a problem - it just seemed unusual that a 5* hotel wouldn't replace any used items daily. The bar and restaurant are fiercely expensive but this is to be expected of an establishment such as this in Rome. We ordered room service one night and the presentation and food were very good, although not worth the high price tag! Breakfast was a continental and "American" buffet. The choice was good but at 32 euro per person it was hugely overpriced. Luckily, we had booked a package including breakfast otherwise we would have eaten somewhere else! There is a room where guests are able to use the internet free for 1 hour each day - a code must be obtained from reception. This was very convenient and another nice touch. The only reason I have given the hotel 4 out of 5 is that the roof terrace was closed during our stay (and will be until late April). I had read a previous TA review hinting at this and emailed the hotel for confirmation. I never received a reply. There was a sign in the hotel lift informing of the closure which was very disappointing. The terrace had been one of the reasons we chose to book Sofitel so felt a bit cheated. Overall the hotel is a classy establishment on the outskirts of the city. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it but be prepared to pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and top service to sleep. Teh dorman Ezio”
Reviews.Author: Filipe_Marta
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to Rome for a 2nd honneymoon and we stayed at Sofitel Roma Villa Borghese. I was going for a 4* but then upgraded for a top rated hotel that was up to the occasion! The service is top, even the fact of not having the bedroom ready when we arrived (it was 11:30 a.m.) had the attention of offering exquisit cocktails that are really a must. The door man Ezio is really a great value of the Hotel. Always nice and with really valuable tips: just ask him for info before going anywhere to eat or to visit! We felt the hotel is not in the "hot" times. That is good if you want quiet nights but for example the terrace was not working. The feeling is that we did not take the full advantage of being in such a goog hotel. Breakfast is very good and complete, but with nothing out of the regular buffet meals. The room was very good, although not as spacious as a room of the same value in the Venetian in Las Vegas, for example that has the same service and commoditied but 3x more space. The bed is really good for top sleep! So, top location, top team specially the door man Ezio, but would like to have felt more on a 5* hotel, maybe some innovation in services or something trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheCassman
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying three nights and my wife and I had a fantastic stay at the Sofitel. The room was great, the bed huge and very comfy, the bathroom was big and very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel. You can walk to the Spanish steps easliy from the Hotel and from there you are on your way into Rome. Plenty of restaurants nearby too. Shame the terrace was closed for rennovation when we were there, but I hope to go back again soon when it has reopened.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with bad air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Donaldswim
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent hotel in a good central location. However we stayed over a couple of warm days in late February and our room was unbearable hot. The air conditioning didn't work and it I was told it was because the system is set to provide heating only in the winter months. I'm not sure if this is correct. I don't really care why the air conditioning didn't work. This just isn't acceptable for a 4 start hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view but slightly expensive and not very central.”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: We are frequently using Sofitel and this particular property has a bit lower value for money ration than the other one, probably due to Rome's crazy prices in general. The view on Villa Borghese and the Vatican was astonishing and the room was rococo which is an original touch, but a bit tired. Location is unfortunately a bit far from the points of interest and you have to walk quite a lot to go to points of interest. Overall, beautiful view but a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fabulous view of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DelmarvaTripper
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, small hotel, tucked away at the end of a quiet side street but only minutes from the main road, Via Veneto. The rooms are tastefully decorated and in excellent condition. The service is wonderful, room service is quick, and the front desk very helpful. But the best part of this hotel is its rooftop restaurant with a panoramic view of Rome. A gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: bertie
Reviews.Content: We love Sofitel Hotels but this is the first time we have stayed in the Sofitel Rome. We were really disappointed. The room was very tired and in dire need of refurbishment. The shower was horrendous and squirted all over the bathroom floor making it very slippy. The bath taps didn't work so had to use the shower to fill the bath. The room was pokey with us falling over one another! Our son had a separate sleeping area which helped but it was a pretty awful drab room. The staff were friendly, the location good, but the hotel lacked atmosphere with only the terrace bar and restaurant open. We wouldn't go back to this hotel if staying in Rome again, but it hasn't put us off Sofitels!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother Staying Here Unless you want to get ripped off”
Reviews.Author: New_Yorker_65
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Italy. My wife had reserved a room at a four star hotel that was a bit further away from Via Veneto. It was Christmas, I wanted us to stay at a nice place - so I canceled the hotel my wife booked and made a reservation at the Sofitel. I am familiar with Sofitel and Novotel Hotels, I thought this would be a real treat for my wife. What a mistake that turned out to be! The check-in was great, people were very friendly and we were shown to our room. The room we stayed was decorated nicely, and had a balcony with a nice view. But I am someone who spends numerous nights a year at luxury hotels, including Sofitel hotels - I immediately noticed what was missing at this hotel. No wireless connection in the room, no iron, no teapot so that you can boil water. I thought it was ridiculous that a five star hotel did not have any gym! Breakfast cost somewhere along the line of 30 Euro. We had Hermes toiletries in our room which was replaced by some cheaper alternatives on the second day. The highlight of stay (?) came about the last night of our four night stay. We asked the concirege to recommend a good Italian restaurant to have our last dinner in Rome. The friendly concierge made reservation at a restaurant near Novena Square and wrote down the address on a piece of paper for us. When our taxe dropped us off at a dark deserted alley few minutes later, we found the restaurant to be CLOSED! There we were, standing the dark with our two year old on a stroller. I used my roaming cell phone to call the hotel. The concierge said to me, "sorry about that. But there are many restaurants nearby, we should be able to find one that you like" Frankly, I was taken aback by his response. Luckily we ended up at a great local place called Monte Carlo which saved the night. Just when my wife and reached the conclusion that hotels in Italy were probably similar to what we had just experienced, the next hotel we checked in in Florence changed that impression. Four star, but absolutely superb in what amenities that had, how we were treated, etc. But that is another review. We are not budget travellers. Among many hotels that I have stayed at, Sofitel Rome was by far the worst value I have ever experienced in a five star hotel - I thought they were so keen on making the next dollar (or euro) that they lost touch totally on how to serve customers well. Sofitel Luxembourg is one of my favourite hotels; not cheap, but they deliver. They lset us use the minibar for free, replenished it daily, and discounted our breakfasts as we were hotel guests. We felt valued. After getting used to high quality service at Starwood, Marriott and even at other Accor hotels, I thought Sofitel would compare with a Park Hyatt or a St. Regis. This visit changed that perception. I will not stay at a another Accor (Sofitel's parent group) hotel as a protest, and will encourage my colleagues to stay somewhere wwhen they travel. When I spend the money at stay at a luxury hotel, I want to feel "spolied", not feel that I am getting ripped off at every turn I make! And there are plenty of good hotels out there beside Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SeemaWorldwide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. On arrival Luigi the doorman/bell boy was extremely friendly showing us all the amenities of our room and hints and tips to get around Rome. We were lucky enough to get a room with a small balcony and we had a view over looking villa borghese. The bedroom was large enough to accomodate our 2 suitcases. The bathroom had large fluffy towels and dressing gowns and slippers were provided. We didnt' experience any problem with the shower. The reception staff assisted us to book a table at a restaurant and were always welcoming. Internet access is provided for free for 1 hour in the business centre but this is a bit slow. The rooftop bar was not open when we were there but it was free to go up and have a look at the views from the 7th floor. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are many restaurants within walking distance. Although the hotel is on top of a small hill we didn't find it difficult to walk to the major sites and back again. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds, Great Staff, Delicious Breakfast, Awful Showers”
Reviews.Author: ddemaagd
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Sofitel in Rome. The hotel is beautiful, but a bit far from the metros and main sites. The rooms are nice with high ceilings and incredible beds. The staff were all amazingly helpful and kind. Certainly a plus for the hotel. Breakfast was very good each morning. The only downside of the hotel was the showers. We had a group of 6 and 3 rooms. Each room had the same problem, water pours all over the floor when trying to shower. I'm not sure what the deal is with glass partitions that only cover about 1/3 of the shower, but they sure are annoying. After a long day of site seeing it'd be nice to take a shower and not have to worry about water pouring all over the floors. We solved the problem by putting 2 or 3 towels right outside the shower to sop up most of the water that leaks out from under the partition because of faulty seals and around it b/c the partition is so small. The leaking shower also lead to quite a bit of mildew/mold in the shower area... Other than the shower fiasco and the fact that the temp control didn't work, the hotel is great and I'd recommend it for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does everything right!”
Reviews.Author: flights
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, we were upgraded to a suite, so this made our stay even better, but Sofitel Roma is a wonderful, upscale hotel. Staff (including room service) was very friendly and helpful; everyone we talked to was fluent in English. The beds were very comfortable, great bath and amenities (replenished daily), and quiet rooms. The hotel is on a quiet street, (we felt safe walking to restaurants at night), but well within walking distance (we're in our 60's) to the Spanish Steps, the Piazza del Popolo, Borghese gardens, and fantastic shopping. A taxi (we used a guide) would probably be needed to get to ancient Roman sites and the Vatican. My only caution is that there is no breakfast/lunch restaurant (but room service is available for these meals), and the rooftop dinner restaurant has a limited menu, although it is a great place for late afternoon/early evening drinks with a view! Internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our Honeymoon... Excellent Service !!!”
Reviews.Author: cocco89
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon with a 3 night stay at the Sofitel Roma. From the time we arrived, we received nothing but the best service. Everyone working there was very friendly and helpful. We reserved a Deluxe corner room through Expedia and were able to lock in a very reasonable rate that included breakfast.
