Our room was very large and had partial city views through the 3 large windows. The bathroom was huge and the upgraded bath products added to our experience. The location cannot be beat. It is only two block off of the via Veneto and a 5 min. walk to the Spanish Steps. Walking to most areas of the city, including the Vatican, was not a problem for us. If you are looking for a great romantic hotel, this is the place to stay. Just for reference, we have been to Rome many times and stayed at different hotels. We also stayed at the Rome Cavalieri (Waldorf) on this last trip and will be going back to the Sofitel on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: ibreak4coffee
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. From start to finish, the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is minutes away from the Barberini and Spagna subway stops and an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain or the Spanish Steps. As mentioned in other reviews, however, the walk back to the hotel is uphill. I didnt try the restaurants or eat breakfast as the costs were very high. There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel but most of them are overpriced. The rooms were small but the bed was great and the the bathroom very nice as well. My only complaint during the stay was that the rooftop bar was closed. It would have been helpful on their website to advertise the fact that the bar was closed as it was a major reason I chose this hotel. Other chains - like Marriott - are more upfront about these types of closures and I was disappointed to say the least when I arrived to find out it was closed (and it wasn't even cold - couldnt they have closed it in January!). Regardless, the hotel is up to Sofitel standards and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at the Sofitel......”
Reviews.Author: Mille_9
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on the Sofitels website giving us 3 nights for the price of 2, buffet breakfast and a late checkout...What a deal. I immediately made a booking looking forward to finishing our Italy holiday in style! And we were not disappointed. We were presented with a gorgeous room on level 6 with an amazing view over the Villa Borghese gardens....a great way to start the day looking over the green of the gardens to the sites of Rome beyond! The room was beautifully decorated and the bed really sensational...the best I have ever slept on and I had the best sleeps of all my time in Italy. The bathroom was great with a lovely tub and fabuluous rainhead shower where you dial up the temperature you require. Hermes products were replenished each day by the cleaning staff who were super efficient. The room was cleaned each day whilst we were at breakfast - lovely to come back to a tidy room! The breakfasts in the basement were really a highlight and a fantstic way to energise for the day. Everyting you could want really, coffee made to order, juices, cereals, pastries galore, smoked salmon, cold meats, wonderful breads and eggs cooked to order. The concierge staff were very helpful, particularly the man at the front door who had wonderful suggestions for our sightseeing. The location of the hotel is great (only 5 minutes downhill to the Spanish Steps) although a bit of an uphill walk from the centre at the end of a long day. If you have time spend a few hours in the adjacent Villa Borghese Gardens and walk to the lookout over Roma - fantastic. The sights of Rome are too many to mention. Our highlight was the Collessum and Palatine Hill - an amazing experience on a warm November day. We also bought the tourist bus pass (red bus 15 euro 24 hr or 20 euro 48 hr) which was a great way to explore the city and also do the loop at night to see all the sights illuminated. Enjoy your stay at the beautiful Sofitel...you will not be disappointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome bed.”
Reviews.Author: CatViccer
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after a week in Positano. Room was quite small, but super-comfy bed, nice amenities. Shower was awesome, great pressure and rainshower showerhead. The rooftop bar has THE best views of Rome and the adjacent Villa Borghese gardens, the service was a little slow and they had the bill wrong (although the corrected it). Nice balcony view over the gardens. Great location, in walking distance to most of the sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - but expensive and breakfast was not incld and costly”
Reviews.Author: mroadster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of a wonderful 3 week trip to Italy. The hotel was beautiful, the room great, the service fantastic. The location is a little far from spanish steps, long walk downhill (which meant uphill back). Every city and hotel we stayed in had breakfast included, and we were told at checkin to "enjoy the breakfast buffet" downstairs every morning. We did, but upon checkout were told it was $25 EU each! When we told them it was included, they stated it was not. Our travel agent was shocked as well as she thought it was included, as it was in all the other cities. The hotel was also the most expensive one we stayed in so the breakfast issue was really a shocker. There are other hotels in Rome just as nice with breakfast included, especially at 300 EU plus a night!

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: LKW9
Reviews.Content: My husband took me for a 2 night surprise stay to celebrate a 'big' Birthday. This hotel was a dream from start to finish. The welcome from the front of house team was spectacular - warm, friendly and genuine. The suite (702) was amazing - grand yet cosy, with its own private terrace with stunning views of Rome. The rooftop bar is like a film set, we watched incredible sunsets over St Peters and watched the flocks of starlings perform firework-like flight patterns on the horizon. Minutes away from the Spanish steps this is also a perfect base for exploring the magical city. I had thought the Eden was the 'place to stay' - however it is now going to be the Sofitel Villa Borghese every time. Really delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and close to the Spanish Steps though pricey”
Reviews.Author: jharrisfosf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night in Rome - then moved to the Daphne Inn because the price was almost twice as much here but we could not get a room the first night at Daphne. Sofitel was nice, but a bit pricey for what it offered. Service was very good, the bed was wonderful - concierge was quite helpful. Sent us to a great little restaurant nearby for dinner (down near the wall by the Borghese but I cannot remember the name) And Cafe de Paris on Via Veneto is a must - great coffee and pastries and sandwiches

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michelebo
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel The bed dreamy, the bathroom sparkling with a tub and rainshower. Our TV didnt work on the first night and they gave us another room to watch tv in and then went back to our corner room to bed! Didn't eat there we were out and about touring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal attention”
Reviews.Author: ferdia35
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, which far outshone our previous stay at the St Regis. The rooms were compact but very comfortable. Room service is very limited later in the evening (after 22:00) so do eat ahead if arriving late. Staff are charming, and the hotel is intimate enough to feel part of it in no time, and all are eager to help with travel arrangements. Locationwise, it's not far from the Spanish Step (from the top, just a few blocks), and there's a lovely pizzeria around the corner from the hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: FLclwr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights based on reviews from tripadvisor. It was excellent, very professional staff, they helped us organize our tours etc. We could see vatican city from our room. The roof top cafe has an awesome view of the city. If EDIZO the doorman (I hope I got that right) gives you tips on how to get to the best sightseeing places in Rome...take them! He told us where to get no line tickets to the coliseum and other sites. He speaks several languages, very cool guy. Tell him we said hi :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Service”
Reviews.Author: gregnazvanov
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, attentive staff, massive room. The highlight was the fact they take special orders for french champagne and sweets from family, and deliever to the room as a surprise. Great relaxing setting to lay back and stretch legs after extensive sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, large rooms, great experience”
Reviews.Author: KandRArlingtonCville
Reviews.Content: Overview Stayed four nights in a deluxe room at the Sofitel Villa Borghese in Rome, Italy. Room was spacious, containing a king size bed, sitting area, desk, and large bathroom. Hotel is two-three city blocks from the top of the Spanish Steps, across the street from Villa Borghese (Rome's largest park), and the Spagna metro stop. Highly recommended for a traveler who wants a hotel that is in a quiet, but convenient, location. We'd rate the hotel 5/5 and would happily return if we went back to Rome. Location Great location on a side street, which is both quiet and safe. If you turn left out of the hotel you can walk to the Spagna metro and the Spanish Steps, if you turn right, there is a shopping mall that also has a small grocery store inside. Highly recommended for the location alone, as the hotel is near everything you need while in Rome. 45 minutes away from the Leonardo Da Vinci Fiumicino Airport. A cab from the hotel costs 45 euro. Note - while we took a shuttle from the airport, the "meeting point" in the FCO airport is a mess. If we did it again, we'd skip the shuttle and take a cab, it's well worth it. Room Very spacious and comfortable room. Bed was up to the Sofitel standard, which is to say extremely comfortable. Turndown service at night. Service Everyone was very nice, courteous, and helpful. Almost everyone spoke English. Restaurant Didn't use it. Notes We really enjoyed all of the gelaterias Rome had to offer and visited six - Giolotti, Gelateria del Teatro, Della Parma, San Crispino, and a few others. While it's close, Giolotti was the best. Their servings are the biggest, they give you panna (whipped cream) if you so desire, and the range of flavors is more than sufficient (though not up to the Della Parma standard). Giolotti is a 10-15 walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the end game...”
Reviews.Author: Maximilliano
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2006... All and all a nice hotel very clean pretty good rooms and a breakfast for a king (cut your own proussito from the leg) Location pretty bad All i can say

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bungun
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, beautiful spacious rooms, large bathrooms, very clean. Employees were all very nice. Also free internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff and service...with luxury prices”
Reviews.Author: chriscox75
Reviews.Content: I read both the undiluted praise and the write-off moans on this site about the Sofitel Roma, and fall inbetween - but definitely on the more positive side. I was on my honeymoon and, having written to the hotel in advance, they offered various services. One of these to book us two tickets to the opera at slightly lower than the usual rate for Stalls seats - which we used, and it was great. I asked for flowers which they forgot, but was not annoyed as we were earlier arriving than we should've been - and they gave us a free bottle of Prosecco instead. The staff, such as a very nice concierge called Ludovic (I think) were all great and very keen to be of service. The bed was massive and so absurdly soft it was a bit like sleeping on a cloud, though I think our room was upgraded a bit due to the honeymoon email. They also have a catalogue trying to sell these special beds to you! On the negative side, the food etc. was very expensive - and some/all of the rooftop terrace was booked a couple of times for functions, which unfortunately coincided with when we wanted to use it. However, Rome can be quite expensive (sometimes 5 or 6 Euros for a Diet Coke!) and you can book terrace tables when they're not being used for functions, we just didn't bother. I did not understand the complaints in this site about the air conditioning, as we thought it provided a very chilled and welcome relief from the baking 30-40 degree celcius Rome heat - perhaps it made a slight churny sound, but barely noticeable to us. Overall I would recommend this hotel, especially if you can afford to splash the cash - but even if on a budget as we were, the pleasant staff, great location and luxurious comfort make it a great option. We will probably stay in a more basic place next time, but for a honeymoon I don't think we could've chosen much better.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked that anyone would be positive about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulJude
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised that anyone had positive things to say about this hotel. We stayed for four days this past month and were very unhappy with the hotel. The location was perfect and the staff very friendly but the hotel definately was not a four star hotel, even by European standards. The rooms were claustrophobically small and very "old and worn" looking. The whole hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade and "re-do". The airconditioning must have been broken and the windows were so grimy, it was impossible to see through them.clearly . We would have checked out but at this point, but we were stuck with the hotel. We are very sorry we didn't choose one of the Boscolo hotels close by.

Reviews.Title: “We will continue to stay at the Sofitel every time we come to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Trevi_Trio
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Sofitel in Rome on two separate vacations (October 2008 and January 2009), and we will return as many times as our coins in the Trevi Fountain allow. The hotel is absolutely first-class, especially by European standards that we have presumed by using Tripadvisor. We have always felt extremely safe and comfortable staying there with our daughter (6 months on the first trip, 10 months on the second). Its location is ideal- on a very quiet and safe street near Villa Borghese but also within walking distance from everything else you go to Rome to see! Our rooms were very spacious (the room in January was actually big) with extremely comfortable beds under plush white linens, a chaise, table and chairs, desk, TV with internet access, refrigerator, hidden safe, plenty of storage, central heat/air, and luxurious draperies on large, fully opening windows. The staff may be the best asset of this hotel- extremely friendly and helpful with any need you have. The front desk called several local restaurants searching for one serving osso bucco for my husband, they delivered and set up our baby bed complete with a toiletry/slipper package for our daughter, and they arranged a private car from the hotel for our 5 AM trip to the airport to return home- less expensive than a taxi! The Sofitel feels like our home in Rome, and it is because of these very special people whose faces are like those of old friends. You cannot imagine how wonderful and loved we felt when we returned in January and Ezio recognized us (from our October trip) through the window of the taxicab and quickly opened the door, greeted us warmly, and took our baby girl in his arms! He was genuinely happy to see us again, as we were him. He was an instrumental part of BOTH of our visits to Rome with his perfect directions, travel tips, tourist hints, and locations we needed; on a particularly gray January day he even insisted we take his umbrella out with us. We hope to see him many more times- he is the best! This hotel is a beautiful place, inside and out, from the decorations on the walls to the hearts of its employees. Do not miss this wonderful place! If you are looking for a place to retreat and relax after an amazing and fascinating day exploring Rome, do not miss the Sofitel and its rooftop bar. We spent some very nice time up there on gorgeous October nights- incredible view of the city. There is a little restaurant one block away called il Piccolo Mondo that is also a must; we went twice on each trip, and that's saying a lot if a couple of foodies repeat a dining experience in a city with so many options! I will upload pictures later.

Reviews.Title: “Recovery from Jet Lag and Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegal70
Reviews.Content: Had 2 days in Rome to recover from the long flight from Australia before travelling on. Prime importance was a very quiet room and good bed and no hassles from hotel staff. The rooms are soundproof and very luxurious, the bed was heaven and the location for sightseeing was excellent being close to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and a metro station. The food service in the hotel was ridiculously expensive but a breakfast bar just across the street had a great menu and the best coffee in the world. The only exception was a splurge to have drinks (served with nice canapes) on the rooftop at sunset with a truly magnificent view of Rome. First class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SadeghiandelaGarza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't have been happier. The hotel was lovely, the staff was friendly, attentive and always available when we wanted candid advice/suggestions. I did take a previous poster's advice and asked for a nice view of the gardens, which also provided a view of Vatican City (stunning)!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Trinman80
Reviews.Content: After having stayed in Sofitels in London and New York, the brand has become my favourite in the $300-$500/night range. The location of the Sofitel Roma is quite good - about a 5-10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, but still in a quiet immediate vicinity. Like all Sofitels, the bed is like sleeping on a cloud. Only complaints - the rooms aren't quite as soundproof as advertised (street noise, especially in the mornings, isn't ideal); there's a lot of wood panelling in the bathroom, which has become warped/mouldy from water; and I agree with previous commenters that the prices for hotel food/drinks/internet, while not entirely out of range for hotels, are a little insane (tip: Thursday evening is happy hour at the rooftop bar - 2 cocktails plus snacks for 15 euros). Otherwise, I was quite pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smgladu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Roma for three days in May 2009 as the starting leg of our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly to greet us and was great at helping us with directions and recomendations. The room was decorated nicely and was unique as it was at the end of the building with windows on three sides. There is a beautiful roof top deck at the hotel with a bar / restaurant. The views are great and it is lovely at night. However.....the cost of the food and drink was crazy expensive. We ordered two ice tea's (non alcoholic) and received two small glasses of watered down iced tea. We were shocked when we got the bill and the ice tea was 10 euro each!!! We paid almost $25 for two glasses of iced tea. We had the bill doubled checked and were told that was infact the price. We had a similar issue with a 15 euro gelato. Be sure to check the prices before you order. The view is nice, but not worth it at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located 5-star hotel with great beds; pricey but a solid choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: mchammersmith
Reviews.Content: It's a 5-star Sofitel in a turn of the century building – pretty much as you’d hope and expect. I personally loved the location: near the park, Spanish Steps, and Via Veneto and a 10 minute stroll to the old town. The building façade is spectacular. The lobby area is a little disappointing but the much heralded roof terrace is in fact stunning – great view and a unique and wonderful place to watch the sun set on Rome - though €10 for a beer or double espresso detracts just a little from the full enjoyment of it. Rooms are good, if unspectacular and of fairly modest proportions. Of particular note, though, are the beds which are absolutely top notch. Service was solid. When I arrived they didn’t have my reservation, but took it in stride, gave us a room and was happy to sort the details out later. We booked at the very last minute, so enjoyed a steeply discounted price. If I paid the publish rates I ran across, the “value” rating would have been even lower. In short, a very nice indulgence in Rome – comfortable, great location and an easy hotel to enjoy. Just not particularly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Possibly the Best Hotel Staff in the World”
Reviews.Author: yuldel
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel from Dec 20 - Dec 25 2007. Our choice was based on the TripAdvisor Luxury Hotel reviews. I have stayed at Novotels in Canada, and really wanted to try the Sofitel. The hotel is located near the Spanish Steps (5-10 minute walk). There are many excellent, albeit expensive, restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel itself exhudes class. The rooms are very well appointed, and feel luxurious without being overdone. The bathrooms are amongst the nicest I have ever seen. Breakfast, which was included, was very average - definitely not worth the 12 or 13 euros it is advertised at. The rooftop view from this hotel is just amazing, particularly at night. if you do stay at this hotel, definitely check out the roof. However, it was the staff that really really impressed me. I stayed at the hotel over a year ago, but I still remember the staff. They were just amazing. They were very welcoming, and took great pride in their jobs and cities. They was a genuine air of cheerfulness about them, which was quite refreshing after the politely distant attitude that most hotel staff seem to adopt around the world. The doorman was an absolute gem - informative, helpful, and courteous, without being overbearing. Rome itself is a wonderful city. I nearly ruined my trip by forgetting an important item in the cab that took me to the airport. I called the hotel to request their help, and sure enough, they traced the cab and had my item returned in 20 minutes. Top class service.

Reviews.Title: “Very very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PaulJudeRN
Reviews.Content: We recently had reservations at the Sofitel Rome for a five day stay during May. The location seemed perfect ( Via Veneto ) and the pictures on the website were beautiful. Upon check-in, we knew that it was doubtful that we would stay. The staff at the front desk were very welcoming and professional. The room however did not meet the promise of the pictures on the website. It was very worn, small and most important unbearably hot. Not warm but very very hot. The room had to be at least 85 degrees. I can not imagine anyone staying at the hotel in any warm month. The bed was beyond hard and uncomfortable. Friends who had previously stayed at the Sofitel tried to discourage us from staying there but we thought they were being a little to unreasonable. They weren't. It would be impossible to sleep with that bed. When we went down to the front desk, again they tried to be helpful and accomadating but when the air-conditioning system is grossly inadaqute and the hotel in desperarte need of an upgrade, their options are limited. They offered to change rooms but were honest in acknowleging that all the rooms would be the same throughout the hotel. Again, the staff tried to be helpful but there was only so much that could be done. We were very happy with the newer hotal right up the street. It was everything we hoped the Sofitel would be

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wheelerwp
Reviews.Content: Staff were delightful. Room very good. Not sure if it is quite 5 star however even if your not staying, go have a drink on the rooftop terrace. Its really pricey however the view is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, peaceful Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: MandTBoise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Sofitel in Rome for just one night. We were currently staying in an apartment in Rome but were unaware of of a loud rock concert to be happening for the entire day and night right by our apartment. In addition to this I had come down with a mild case of food poisoning from earlier on our vacation and needed to rest. We decided to get out of this area and searched for the perfect place to rest and relax and pamper ourselves. After much searching and comparing on the web we decided on the Sofitel. For Rome, it's location is super much better than many of the other luxury hotels in the same area. It is on a relatively quiet street with views of the Borghese Gardens. When we arrived we were treated impeccably and had amazing service from Mossimo at the front desk and everyone else we came into contact with. We also had a very special evening in there lovely restaurant. While it was practically empty, we found the service to to be so endearing and thoughtful, Ramona and Francesco did a wonderful job. The food was wonderful and they treated us and the presentation as if it were the most important thing in the world. We had a great time and will definitely stay with Sofitel again in Rome or other cities we travel too. Thank you Sofitel for a wonderful one night retreat.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cpwest
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, clean, good location. great staff, but pricey on the food and drinks both in the restaurant and bar. You can do better by walking a block or two away I would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: HannaGustav
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 great days at the Sofitel in Rome. The hotel has ambience and old Roman style without turning to kitsch (as, e.g. the Rome Cavalieri which is much too transatlantic...). The service is good, the view from our upgraded room was great, the roof top bar is fabulous, and the location next to the Borghese park is 2nd to none. The only deltas were a bit too pricey breakfast, too soft beds , no full body mirrors in the room and no complimentary water (very surprising at a luxury hotel). But we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but falls just a little short on the "luxury " title”
Reviews.Author: RamblingMan
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good, safe location. Room looked great, bathroom spacious with nice touches (robes, marble, nice toiletries). Bed very comfy. Some of the service was good. For example when my wife accident broke a glass in the bathroom, there was someone up there to clean it up within 5 mins. Negatives (i.e. stopping me from giving it 5 out of 5). There was no way of changing the temperature in the room i.e. the airconditioning didn't work. I was first advised to turn it off as it only pumps warm are at this time of year. That didn't really work, so we just has to keep a window open. They had also sold the room as having "perfect soundproofing". This was not wholly correct as our room was connected to the next room with an interconnecting door. The sound of the loud TV and the the loud family next door was quite intrusive. We knew about breakfast being 25E per person, but that doesn't stop it from being extortionate. We had breakfast in a nearby cafe. And finally I remembered when we home that our deal included a "box of chocolates in the room". We never got these. While this is no big deal in itself, I think it is one of a few little lapses in attention to detail which means this hotel cannot be rated as any higher than 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel - Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: ctocm_aw
Reviews.Content: This 5 Star rated Hotel was all you could hope for. Great Location, Beautiful Interior, Outstanding Staff, and Comfortable, nicely equipped rooms. We upgraded our room to a Superior Queen Deluxe non-smoking and we not disappointed with the room in any way. It was clean and spacious with a view over the Borghese Gardens. We arrived early driving up from Sorrento, and our room wasn't quite ready. We opted to drop off our luggage, return our rental car (we wouldn't need it in Rome), and walk back to the hotel. Upon our arrival, a room on the 5th floor (506) was available and we were not disappointed. The entire staff was friendly and gracious. The Porter brought our bags to the room, placed them as requested, and showed us some of the amenities. We had plenty of Closet and drawer space to store our belongings, including those that needed to be secured in the digital (individually set) room safe. Afterwards we set out for our first sightseeing walk to Piazza di Spagna (Spanish Steps), it was only about 15 minutes walk from the Hotel. Our Stay included a "Contenintal Breakfast" which we asked for on the second morning of our stay, the "Le 49" Restaurant Staff apparently mis-understood, offered us the "Buffet", we repeated our "Continental" breakfast request, and she repeated "Buffet" so we assumed it was the same. She asked if we wanted any eggs, or meat, and we declined. The spread was nice with a good assortment of breads, cereals, fruit, juice and coffee or tea. We had a small breakfast and was presented with a bill for 25 euro each - I wasn't prepared for that, but had read in the room guide that would be the charge for a full breakfast - If we violated the "Continental" boundary I wasn't made aware, but paid the charge, and didn't eat in the "Le 49" again during our stay. There are many Bars and Tea rooms within short distance from the hotel that have a continental breakfast for about 12 euro total for two. I think that was my only surprise with the Sofitel. As we came and wen't on various tours the staff greeted us and wished us a good day. The night maid was gracious in turning down our beds and leaving almond cookies on the nightstand. Nice touch. The Day maids did a superb job keeping the place up during our four night stay. We appreciated not hearing any noise from our room to any surrounding and only barely hearing any street noise (even though a street was outside our window five stories below). If I missed saying anything good - I meant to. I'd definately stay here again! The location is perfect, (a little far from the Vatican City and Colosseum - but not terribly so - we walked to both).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Fantastic View of Rome from the Roof Top Terrace”
Reviews.Author: mdean09
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Sofitel and cannot complain about the hotel, the room itself or the service received. Reception Staff - very helpful indeed, especially pointing out where and how far away the main attractions are on a map. Room - Prior to our visit, other reviews on TA did not fill us with much hope but we were extremely surprised to find a fairly large room by most European standards. I do not know what a lot of those reviews are complaining about - you cannot expect one of the oldest cities in the world to suddenly throw up 30 storey modern skyscraper hotels with all the mod cons - it does not fit the location, heritage or culture!. Great room, always kept clean, nice touch with the amaretto biscuits everyday (very yummy!). I agree it is slightly away from the main attractions so you do need very comfortable shoes but its a 10 min walk from the Spanish Steps and we found most attractions easily accessible from here. Tips for your Visit: 1. Comfortable shoes a must - metro doesn't bring you out right on top of alot of the star attractions but we found by walking you stumble upon hidden secrets (i.e. fountains and piazzas). 2. Do not book the vatican tour through the hotel - waste of money - the guide was more interested in rushing us through the vatican museums to the sistine chapel then letting us look around on our own for 20 mins with no real information from him then constantly reminding us that St Peters is the biggest church in the world. If you want a tour guide get one outside -they tend to be students/ scholars of art/ history who know a lot more! 3. If landing at Ciampino - do not use the Terravision coach - 12 euros return seems a bargain but not with the 1.5 hour wait first then its a fair walk to this hotel as it drops you off at Termini Station. Pay the 30 euros each way between the airport and your hotel. 4. As you can expect, food and drink near the attractions is expensive - if your trying to save money look a little further away first. 5. Before you go, it is well worth buying the Dorling Kindersley guide book (logo is the letters DK on an open book) - especially if your guide is not very informative at the Vatican! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and quiet but a little off the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself is beautiful: nice building, cosy and luxurious atmosphere, very good service, gorgeous terrace overlooking the city and the gardens of Villa Borghese. However, it takes quite a while to walk to the closest attractions (Piazza di Spagna / Villa Medicis) or get to the closest public transportation (unfortunately public transportation is not the main claim to fame of the city...) The room was nice (even though we had no view as it was facing the courtyard), well decorated and included an antichamber which gave the impression of a little more space than it really had. The bathroom was nice and clean with great amenities. Unfortunately, the terrace was not used (too early in the season - 1st week of March). We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we felt its price was prohibitive at 25 €. There are plenty of bars in the area where to have breakfast (though we would advise to avoid the cafes on Via Vittorio Veneto which are tourists traps. Overall, it is a good address and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay just a little way from the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkSpinone
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights booked through Greenbee we had a good deal getting 4 nights for the price of three. Because of the high cost of breakfast and drinks we only used the hotel as a sleeping space (breakfast 25 euros, coffee in the bar 5 euros) We had booked a superior room but it was not very large but adequate for 4 nights. The bathroom was a fair size with all you need including 2 shower options. The huge bed was very comfortable and the linen was very good, the towels were thick and fluffy not all hotels of this standard give you the linen you expect. The desk staff were helpful recommending a local restaurant for our first night and booking top rated (tripadvisor rating of course) restaurants on other nights for us. They were also helpful booking Galleria Borghese. The hotel offers complimentary internet access in a quiet back room. The hotel is reasonably quiet for Rome and the double glazing cuts out all the traffic noise. The air con worked very well. There is a small cafe on the way to the Spanish steps which offers a Roman breakfast i.e. pastry & coffee/tea for 7 euros for 2. Be careful if you are going to the Vatican museum the cafe opposite the entrence grossly overcharges if you have to use it ask the price as they will treble the cost if they think they can.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Rome”
Reviews.Author: C1
Reviews.Content: We booked months before and the booking system was easy to use and worked well. On my questions send by email they answered within a few days. Of course hotel rooms are smaller than compared with the rest of Europe. Room was small but nice and bathroom was really good. The toiletries were from Hermes just perfect. We did not have breakfast in the hotel because 25 euro per person is insane to pay. The concierge was helpful in choosing a good restaurant en helping us with directions. Rome was very busy during the valentine days everywhere long waiting lines. But for shopping it was perfect. The hotel is about 10 minutes walking from the Spanish steps. So overall a good choice for a normal price. We payed 220 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “for THAT money, little value”
Reviews.Author: RomaCologne
Reviews.Content: Booked via the hotel website. Five stars? Why? Slippers were missing, only one small complimentary bottle of water in the room. No toothpaste. Blocked drains, shower leaking all over the floor. Reception staff arrogant , porter although well mannered and helpful, smelling of cigarettes and alcohol. Good location though, but certainly not worth 220 Euros per night (EXCL. breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rebsed
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and 6 other family members over New Year. Our rooms were conveniently located on the same floor and all were large (by Rome standards) and fitted out very nicely. The beds were large and comfortable and noise from the corridor was blocked out well. The location of the hotel is about 5 mins walk away from the Spanish Staps and right next door to Villa Bougeise. This was not an issue for any of us as within minutes you were in the centre of the tourist spots. Also, Via Veneto is a nice area. The staff in the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. We were made to feel welcome and bar service and room service was expedient and high quality. The only slightly negative comments that I have are regarding the bar and food prices which were far too expensive. Additionally, the temperature in the hotel and the rooms was very warm. We all tried to adjust the room temperature but did not have much success. Despite this, we had a great time at this high quality hotel and would not hesistate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: bruceleelaroche
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Small room, but very clean and nice. Staff is attentive and pleasant. If you have mobility issues, this is probably too far out of the central district for you. It is not far to walk to places if you are used to walking. Rome is not handicapped accessible...and traveling with older parents is a chore. The city is wonderful and enchanting. There is grafitti all over, but remember...it is a big city and it does not detract from the wonder of Rome. WE LOVE IT HERE! Rome è bella! any questions, just email whtheater@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, but vaguely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tallguy2
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sofitel for a four night stay, our first in Rome, after a 10-day cruise. Love the chain's North American properties in New York and Montreal, but came away vaguely disappointed with Sofitel Roma. The good bits: the location is superb. Comparatively quiet, yet very near the Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. Then again, central Rome is compact and easy to navigate on foot. The service gets full marks, and the rooftop bar's food service was excellent, too. Likewise breakfast in the basement restaurant, which was included in our daily rate. Don't think I'd venture in at night, given the proliferation of restaurants in the neighborhood. This in contrast to our Montreal experience. The down bits. While we had expected small rooms, nothing prepared us for the broom closet provided. Enough closet space for two hangers; no space at all in the room for luggage (we ended up with one bag on the desk). The queen bed had seen far better days and was far beneath a hotel of this caliber. The ample bath was marred by the usual european shower screen and the inevitable flood. All in all, it was OK, although we wouldn't book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: ashsmash
Reviews.Content: I have to counter-balance some of these positive reviews. I really felt like the location was too far off the beaten path, and a lot of people raved about the location. I guess the location was good is you're looking for a quiet location where you can walk to the Spanish Steps, but my husband and were so over it after a few days. We wanted to check out all of Rome and were so tired of footing it back to our hotel every day after exploring, and there was so little to do right around the hotel. It felt big and impersonal with lots of big tour groups. Probably a great place for older travelers. (In fact this was recommended to me by a grandmother who recently stayed there.) But, if you want to be in the heart of things, this is not the place. Granted, it is nice and luxurious, but in that old school, red-velvet, gold way. Good for some, but I couldn't wait to get to a cooler, boutique hotel in the heart of Rome. Maybe this is ideal for a 30th wedding anniversary, but not for a honeymoon. Sorry Sofitel. Glad we were able to check out early.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: captnkirk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 4 days at the end of October after reading the tripadvisor advice and spotting that they had a 4 nights for the price of 3 offer at that time. We were very happy with the hotel, the entrance, reception and public rooms were beautifully appointed and luxurious. Similarly our room at the front of the building on the 5th floor was very comfortable and absolutely quiet with the windows shut (probably traffic noise if they were open, there is aircon obviously), It was a good size with excellent bed and desk, small table and chairs, mini fridge and older style television. Marbled bathroom was large and well equipped. There is a lovely terrace restaurant on the 7th with brilliant views across town. All the staff were very welcoming and helpful. There is a business centre with computers and printers which cost nothing for an hour. Not much of a downside, food was expensive but then it is a very good hotel and I would have liked to make tea or coffee in the room. We used http://www.airports-shuttle.com/ for the transfers and they were excellent, met in arrivals, smart driver and merc, and wisked to the hotel, paid 80 euro for the return trip, which compared well with taxis. We ate locally to the hotel and liked il Piccolo Mondo which was left out of the hotel and at the far corner of the next right. We lunched mainly in the Piazza Navona which had loads of atmos with buskers and artists all were good and expensive. We'd ordered tickets for the wednesday Papal audience from the http://www.santasusanna.org/popeVatican/tickets.html and picked them up from the church the night before. My first request from my usual email address didnt get a reply so I tried again using a hotmail address and got a reply within the hour, similarly with www.vatican.va for the vatican tour. The papal audience had a real festive atmosphere with marching bands and baton twirlers and singing, really uplifting. We arrived the recommended 2 hours beforehand to get a decent seat and the wait flew by there was so much going on. In the event the Vatican tour was cancelled so we went solo and exited the Sistene Chapel to St Peters Basillica as advised on Trip advisor Prebooked the Collisseum/Palatine/ Forum at www.ticketclic.it and printed tickets at home, that saved a big queue on the day. Great trip

Reviews.Title: “Treasure in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaCharlestown
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, convenient location, comfortable, immaculate room, quiet, safe neighborhood, breathtaking views from the roof top bar and an outstanding staff, especially Ezio DeLuca who went out of his way to make us feel welcome and to help us with information about Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service Great Position”
Reviews.Author: ChiaraBug
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Rome is Amazing!! great location right near the Spanish Steps! The service was great the room was very nice and spacious. It's not the cheapest hotel in Rome but if you can splurge a little it's the best! A warning to all non Italian travelers to the Sofitel Breakfast is a strictly traditional Italian business in this hotel you will not find bacon and eggs nor sausages and beans! But you will find freshly baked cakes and pastries yogurts fruits, cereals lovely juices and of course coffee! The staff are very friendly and double as tour guides they will give you maps tips and recommended tours.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: DenverKgirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel Roma for two nights during our 11 day Italy adventure. It was by far the most "luxurious" place we stayed. The rooms were quite small, but was expected from what we were told. But the room was well decorated and extremely clean. The bathroom was spacious with a great tub for two :-) The employees were extremely helpful and friendly. We had asked the front desk where we could purchase some AAA batteries and to our surprise one of the men at the front desk took our old batteries and ran out of the hotel telling us he would be right back. In about 10 mins he returned with new batteries for us. He wouldn't even accept money to pay for them or a tip! We truly enjoyed our stay there. The location was great. Very easy to get to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Walking around the area of the hotel was very nice. A very clean and comfortable area. We would return to this hotel in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Escape23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Rome for 3 nights in late August, when the city was less busy. The hotel is conveniently located, clean and comfortable. Service from the Front Desk is excellent, always willing to help with restaurant bookings and directions. Breakfast, like other reviews have said is very expensive and quite limited. The size of the rooms is okay, but compared to other Sofitels, perhaps on the small side. The area is quite at night, and only five minutes walk away there are a host of restaurants and bars. Just ask Concierge and he/she will give you directions. Travel to and from the airport was easy and hassle free with Romecabs (45euros eachway), Stefano even managed to contact us with a Vatican guide, which is essential if you only have a short time in the city. In August, the city is less crowded, though hot during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Close and Yet Removed”
Reviews.Author: emiao
Reviews.Content: A 5 minute walk from the Spanish Steps, the Sofitel offers a location that is just far enough removed rom the hustle and bustle of the tourist sights, but yet centrally located. There is a supermarket located in the metro stop only 5 minutes away. Not many restaurants right by the hotel though. The hotel has a terrific roof top terrace where light meals and drinks are served only in the evening. A very beautiful spot to watch the sunset over St. Peters. The hotel has limited services: no fitness center; a smallish restaurant located in the basement.. Breakfast didn't look all that appealing for Euro 25. But what it lacks in physical plant, it makes up for in terrrific rooms and bathrooms. We had 2 rooms that were connected by a foyer, creating a decent sized private area for 2 adults and 3 children. We found the front desk staff to be very helpful and the housekeeping staff was great in providing 2 sevices a day. The hotel is not "grand" but is "charming and intimate"

Reviews.Title: “The Sofitel Rome was great!”
Reviews.Author: jaykid007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Roma for our first 3 nights in Rome. This was an excellent place to stay. It appears it may be off the beaten path, but it is actually close to the main part of town. I enjoy the quiet in the areas I stay and this hotel met that expectation. The room was small but was elegant. Rooms are typically small in Europe so this was not a surprise to us. Additionally, out of all the hotels we stayed at on our 3 week European tour, this hotel was the best. Shower only had a half door which was odd, but we found most hotels in Europe are the same way. The bed was especially nice and comfortable especially after a long day of walking and he heat. The A/C worked great and was quiet. We did not hear any noise from adjoining rooms. I would ask for the top floor if any rooms are available as the view is nice and no one above us. We had a balcony which was especially nice. The hotel front desk staff (especially Massimo) were friendly and helpful. We especially liked Luigi who was always kind and friendly as other reviewers have mentioned. Other reviewers mentioned that the breakfast was pricey, limited to bread, and fruit, etc. Our breakfast was included but I do agree 25 Euros is expensive. The breakfast offered a lot more than just breads and fruit. In addition, we were offered eggs and bacon made to order form the kitchen. There was several different kinds of cheeses and meats, along with multiple pastries, salmon, bagles, pies, etc. We also were offered hot coffee each morning that was really good. We always had a friendly hostess and wait staff. We did visit the rooftop deck which had some really nice views. At night, they offer cocktails. Beware that the drinks there are 10 Euros and up and will cost you a fortune. Didn't see any type of food there. Overall, this hotel was excellent and I will book my next Rome trip at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel near the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Robinhat
Reviews.Content: Very nice and quiet hotel, with a fantastic rooftop lounge outlooking the Villa Borghese and downtown Rome. Some very nice sunsets. Nice clean rooms and good service. Avoid the very expensive breakfeast 25€ pr. person. Go get a snack at the nearby Cafe's. 7-10 minute walk to downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bobina007
Reviews.Content: This is a small, boutique feeling hotel located in a quiet residential area of Rome. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and nice and allowed us to check in at approximately 9:30 in the morning after our flight from the United States. The rooms were tasteful and exceptionally clean, if a little on the small side. The bathroom was beautiful, although the shower configuration allowed water to leak out onto the floor, which I hated to have to mop up with the bath towels, since they were thick and luxurious! It was a short (five-minute, approx.) walk to Via Veneto, and a bit of a longer (10-15) walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Ancient Rome and Vatican City were a longer distance to walk, but we found the peaceful, quiet and peddler-free area the Sofitel was located in worth the extra distance, either on foot or by cab. We got the bed and breakfast rate and were very pleased with the breakfast. This was a perfectly wonderful place to start our trip through Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburghpenguins
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Sofitel Roma. The staff was very friendly and the room was quite nice. The hotel was extremely quiet (which is what you want after traipsing around ruins all day). Ezzio was especially friendly and recommended a great restaurant. Avoid the laughably expensive continental breakfast (45 Euros!) and go to some of the cheaper places very close to the hotel. The terrace bar is breathtaking, but expensive too. Very close walk to the metro, Spanish steps, and Trevi fountain, but tucked away in a quiet residential area. Will we stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: paulos1
Reviews.Content: After spending time at the Sofitel St James London is was always going to be hard to compete. About five minutes walk from the centre of Rome this was a little gem. Lovely appointed rooms with very friendly accomodating staff. The doorman Luigi is a great guy with my 4 year old telling him she wanted to marry. All and all a great all round hotel with nothing to complain about

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: krislecl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Sofitel Roma based on reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. I have to agree with the rest of the positive feedback that others have left here. The front desk staff was super nice. One gentleman helped us each night with dinner suggestions and reservations. Each place he suggested was great. We stayed for only one night when we first arrived to Rome then stayed again for two more nights when we returned from the Amalfi Coast a few days later. We had a different room each stay. While the rooms were both fairly small, they were well appointed. The bed was the most comfortable we slept in while in Italy (even better then the Westin in Florence, which is known for their "heavenly beds"). The decor was very nice. The bathrooms were all marble and clean but small. The shower had the half door like most hotels in Italy so each time we showered the floor would get soaked. They provided nice toiletries in the bathroom. It was in the upper 90's our entire time in Rome so it was wonderful to come back to a nice cool room each day/night. Our A/C worked great! The location of the hotel was great. Some people have complained about there being a hike to get back to the hotel. We found it not to be bad at all. It took only about 10 minutes to walk to the Trevi Fountain from the hotel, even closer to the top of the Spanish Steps and the area that the hotel it located in is very nice. We had drinks upstairs on the rooftop patio one night. The prices were pretty steep and the dinner menu didn't look too great (and also very overpriced). We enjoyed our strawberry belinis and the setting and chose another location for dinner. The views and setting were beautiful from the patio. We also enjoyed chatting with the waiters up there, they were so friendly. The only thing that disappointed me was that we didn't receive any awknowledgement from the hotel that we were celebrating our honeymoon. All the other places we stayed at in Italy gave us a bottle of prosecco and a card. I also didn't like the fact that breakfast wasn't included in the price of the room, it was something like 30 euros extra pp so we ate elsewhere. Overall it was a good experience and I would choose to stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALFRED99
Reviews.Content: This was the latest in a series of city breaks the wife and myself were taking around Europe. The Sofitel Roma is on a hill above and behind the Spanish Steps. The Hotel is located in a quiet residential area well within walking distance of main city streets and squares but there is a steep climb back at the end of the day. The Villa Borghese is nearby and well worth an early evening stroll. There are restaurants in the vicinity but we preferred to dine in the various squares in the city. The reception area is large and welcoming with adjacent spacious lounges furnished in elegant style. Our room was a delight decorated in warm colours with plenty of storage space, a good bed and overlooking a quiet street. A very high standard of cleanliness was maintained with little noise intruding from within the building. We dined out at night but used the basement restaurant for breakfast and this was the only disappointment. The room is not very exciting and whilst the buffet is varied it lacked imagination. I also have a thing about people leaning over uncovered food to serve themselves. There did not appear to be a "cook to order" service so eggs, bacon and sausages were left in covered tureens. This food was always cold and unappetising. Table service was average and in all our time we only saw one waitress smile. In contrast reception, door and portering staff were all friendly helpful and efficient. Reception organised a personal guide for our Vatican tour and this was well worth the expense. Make sure that you view the city from the hotel roof terrace and of course visit the Vatican museums and St. Peters Basilica, the sculptures and art work are incredible. Our trip was just out of season but the Closseum and Trevi Fountain areas were always crowded and we felt less impressive. We loved Rome and and this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Staff, Stunning Views”
Reviews.Author: LoobieLulu
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Roma, is a great hotel in a very good northern location near to the Borghese Park, and 5 mins walk to the Spanish Steps and the shopping, bars and restaurants that surround that area. Rooms are very comfortable with fab aircon (which you'll need after a hot days shopping and sightseeing) lovely power shower and bathroom facilities and big comfy beds. The hotel was very quiet and located perfectly for our stay just be prepared for a lot of walking and hill climbing, and most nights after dinner you'll need to conserve energy for the climb up the spanish steps back to the hotel! The best thing about the hotel is its walkable to almost all the major sights (colluseum/palatine hill 20-25mins, spanish steps 5mins, pantheon and piazza navona 15-20 mins, piazza del popolo 10mins) The only time we used the metro was to go to st peters and it was super efficient and only 1euro. (the nearest stop is at the top of the spanish steps) After a long day exploring rome go up to the roof terrace and enjoy the amazing views over the city (you can see st peters, castel st angelo, the roof of the pantheon, villa medici etc etc) Drinks and food are very expensive and the one thing that let this hotel down, (although we did treat ourselves to a cocktail before we went out for diner each night to soak in the views but £25 for 2 drinks eeeeeek) If you want cheap drinks and snacks Bar Lembo is just down the road from the hotel on the way to the spanish steps and does bottled water, coke, beer etc and delicious panninis for quick bites! We would definately return to the Sofitel Roma! the staff are exceptional, very accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: jflow119
Reviews.Content: My family (me, my husband, and 5 children aged 6-12) stayed at the Sofitel Roma for 2 nights. I had contacted the hotel by email because their website would not let me reserve only 3 rooms for 7 people. I received a very prompt email in return that same day saying that it woul be no problem and that they would have 2 connecting rooms and a triple room on the same floor for us. The manager I dealt with was wonderful and accomodating. We ended up needing the rooms a day earlier than planned at the last minute. Another almost immediate email told us that it would be no problem. When we arrived in Rome from Sicily, we thought it would be great to take the express train to the Termini station and take the metro to the Spanish Steps and walk to the hotel from there. We only had carry-on luggage, so we did not think it would a problem. However, the map of Rome that we had did not show that you cannot get to the street we wanted without climbing the Spanish Steps, which we were not about to do. So we had to go about 7 blocks (at least 4 straight uphill) to reach the hotel. As we made it up to the front door, a lovely doorman come rushing to our rescue. Luigi quickly took our bags, found chairs for the kids, and directed us to the front desk. He even fanned me off with my map. We were hooked from that point on. The rooms were beautiful and large which was a pleasant surprise. Great bathrooms and Hermes toiletries (great shampooo). It is also very quiet at night - we did not even know anyone else was in the hotel. The crowning glory of the hotel, however, has got to be the Terrace. On the top floor is an open terrace with couches and bar tables that overlooks the entire city. It is breathtaking. They have an extensive drink menu and serve appetizers, entrees and desserts. There is even a telescope if you want a better view. I was impressed with every aspect of the hotel and will hopefully have the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: bajathree
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 with 2 rooms booked through their web site using the book 3 nights and get the 4th free including a picnic lunch. We were check in promptly into 2 rooms right next to each other. We had a bit of an AC problem in one room so asked to be moved to other rooms and were promptly relocated. The new rooms were even a better setup as they had a door that you could close off to the hallway that made the 2 rooms private and adjoining...not sure why we were not offered this to begin with. One room was still warmer than the other, but hey Europe is not know for great air conditioning, so it was fine. Rooms were of good size and very comfortable. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. They have an incredible rooftop bar which just opened 2 weeks prior to our visit. They were not serving food yet on the roof but were about to start in a day or two. The view from the roof was gorgeous! The drinks were great but be prepared.....$20-25 for a glass of wine and about $7 each for a soda for the kids...great snacks though. Easily spent a $150 a shot each visit. We spent time on the roof every evening before dinner....it really was the highlight of our stay. The picnic lunch was great...really good sandwiches and a bottle of wine for each in a lovely basket....very very nice. However that was all we ate at the hotel as the restaurant was not that impressive and prices were very high.....this is a business hotel after all. Breakfast I think was $25 Euro....crazy. We just went a few blocks away to Via Veneto every morning and we had breakfast for $15 Euro total for 4....a bit better than $100 Euro. A bit of an uphill walk back to the hotel but the location is very nice and quiet...so well worth the extra effort. All in all a very nice stay and would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it ...worth every single penny...”
Reviews.Author: ellimizani
Reviews.Content: I called the Sofitel on the morning of my check-in date after the original hotel I made reservations at (Roma Boutique) lost my reservation (they blamed Hotels.com) and put me up at hotel Della Regioni. I was sick of all the hassel, really disliked the accomodations at Regioni and willing to pay any amount to stay at a great hotel. I called Sofitel and the reception desk gave me a rate which was about $100 less than major websites had advertised (probably since it was a last minute). I have nothing bad to say about them at all. The location is amazing, staff is incredible (one of the men at the front desk spent 20 minutes looking for a place that sold curling irons because mine broke) and the room is EXTREMELY spacious by Italian standards, clean with beautiful decor. I don't think I will ever stay at another hotel in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Leno4ka
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for Christmas 2007 and were very pleased with our choice Excellent location, efficient and friendly staff, and even a spacious, elegant room. Breakfast was good. It's a typical European breakfast with deli, bread, pasteries etc.,

Reviews.Title: “delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: cheesemad
Reviews.Content: absolutely delightful sevice throughout our stay. good room sevice particularly for breakfast and reasonably central location. would definitely recomment

Reviews.Title: “Quiet refuge, but with a few reservations”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeCapeCod_
Reviews.Content: Nice neighborhood and a stunning view over a corner of the Villa Borghese and the entire city of Rome. The view is similar to The Hassler, but the hotel is even higher. The next door Hotel Eden uses its rooftop for a very expensive restaurant. Sofitel Roma has a lovely rooftop terrace where you can bring your own drinks and snacks. We used it late afternoon and had it mostly to ourselves. Room was not large, but nicely decorated, and with excellent soundproofing. Staff was helpful and very friendly, with good English spoken. Our package booking did not include breakfast, which was priced at an outrageous 25 euros per person. We never ate at the hotel, but it was fun to discover several neighborhood breakfast bars, a great pastry shop, a wonderful fruit store, and even a full grocery store two blocks away located underground in the passageway between the upper end of Via Veneto and Villa Borghese. Neighborhood restaurants not on Via Veneto were good and moderatelly priced. Just around the corner Marcello's/Vladimir's provided us a three course dinner with wine for little more than the hotel breakfast charge. Aurora 10 had great seafood, and Chiacchiere, 1.5 blocks the other side of Via Veneto on Via Sicilia was nice for an outdoor cafe lunch as well as dinner. A one foot strip at the edge of our king size mattress in Room 505 was lumpy and saggy, reducing the useable size of the bed to queen size. For a hotel of this overall quality the mattress should long since have been replaced. While the hotel did make a nice refuge from sightseeing, it is somewhat far afield from a number of sites, and while we walked 8 to 10 miles a day, we did need 3 or 4 cab rides a day at never less than 9 to 10 euros each. Public transportation seemed both inconvenient and intimidatingly complicated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: BostonMAC
Reviews.Content: By the time we got to Rome, we were on the last 3 days of a 2-week whirlwind Italy trip so we were happy to stay in a large, well-known European chain hotel and all the amenities that came with it! The location of this Sofitel is great - it's about a 5 minute walk down to the Spanish Steps, right next to the Villa Borghese, and we were able to walk to almost everything in Rome (except for the Coliseum and Vatican City) from this spot. We found the best rate to be the internet "hot deals" rate and booked right through the hotel's website. At the time, a classic double (which was a very nice size, had a great bathroom, and a small terrace) was around $390 US. Breakfast was inlcuded, and was superb! The staff was always very friendly and helpful in recommending restaurants, maps, etc. I didn't take any pictures of the hotel itself during our stay, but the room was beautifully decorated in dramatic and luxurious red and gold fabircs.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Sucal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I hoped it would be. It was quiet, luxurious and well run by friendly staff. The room was spacious, had a very comfotable bed, had all the usual toiletries plus lots of extras such as slippers, bathrobes, shoehorn and even a small stool in the bathroom. The buffet breakfast cost 25 euros . It was not extensive but was of good quality and I felt it was fair value for money. There is an a la carte breakfast menu in English if you just want coffee and rolls. It was not always out so just ask.The bar, which was very comfortable and had an English country house feel about it (how strange in Italy) served an excellent array of free hors-d'oeuvres with drinks and was similar in price to many of the surrounding bars . A tip for getting around is to use the buses as well as metro. The 116 circular minibus terminus is on the street next to the Sofitel. It will take you all over, it winds through the city centre small streets with ease and runs about every 5-10 mins. Get a bus map from atac.roma.it website before you go as the hotel did not have any information. After this first excellent experience with Sofitel I will always see if they have a hotel where ever I go in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great but a few minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Njal
Reviews.Content: Our room, 612, was quiet, clean, nicely decorated. The staff was helpful. The location is convenient. A few caveats: the buffet breakfast is NOT included with the hotel, and it costs 25 euros ($40). Even a la carte is outrageous: 4 euros for an espresso, etc. The desk was apologetic, and explained that the breakfast used to be incluided, but the French management decided to charge for it. But there are cafes (such as the Palomba) nearby on the Via Veneto, a five munute walk, with excelelnt coffee and patry, for about $3 euros a person. There is no business center. That means no printer. If you do not have your laptop, you have to use TV internet, which I found awkward, and it was difficult to get started. A hotel employee had to fool with the wires in back before I could use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SdR08
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Hotel was wonderful! The hotel is located on a small street, making it ideal for people who want quiet at night. Its about a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, and 3 minutes to Via Venetto. The staff is wonderful, the front desk staff speaks English, and the rest of the staff was very nice. The room (1 single/smoking) was on the 6th floor, perfect with a double bed, and a balcony. The bathroom was very large. This is one of the few hotels in Rome that knows how to make "american coffee", and they have the best tiramisu I have ever tasted. Don't miss the view from their terrace on the 7th floor. My only concern with this hotel was that the last night I was there I could hear the conversation of the people adjacent to my room. This was the only night I heard people on the other room. I was there for seven nights, and while a little pricey, I believe I made the right choice to stay at this hotel. Word of caution with hotels.com - I verified 3 times if breakfast was included in my price, they said yes - however, the hotel said no. Verify with the hotel before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa026
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice experience for us. The location is wonderful, just a short walk to the Spanish Steps and has some nice places to eat and drink nearby the hotel itself. The room was a little small but the decor was lovely. We were very happy with the service we got, everyone was very friendly and kind. I did miss some english on TV but when you are in Rome you should be out anyway so it was not a problem plus they have pay movies if all else fails. I definatly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Will definately be back again!”
Reviews.Author: robbertl
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it brief, to the point and as useful as I can (the type of review I like to read myself). My girlfriend and I planned a Romantic break in Rome and used TripAvdvisor (once again) to choose our hotel. Based on the reviews of the hotel and their TripAdvisor award we settled on the Sofitel. We made our booking by telephone through Hotels.com in less than 5 minutes. We booked a Deluxe Double room for 3 nights (Friday 22nd February to Monday 25th February). The hotel is located near Villa Borghese in non-touristy and quieter part of Rome (no offence to other hotels or areas - that’s just my opinion having stayed in Rome several times before). To place it in perspective, its only a relatively short walk from the Spanish Steps (yes, a little uphill on the way back - but not a problem) and close enough to the Trevi Fountain to make it a comfortable walk. It is located on the corner of a really quiet, peaceful and safe street. From the outside it does not necessarily appear that impressive looking (sometimes a positive sign of understated quality!!!)... but (and this is a big but) the service and quality strike you from the moment you approach the hotel or get out of your taxi. The caped doorman is ready at hand to offer a smiling welcome and take your luggage. The bellboys immediately step in to take your luggage and guide you to reception. The reception staff are very professional, well spoken, well dressed and very, very helpful with the whole process. Maps and tourist information were presented without asking and we were advised that taxis can be booked from reception or the or the doorman at a moments notice. It is clear that this hotel has a clear standard and level of service, worthy of its star rating. Although our room was not immediately ready on checking-in, we received a profuse apology but we were assured that the Deluxe Double room we booked was worth the wait - and Yes, they were absolutely right. The room (519) was tastefully decorated, with a seating/lobby area, room safe in the wardrobe, large bathroom and a HUGE (and I mean HUGE) bed - you could easily fit 3-4 people in it. A word of advice - don't lie down on the bed straight away... its that soft and comfortable you may not get out of it again... I'm not joking!!! Sometimes I find it difficult to settle into a hotel bed for the first night or two... the only two exceptions are the Renaissance River Hotel in Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam and, now, the Sofitel Roma. There is hardly any traffic passing and little if any noise from the road outside. Our room had two little balcony's to look out from... a nice touch. The hotel has a nice lobby and bar area where you can relax after a hard days sightseeing. Most importantly... the staff are very professional, discreet and stay in the background, but are there when you need them. The 7th floor has a wonderful terrace with great views of the city by day and night, and is worth the visit even if you are not staying in the hotel. We booked a walking tour of Rome with a company called EnjoyRome.com, when we asked the doorman to order a taxi he immediately knew that we were taking a tour and instructed the taxi driver exactly where to drop us off, saving us some time wandering around looking for the tour pick-up point. On our last day we planned some sightseeing and asked if the hotel could hold our luggage for a few hours. This was no problem and the staff seemed happy to help out. Five little tips. 1) Book some walking tours with EnjoyRome.com. In total we took 3 walking tours of Rome with Enjoy Rome, all lasting 3 hours long.. The old city/Jewish quarter tour is particularly good both for the sites and as an introduction to Rome. They also do the Vatican and the Major Sites. We would strongly recommend these tours as they helped orientate us to the city and sights. These tours also gave us a good idea of how easy it is to walk to/around the major sites - so take our advice and make the most of your time using an organised tour. 2) if you are English or Irish and are absolutely gasping for a cup of decent tea then try the Babbington/Barrington Tea house at the bottom of the Spanish Steps (left hand side), yes its a little bit expensive... but when the need for tea calls this will really hit the spot. 3) For an authentic family run trattoria with local atmosphere and genuine Italian food try Mario' on Via del Moro (near Piazza Trilussa) you will not be disappointed with the food or the prices. Try the Meatballs or the Sausage (I did both!) The young waiter is very happy to use/learn English (he even gave us a free pen!!!) and it has a really nice local and genuine feel to it. Friday or Saturday are probably best for a real experience. Leave your diet outside. 4) For real pizza in a lively and genuine atmosphere try Dar Poeta on Vicolo del Bologna (near Piazza Trilussa), be warned... the Italian starter is HUGE (meats, cheese, olives, etc) so have plenty of room for your main course. Needless to say the piazza is excellent and well helped by the house wine. You might have to queue for a few minutes, but it is really worth the wait! A good mix of locals and tourists mean that it is really lively and buzzing. Again, leave your diet outside. 5) Even on weekend trip - get out of the city for a while. A trip to Chianti (yes, where the wine comes from) is only 30 minutes by train. A lovely little town with a nice square, wonderful ice cream and delicious cakes. A nice walk in the park below the towering main house on the hill followed by a coffee will round things off nicely. In closing, one of the most welcoming notions while on holiday is the prospect of returning to your warm, welcoming and comfortable hotel after a hard days sightseeing, shopping or a night out. We would therefore strongly recommend the Sofitel Roma to couples, families and older people if you want to treat yourself to a non-touristy (sorry to use that term but mass tourism hotels do not really appeal), quality, relaxing, comfortable and memorable stay in Rome. After this experience we intend to return to Rome and will definitely be staying at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a little out of town”
Reviews.Author: jandg20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel for one week. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom excellent and the service efficient and friendly. For our taste it was a little overfull of soft furnishings - very plush and fin de siecle. it was difficult to let light and air into the room because of the number of curtains. We did not eat in the hotel but had a snack in the bar - delicious but expensive. The hotel is a little way from the sights and we got quite fit walking up and down the hill. We were part of a musical tour group and had no regrets at our choice of hotel apart, perhaps, from it s location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: deego
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in February and I really loved it. Its a lovely hotel, both the lobby and the rooms are decorated to a high standard. Its in a great location, only 5 minutes walk to the Spanish steps. You have to walk up a steep hill to get bak to the hotel but then Rome is all about walking!! We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it was €25 per person so I'm not sure what its like. I would highly recommend this hotel for a weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and beautiful hotel perfectly located in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DanielleSheffield
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at the Sofitel Roma this February and had an amazing time. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are really helpful. The hotel is extremely well located for sightseeing and the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps are all within a reasonable walking distance. In fact we walked to the Collosseum and Vatican directly from the hotel. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and after checking out they allowed us to store our cases so that we did not have to trek around Rome with these. I booked the hotel through Expedia and paid £150 per night which i felt was a little pricey but well below the average price suggested on here. This was £150 well spent though as our stay at the Sofitel was thoroughly enjoyable. For anyone visiting Rome for a short city break, i would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sillyfemmy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my parents on a trip to Rome for their 60th birthday. It was their first time in Europe so I wanted the trip to be very special. I agonized over the hotel location and choice--I travel a lot for business so my standards are pretty high. After reading all the reviews here and in some of the guidebooks, I finally settled on the Sofitel despite my reservations and previous mixed experience w. the US chain: the Sofitel in Philly is superb. The one in Chicago was terrible. So, imagine my relief upon arriving here. The doorman was quick to grab our bags but that's the kind of service I was expecting. Our rooms were ready before the normal check in time. They gave us a corner room on the 2nd floor and my parents a room down the hall. Ours was definitely nicer and larger although theirs was just fine. The decor is a bit "ROMAN" aka chintzy, and the rooms are a bit dark due to the heavy curtains, but the bed--just a classic double--was king sized and super comfortable.
