The marble bathroom was incredibly spacious, with a full bath and powerful showerhead. The robes were kind of thin and rough. Amenities were great (except no lotion--is that strange?) and everything was very clean and the hotel offered turn down service and a 2nd clean up each night. Staff was accomodating, friendly and prompt--helping to arrange taxi service, always prompt w/ wake up calls, quick to bring up a toothbrush, etc. We loved to retire to the lobby library lounge after dinner for drinks. I had a cold for most of the trip and one day the bartender offered to make me a hot toddy of milk, brandy and honey---it did WONDERS for my chest cold. We did not bother w/ the hotel breakfast...instead walking down the Via Veneto to Cafe Paris and having coffee, frenchly squeezed orange juice and chocolate filled brioches while standing at the coffee bar--just like the locals. $15 euro for 4 people, as opposed to $25 euro per person for the sofitel breakfast buffet. The terrace on the 7th floor offers a great view. You can pick up some vino and toast to the fabulous city up there. The location is great because it's near to the Spanish steps, across from the Borghese gardens and yet quiet during the night. There is a great gourmet shop just down the street that serves fantastic lunch. Note: the nearest Metro is a bit of a hike so if you don't like walking, this may be an issue. I would definitely stay here again--perhaps asking for a room on one of the higher floors. We had SUCH a great time on our trip and it felt good to be greeted by the doormen after our daily adventures with a "welcome home".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: tidda
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Sofitel as part of a group in Rome for a music festival. We were particularly pleased that the hotel listened to our group leader and gave us the kind of room we requested. This is always a sign of good management. Our room was wonderful. We could have held a party in it, it was so large. We had a TV in the bedroom area and another in the living area. This is something we have only experienced in the USA or on board a cruise ship. Like another reviewer said, maybe this was because we were in a corner room but we did not find it dark at all. We had 5 windows! The bathroom was also excellent with 2 basins (his and hers) and a very good size. There were lots of lovely good quality toiletries in a basket. The room was very quiet and we slept well. We could not hear the traffic at all. We thought the staff were very nice at Reception and even the Electrician working on the lamps was very pleasant to us when we passed by. Altogether we really enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to return if we visit Rome in the future. The hotel is situated in a very nice part of the City. Of course there is the problem of the hilly walk back to the hotel but there are solutions, ie. bus or metro to Via Veneto and walk down to the hotel from there instead of walking up from the Spanish Steps area. If you are fit it is no problem and only about a 10 minute walk from the Steps. Lovely restaurants in the vicinity if you do not eat in the hotel. We had 1 evening meal plus breakfasts. The meal was very nice and the staff very obliging. One point, if you like tea at breakfast, the water is only luke warm unless you say you really need it boiling! Do not know what the coffee was like. The breakfast was fine - just like any buffet breakfast in a hotel, but adequate for us. Very nice choice of juices and cakes which was unusual for us at breakfast but thought the breakfast room was very nice and cosy and although in the basement, was very light and bright in the corridor approaching it. Try the Sofitel, you will like it. Cannot understand why a reviewer is showing the chaise lounge as a 'single bed' - really strange. The bed was lovely, clean and big with huge pillows. Enjoy everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: The Wright Family
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite a distance from Rome's Termini station (main station) you should catch a taxi. The doorman was overly aggressive and pushy to take our suitcases of us. The reception had stuffed up our reservation and put us in a smoking room. We had to arrange to be moved to a non-smoking floor. The beds are not to Sofitel standards. They’re very hard, with flat pillows. The décor is hideous, very Roman – King Caesar! When we were moving rooms the staff were very aggressive (to take our bags), to the point of being intimidating. The doorman without any course or reason whilst bringing up our luggage from the other room. He entered our bathroom whilst it was occupied by my daughter. No apology all he said was “Scusi”. We were so disgusted with the way we were treated we checked out after only one night (we booked in for 5 nights). We were also booked in for Christmas Lunch which we cancelled. *For an excellent hotel in Rome look for our other hotel review. After a flight all you want to do is relax and not have rude staff continually being in your face, to the point of harassing you.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service"”
Reviews.Author: jlwine2
Reviews.Content: "Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service" Just a short walk from "The Spanish Steps" and many restaurants and other attracktions.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany2
Reviews.Content: We booked our room based on the high rating the hotel received on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We booked a deluxe suite and enjoyed the luxury and spaciousness the Sofitel provides. The location can't be beat for its quietness and its proximity to the Villa Borghese. The views from the terrace are spectacular and is the perfect setting to enjoy a glass of wine at sunset. We were very impressed with the full breakfast buffet the hotel provides. We also enjoyed a dinner at their restaurant. However, it was pricey but the service was spectacular given we were the only couple dining.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: montrealer1110
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in one of the best areas in Rome (near via Venato). Plenty of restaurants around and close to the Spanish Steps. The rooms are of decent size, but very comfortable and clean. We were upgraded to a deluxe room with a balcony. The bathrooms are fairly large and very clean. The shower head could use an upgrade. The breakfast is passable, but the service and snacks at the bar are excellent. The only issue I have with the hotel is that we asked for an umbrella one day and we were told that none were available. When we passed by the doorman who had heard our request, he told us that umbrellas were available but the management gave them out only to selected guests. I'm not sure how they determine who is a selected guest or not. All in all a very nice place to stay, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No towel warmer???”
Reviews.Author: AvonTravler
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Sofitel Roma and it was by far the best hotel out of the four we stayed at during our trip. This is clearly a high-end luxury hotel which delivers. The location is great, the staff were all extremely helpful and spoke proficient English. The room was wonderful with a very comfortable bed. The walls must be 10" thick, because we could not hear a sound, which was amazing given this is in the center of a major city. The only item we could come up with on the "negative" side was the lack of towel warmer in the bathroom. When in Rome, stay here - it really is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Good Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBirmingham
Reviews.Content: The hotel lives up to its reputation offering everything you would expect from a four star hotel. The service was professional and courteous, the staff were very friendly and offered to help without having to be asked. The location is good, right next to Via Veneto, we found most of the sights were in walking distance. There are a number of nice (but expensive) restaurants nearby (if you book restaurants through top table you can get a discount on your bill as we did with nearby Doney). We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant. The room was nice, bigger than your average 4 star city hotel, as was the bathroom (although we had a corner room which may be bigger than a standard room). The room decor was in keeping the style found in Rome generally, statutes at the end on the corridor and lots of marble etc. The bath had a rain shower and separate bath shower which was useful. My only complaint would be that the room was a bit dark with no main light but series of lamps, which wouldn't be great for a business traveller. The TV was also a little small. The breakfast offered a good range of food, again in keeping with a good four star although no fresh hot food, but this is often the case. The bar area was nice (although as is usual with a four star hotel slightly overpriced). There were nice touches like a selection of little biscuits served with coffee. We were pleased with the hotel and would certainly recommend it for the price paid (around £150 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Maishe
Reviews.Content: Our family (group of 13) stayed for four nights at the end of September at the Sofitel and overall we were very pleased with our stay. We booked here based on the high tripadvisor rating and we certainly weren’t disappointed. We stayed in a variety of rooms –a single room, several double rooms, a triple, and a suite on the top floor. So, we got to see a great deal of the hotel. Rooms were very clean, nicely decorated with great bathrooms. The double rooms were an adequate size – not huge but certainly acceptable. We all had a few difficulties flooding our bathrooms, due to the shower heads. My Mom and Dad’s suite had a beautiful terrace with a great view. Our room faced onto Via Lombardia and it was nice and quiet. Pros: - great doormen, front desk and bar staff - loved the lobby bar, drinks pricey but good - good variety of breakfast choices - good location 5 minutes from Spanish Steps and couple of blocks from Via Veneto, able to walk to all sites. Cons: - no concierge - restaurant was in the basement (not keen on that), staff there were not the friendliest. - trip back to the hotel at the end of the day is all uphill - sheets felt like you were sleeping between tablecloths. We would return to the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish and you can open the windows!”
Reviews.Author: ozbabetasmania
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were very pleased ( and relieved) with our choice. Rome has so many hotels in so many areas that it can be confusing and quite risky to get a hotel that lives up to it's PR. I looked at the reviews on Trip Advisor first and these certainly were reliable. The hotel is sited close to the Spanish Steps and Borghese Gardens ( beautiful for walking) and has plenty of cafes, hair salons and small shops nearby. The rooms were comfortable and well stocked with all amenities and the breakfasts were excellent ( although the restaurant is quite small so be prepared for a short wait). It was also a great plus to be able to open our window and get lots of fresh air without having to put up with traffic noise. Thoroughly recommend this hotel if you want to stay somewhere quiet comfortable with good, unobtrusive service. When we returned to Rome a few weeks later we had to stay in a hotel nominated by our tour (a Mercure) and it was horrible. If that had been our only experience of Rome we would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we expected”
Reviews.Author: kaconway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 week tour of Italy. Our first 2 nights were spent at the Sofitel Roma. I should preface my comments by saying we had previously stayed at the Sofitel New York and couldn’t have had a better stay. My expectations, therefore, were very high for the Rome location. The hotel is nice, the breakfasts are very good, the staff is certainly cordial and the roof top terrace gives an excellent view. The rooms, however, were a disappointment. They were tiny, the décor was loud and ornate in an overdone way. Our walls were scuffed from previous occupant’s luggage and the room just didn’t feel plush. The bathrooms were very nice, however. We decided during our trip to return to Rome the day before our flight, instead of the day of, and did not book with the Sofitel. We, instead, booked at the Hotel Piranesi and were thrilled with the accommodations and location. Breakfast there was even better!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yodatoadi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. My boyfriend and I only had one night in Rome and had gone through some extensive research as to which hotel we would stay in. This hotel was over our budget but it was well worth saving all the extra pennies to stay there. It's pure luxury, lavishly decorated with real artworks and sculptures. Doormen and Reception Staff were friendly and helpful. As we checked in, without even asking we were given an intricate map of Rome featuring all the major sights and a book on what else there was to do during a stay in Rome including recommended restaurants etc. There was a harpist in the bar/lounge during the day, we had gone out for the evening but there may have been other musicians. Brilliant location, only 2 mins walk from the Spanish steps and 2 mins from an open top bus tour stop. Continental breakfast was tasty and there was a fair variety. Our room was more than comfortable and just as lavish as the rest of the hotel, with a view of the old Roman City Wall and a large Bathroom. We stayed in one of their cheapest rooms and it was one of the biggest rooms we've had at any hotel. I would undoubtedly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you're in Rome for a special occassion.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: caviargal
Reviews.Content: Previously I have stayed at the Empire Palace, Edera (2x), Minerve (5x), Del Senato (2x), Capo D'Africa. Sofitel was the best of the bunch. Perfect location, lovely rooms, wonderful breakfast with great cappucino, cordial staff, well appointed public areas, top notch bathrooms and amenities. I have already booked for next year. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Sofitel Roma”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: We broke up our stay in two parts due to our Prague visit in between. First room we had was #319 which overlooked nothing special other than an old palazzo across the street. Room was spacious with sitting area and desk in one area and a huge bathroom. Our second room was #618 which overlooked the same old palazzo view just higher up. This room was smaller than the first one but had a balcony that you could walk out onto and sit on except there were no chairs available. One complimentary bottle of water was included on the first day only. As a chain hotel there were the typical nice amenities offered in the bathroom (e.g. Roger & Gallet toiletries and even toothbrushes and toothpaste, comb, vanity and sewing kits, etc.). There were shower/tub combination in both rooms. However, there were two showers-one normal but not adjustable handspray and an enormous rainshower). The irksome thing was that the normal shower was not adjustable so it risked spraying the floor if you weren't careful. The rainshower was not as strong as the handspray so it was either you used one or the other, perhaps both if you wanted. The hairdryer was also irritating as it was tiny, had a short cord, and had one setting and temperature (high). Breakfast was either Continental style in the room or buffet in the nice basement dining room. Typical fare was offered like cheeses, cornetti, breads, cakes, pies, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, boiled eggs, canned fruits, juices, bottled water, and cold cuts. We are Sofitel/Accor members so we got a free drink at the bar and a box of chocolates. I highly recommend signing up for this free membership. Note: As others have commented on the hotel is a bit of a hike uphill and is tiring to walk back to after a day of sightseeing. To get an idea it's about six blocks up past the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Roman experience”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several hotels in Rome but this was definitely the best ( as long as you don't mind the walk back uphill). We were upgraded to a lovely room with a front/garden view. The Bar and bartender made our stay even more enjoyable and we loved the breakfast in the beautiful setting. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and all speak English

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service without the Five Star Price!”
Reviews.Author: vinceonthemove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel, Roma on the last leg of a two week trip to Italy for four nights. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon after driving in from Tuscany. Rome is a little difficult to navigate by car so we were happy that the Hertz drop-off was only a couple of blocks away. We pulled up, and were met by two bellman who quickly took care of our bags. Michael at the front desk made check-in a breeze, and also made three local restaurant recommendations that were excellent (more on that later). The hotel lobby, and common areas are immaculate. Our room #209 on the 2nd. floor corner had three exposures: facing the front of the hotel (Via Lombardia), two facing the busy (Via di Porta Pinciana). Although facing that busy side street (cars, scooters, tour buses), the double pane windows kept things quiet. The room itself was elaborately decorated with nice furniture (desk, armoire, fully stocked mini-fridge, tv), and three levels of window treatments. Twin beds (pushed together) and pillows were good. The bathroom was large, all amenities (bathrobes, soaps, combs, lotions etc.) and a nice rain shower. The buffet breakfast (european style) included was good, and can be had either in the restuarant on the lower level, or sent via room service (at no extra charge). Room service was the quickest I ever experienced. Much faster than many of the true five star properties I've stayed at. Imagine, the room service operator was apologizing because it may take 5 minutes!! Nice! The hotel is in a great location in my opinion. Two blocks from the Via Veneto (cafe's, restaurants (Hard Rock Cafe, The famous Harry's Bar, shopping). And within walking distance of all of the major sites (some closer than others) albeit a long walk to others. We were blessed with great weather our whole trip so we laced up our sneakers, and walked virtually around the whole city. **Reviewer Recommendation** Upon arriving in Rome buy a 2 day (Open City) hop-on, hop-off double decker bus ticket. The 2 day ticket is $20Euro, and worth every dime. The approx. two hour tour covers most of the major attractions, and your'e never too far from a bus stop so if you get tired of walking you can hop back on the bus. The tour helps you get your bearings while in Rome. The "Open City" green bus can also be used on the "Rome City" buses also green. The one pass enables you to use both companies..Great deal! There are two stops relatively close to the Sofitel (two blocks away on (Via Ludovisi), and a little longer walk down the hill on the (Via Veneto). The restaurants recommended by Michael (a native New Yorker) were excellent. All within walking distance of the hotel, all very good food at very reasonable prices. First, "il pomodorino" (ate here twice) on the Via Campania. A modern, bright and open local jaunt. Great house red, great pizza and pasta, and the grilled steak & chicken was excellent. Also, on the Via Campania "al vero Girarrosto Toscano", a slightly higher priced "old school" more formal, italian restaurant with a open charcoal grill, and waiters in white jackets, the service was wonderful, and the food also great! Again, a nice grilled steak, two pasta's and a nice bottle of Ruffino Chianti. On our last night we went right around the corner to 'Ristorante Aurora" we kept the "outside" waiter company, and sat alone at the outdoor cafe. Everyone else seemed to want to dine inside, but honestly we never even went in. This local place has great fresh fish. We dined on grilled lamb chops, salad, and a great grilled sea bass (d-boned by the waiter), oh! a bottle of red of course. Service and food was very good, and moderatley priced. I would'nt be surprised that Michael recommends these places to everyone, but in my book all great choices. On a side note, if you plan on visiting Vatican City (St. Peters, the Vatican Museum, & the Sistine Chapel), buy your tickets in advance or take the group tour. The lines when we were there were three hours long to get in. Also, freebies (no charge) are the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, St. Maria of Cosmedin ("mouth of truth" from the movie "Roman Vacation" and the Trevi Fountain. I highly recommend the Sofitel in Roma. It has the hospitality tri-fecta: great location, great service and great price!! Enjoy! Caio!

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CARose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel September 19-24th. We spent a lot of time prior to booking our room researching locations. We decided that the Sofitel was the best choice. We booked six months in advance, directly on the Sofitel website. We booked an internet special where we paid in full right away. It actually worked out for us, since the US dollar has declined. The hotel is small, as most European hotels are. The staff at the front desk were pleasant. When we made our reservation, I indicated we were celebrating our 10th Anniversary. We must have got upgraded to a larger room (looking at the other member postings of pictures). We were on the first floor in the corner. We had a very large room with a King size bed situated almost in a separate room, with a TV. Headboard had buttons to turn on and off lights in the room, with separate reading lamp. There was a very large living room with couch, table, sitting chairs, and a desk and another TV. The decor was very similar to that of a Ritz Carlton I've stayed at. Bathroom was nice, I had read several reviews about no shower curtains, not able to close the door etc., We had no problems. We couldn't be happier with our room. Breakfast was very good. It's a typical Eruopean breakfast with deli, bread, pasteries etc., Rooftop patio was amazing. I read about it on this site, and we checked it out right away. Amazing views, and a great way to end the day with a nice glass of wine! Bar is very nice, excellent service. Approx., 5 mins from the Spanish steps. We were very happy with our room and stay and the Sofitel Rome. I agree with the comment about the lack of Concerige services, but that is the only negative comment I have.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbdgirl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome yesterday and had spent 3 nights at the Sofitel. Hotel is small but elegant, nice rooms (although standard European size - small), fair breakfast, great staff. Fantastic views from rooftop. Location fair - not far from the Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, etc. but a bit of a hike to get to the center. Good value for cost - would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S6_OWL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel Roma for 3 nights on the first weekend of October.This is a very nice hotel in a nice part of Rome close to the Via Veneto and the Spanish steps, other reports on here say it's 5 mins from the Trevi fountain, it is not, it's a longer walk than that and down hill so walking back takes even longer.The Hotel itself is a very nice place to stay with lovely rooms, huge comy beds and for the age of the building spacious bathrooms. It has a nice bar area, and the staff couldn't be more helpful, the restaurant is in the basement, we only used this for breakfast which had a very nice choice and set you up for a day's sightseeing. The jewel in the hotels crown is the roof top terrace which offers you amazing views of St Peters and other parts of this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: This property has a lot going for it. Location is excellent, easy walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain and Medici gardens. It sits a few blocks from the Via Veneto in a relatively quiet area. My room faced a small street with lovely buildings. The staff were uniformly helpful. The room was nicely sized, amenities appropriate for the class of hotel. Bed was a bit hard for my taste. The sheets were atrocious. Like cheap gauze and not comfortable to lie on at all. This is my only dislike. The hotel is not big enough for tourist groups but large enough to accommodate the average guest which i appreciate. The included breakfast was good, the service in the restaurant above average. One tip I got from the hotel: The travel agency two blocks down sells train tickets (seat reservation included) for no extra commission. Definately a time/hassle saver if your plans include train travel and you have not purchased online. Lines at Termini in Rome are mostly miserable!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel but could improve in some areas”
Reviews.Author: travlinandyjr
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to my stay at the Sofitel Roma. We stayed from September 19th through the 24th. First of all, for those that complain that rooms are too small, that is just the way it is in Rome. In this case, I found our room (#214) to be quite comfortable. Here are the pros and cons... PROS: The front desk staff, bellmen, and doormen are great. They are all quick to greet you and help you with whatever you may need. The rooms are clean with turn down service at night. You can have breakfast in the breakfast room or in your own room at no extra cost. The location of the hotel is great (once you get there). It has an unforgettable top floor terrace where you can drink wine and enjoy the spectacular view of Rome. There is also a nice bar/lounge to enjoy a late night cocktail. You are pretty close to Barbarini Square. There are several restaurants (including the Hard Rock Cafe) as well as the Metro (aka subway, tube, underground, etc) You are also close to locations such as the Spanish Steps (where I proposed to my girlfriend.....SHE SAID YES.), Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona etc. You are about 40 minutes walking distance to the Vatican. CONS: I mentioned that the majority of staff is nice. I cannot say this for the breakfast staff. The servers seemed to be disgruntled. I heard many complaints from other guests, although some of the guests, in my opinion, deserved the bad service. PLEASE DONT FORGET THAT YOU ARE VISITING A FOREIGN COUNTRY. YOU ARE THE GUEST AND MUST ADAPT TO THE WAY THINGS ARE IN ITALY AND NOT EXPECT EVERYTHING AS YOU WOULD BACK HOME. Continuing with the cons....the hotel is located at the top of a hill. If you plan on walking to the hotel throughout the day or just at the end of the day, expect an approximate 1/4 to 1/3 of a mile trek uphill. This is important to know if you are out of shape or have any health problems. The hotel is ABOVE AVERAGE. I have stayed in better places around the world but the Sofitel Roma definately made our stay in Rome a pleasant one. We will likely return on our next visit. The breakfast staff was what blew it for us. We would not look forward to going each morning. By the way, the food itself is pretty decent. breads (sweet and regular), salami, prosciutto, cheese, eggs (real ones but a little runny), bacon, little weiners, yogurts, cereals, fruits, juices (real juice) and the coffee is good. Another option is eating out, but why pay when the food is good and FREE. Pleasant Journeys!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Irekky
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel from August 30 till September 6th. We arrived at abt 8.30 am, directly from airport after long flight from the US. Although our check in was scheduled at 3 pm, reception first invited us for breakfast and then showed us two fabulous rooms to chose from. We got a fantastic huge room with balcony and view on the park. Service was as good too. We recommend this hotel very highly to everybody, especially that its location is just perfect in the center or Rome nearby of Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: motiv8matt
Reviews.Content: We booked early and received a decent rate. Although we found a better hotel at an even better rate later on. This hotel was about average to what you get in the U.S.. The staff was very friendly. The location is near to the spanish steps, but up hill! Their dinner reccommendation they gave was not good. The breakfast was OK. The room was beautiful and spacious. In our opinion it was not worth what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Roma-we will return!”
Reviews.Author: cravingtravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel Roma for the first three nights of our honeymoon in Italy and were very happy with the hotel. Our room was lovely, comfortable, very clean, and we were escorted to it by one of the professional staff members. The hotel is very well managed. There is a wonderful terrace that overlooks Rome, more specifically, St. Peter's Basilica is front and center in the distance (well, maybe a little to the right) as you overlook the city from the top of the hotel. My husband and I enjoyed going to the bar of the hotel and ordering a bottle of wine to take to the terrace to enjoy the sunset. One night we decided to stay in rather than go out for dinner so we ordered room service. My risotto ended up being the best I had during our two weeks in Italy. Last, but not least, when we returned to Rome at the end of our Italian honeymoon, we had booked the last two nights at a hotel right around the corner on the same block as the Sofitel. I'm not sure why actually that my husband did that, must have been availability, because the other hotel was not less expensive and certainly not as nice as the Sofitel. Highly recommend the Sofitel Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: McKaye
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a 3-night weekend getaway. The hotel is located just between the metro stations barberini and spagna and it´s a five minute walk from each of them. The area feels very safe, even late at night. Taxi fom Termini should be around 10€. After a warm welcome we were given a huge room by european and especially by rome standards: Twin beds, workplace, table, sofa and two windows facing the patio. Bathroom is huge too and got a powerful shower and nice amenities. The Minibar (Beer 7€) is expensive, but they got a very nice bar next to the lobby which is a lot cheaper (4,50€ for a beer coming with a selection of nuts and crackers). The very nice rooftop terrasse is open till 22:00h and kind of an insider tip. There is no bar upstairs, so it´s no problem to bring your drink from the bar up there (or even your own bottle of wine, I guess). Breakfast is huge and plentiful, especially by italian standards. Overall a true 5-star hotel, even if they only got 4 stars premium. We received a warm goodbye when leaving incl. waving and smiling. I would definetely try to book this hotel again for my return to rome. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heiner5
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room on short notice and paid around 340 EURO per night. It seems that this is the rate you have to pay to get a good, clean, spacious hotelroom in Rome. The Sofitel is nicely located off the Via Veneto, a short Taxi ride from Termini (the main train station in Rome). Or a 5 minute walk from either Metro station Spagna or Barberini. It is going up hill or up the Spanish Steps from the Metro stations so the Metro is not the most comfortable way to travel if you have heavy or plenty luggage. The taxi ride should cost you less than 10 EURO. The room was facing the yard which made it very quiet though not offering the greatest view of course. It had 2 comfortable beds, the usual 4 star stuff as cable TV, minibar, safe and a big sofa. Room was clean and cosy. The Bathroom was pretty big, bright and clean, a bath tub but no separate shower cabin. Breakfast was good by Italian standards but not overwhelming: scrambled egg, sausages and ham, juices, cereals, breads and cakes, canned fruits, excellent prosciutto ham and cheeses – no fresh fruit or veggies like tomatoes though. The food I ordered to the room came in no time and was very good and reasonable priced – unlike the beer from the minibar which costs 7 EURO for a small bottle of local beer. There is a nice bar in the lobby which is opened till midnight where the drinks are much cheaper, so go there for your sun-downer or get your drink there to enjoy it on the 7th floor terrace which offers a great view of Rome! There are loads of restaurants around the area, something for every taste I suppose. Overall this hotel is by far better than another 4 Star Hotel I booked in Rome though it is only 10% more expensive (see my other contributions if you want to know which Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cboer711
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a great choice for a stay in Rome. The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are very large and comfortable. The bathrooms were very nice and the breakfast buffet was extensive. The hotel would have gotten a 5 had there been any kind of concierge help at the hotel. My girlfriend and I were first time visitors to Rome and needed some suggestions for both dining and tours. The front desk did not have a concierge and the extent of the reception desk's help was providing a street map. That being said, there was a doorman at the hotel that should be promoted to concierge. He had some great advice on where to get tickets to avoid lines and certain "off-the-beaten track" sites. For the price, the Sofitel is a prime choice in Rome, just promote the doorman and we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray8888
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful stay at the Sofitel. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. The room was gorgeous…really large, immaculately presented and a wonderfully comfortable king size bed. The bathrooms were enormous by European standards and offered a good selection of beauty and grooming products if you wished to use them. The buffet breakfasts were also a definite must if you stay here – they had such a huge selection of beautiful fresh food so there’s really something for everyone’s taste. And the best part was, unlike many hotels who only offer processed, highly fatty, sugary foods and cooked breakfasts, there was a really good selection of healthy breads, cereals and fruits. The staff were also incredibly friendly and helpful, always only too happy to help, offer local advice etc. The location is ideal – about a 5 minute walk from The Spanish Steps and 10 from the Trevi Fountain. All the other major sites aren’t too far either – my husband and I opted to walk everywhere rather than get public transport and found everything very accessible. The colleum was only a half hour’s walk and the Vatican maybe 45 minutes. It might be a bit far for some, but if you’re young and fit you won’t have a problem walking around Rome and seeing all there is to offer. The hotel is also in what we felt was the nicest, cleanest part of Rome – it was definitely geared towards the up market tourist sector and there was a load of lovely restaurants nearby –and there’s something for everyone, there are the more prestigious, expensive restaurants and also a large selection of very affordable places to eat with great food. And if all that’s not enough the rooftop terrace is lovely….the perfect way to look over the rooftops of Rome at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: edoze
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights for a birthday break, and the quality of the hotel made the trip for us. I've stayed in other places in Rome, and the quality is usually less than you get in the UK or US, but not at the Sofitel. The desk staff were friendly, helpful and unobtrusive. The door staff got to know you very quickly and helped make the place feel very safe and secure. The rooms are immaculate, with luxurious touches everywhere. The bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel - as the guy on reception said "it's like a nest". Great, clean bathroom with regular towel and toiletry top-up. In short, everything you'd expect (but don't always get) from a 4-star hotel. You're within a short walk of the Spanish Steps & its metro station (5-10 mins), though on the way back this is uphill, which might be a problem for some. 5 minutes in the other direction and you're on the Via Veneto. For me, an upmarket location in a quiet but accessible part of the city really makes a city break great. The rooms are big by Rome standards, but not enormous. The breakfast is fine - nothing great, but a convenient start to the day, with pastries, coffee, juice, a good selection of cold meat and cheese and a small hot item selection too. We didn't eat in the restaurant as there are plenty of choices nearby. Other guests didn't seem to use it, but the Sofitel takes advantage of it's hilltop location with a stunning roof terrace. Order a drink from the bar, head up in the lift enjoy a gorgeous pre-dinner half hour up there with views over St Peters and most of Rome! Chances are, you'll have it all to yourself too. This is the only hotel we'll stay at in Rome again, and is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Quiet Elegance”
Reviews.Author: wawood
Reviews.Content: Located adjacent to Villa Borghese, although a wall separating the two requires you to walk several blocks to get into it. Same thing with the Spanish Steps, which is about an 8-10 minute walk due to inability to walk directly there. The hotel is located almost exactly equa-distance between the Spagna and Barberini Metro stations, at about 8 minutes walking. Also located very near to the upscale Via Veneto. The hotel itself has a small feel to it, although the exterior facade promises more. The entry and front desk are understated to the point of being underwhelming. Only when you walk up the stairs to the right of the entrance do you start to experience the old world elegance. Our room, which I believe was a standard king, was small, but nice. Free breakfast included, which was a substantial buffet-type spread in an attractive room. Overall, the Sofitel Roma doesn't blow you away with its opulence, but is upper scale, clean, and quiet; off the beaten path. As such it is a little farther from the Metro and from the heart of the Centro Storico than we would have liked. We stayed at the St. Regis the last night of our vacation and were more impressed with it, although we also paid a fair amount more as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be in the heart of Roma”
Reviews.Author: Saraboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on our stay at the Sofitel in New York and loved it. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were big for Rome, and the staff was very friendly. I would recommend this property to anyone who loved the hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “happy at the sofitel roma”
Reviews.Author: janieB1123
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a two week stay in Italy ending with three days at the Sofitel Roma. The hotel did not disappoint. We booked two rooms both of which had views over the treetops into Borghese Park. The rooms were nicely appointed with excellent beds, very fluffy and welcoming. The bathroom was particularly nice and large enough for two people sharing it. This is not always the case with European hotel bathrooms. There was only one sink which sometimes makes getting out of the room in the AM difficult but there was enough space and good enough placement of things where working together was possible.The only complaint I would have is the airconditioning is just not forceful enough and didn't keep the room cool enough. The location of the hotel was lovely, close to the Spanish Steps but not in the midst of the crowd. The staff was wonderful. We were helped to hire a guide to do the ancient sites which was a first for us and turned out fabulously. Restuarant suggestions (needed at the end of August when things are closed or closing) were excellent. In general, I would recommend this Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ritzcarltonUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days in August. The hotel was comfortable air conditioned throughout, clean and quiet. The breakfast was all you would expect with fresh breads, cheeses, fruits, bacon, eggs etc etc. Service was excellent throughout the hotel. Only a short walk from the spanish steps, pantheon and trevi fountains but in a quiet street with little passing traffic. The open top bus tour of Rome stops one street away and the metro is nearby. Great roof terrace which could use some sun loungers to take the weight from weary feet but otherwise great views over the city. Quite expensive however but it is Rome. Well worth considering!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - close to Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: Looking at Hotels to stay in Rome we had selected a small Boutique Hotel, but then as we had become members of the Sofitels (Accord Favourite Guest card) cancelled this hotel and booked into the Sofitel Roma. The reviews were good on trip adviser. We had booked for one night (before spending five nights on the Amalfi Coast) and then a further two nights upon our retrun to Rome before heading home via Dubai. On arrival the doormen were wonderful and check in was quick and painless. The doorman/Porter showd us to our room and gave us a few quick lessons in Italian (Very funny). Our room was very nice, large room and very well decorated, nice bathroom. We were also given our complimentary drink vouchers (another bonus of being a Sofitel member). Interesting was the fact when we went to the bar that evening to use the vouchers (that we get in every Sofitel we stay at) the waiter made us feel like we were not entitled to these drinks - to the extent he said he would have to check. (So much for being special). The bar area is very large and we were lucky to find a quieter spot as the main portionn had been taken over by some very very loud Americans - we did not revisit the bar, but frequented the restaurant down the road - cant recall the name but turn left outside the hotel and go one block and turn right and the restaurant is right on the corner. (You can actually see it from the door of the hotel if you look right). We did not get upgraded this time. Unfortunately the shower was not great the water pressure was poor and water went everywheree when I tried to wash my hair (Shower over bath). The bed was not the normal Sofitel type with the fluffy pillows and matthress's etc. Also when I sat on the bed it dropped slightly - but it was one night at this stage so we made do. Good point thought was that when we returned at night, we had been given beautiful complimentary toiletries and a gorgeous box of chocolates. We also thought when we returned we would probably get upgraded as Sofitel Members. One great thing was that as we were leaving early the next day for our Amalfi trip tour, the Hotel organised breakfast boxes for us as the breakfast dining room would not be open at this stage - nice touch, Also they kept all our luggage free of charge for the next five days, saving us taking loads of luggage we did not need to the Amalfi Coast. Upon our return five days later we were greeted with "Welcome back Mr & Mrs Dobson" and also our upgrade and what an upgrade it was. We were put on the 7th floor (Top Floor) In a suite with its own very large private terrace (I could have held a party for 50 friends there) table and chair and sun beds. The suite was wonderful, separate lounge, ensuite bathroom and then a huge bedroom with very large bathroom, including a separate shower with great water pressure. The beds were back to the wonderful Sofitel fluffyness and it was amazing. Went I went back down to the front desk, the staff asked was I happy with the shower (they had remembered my complaint five days earlier). The staff were wonderful and the breakfast buffett was very good for Europe buffetts. The staff were very helpful with maps and recommendations and as the sales were on it was a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, perefctly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: ultrafrog75
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at sofitel. Rooms are spacious, and the personel very devoted. We'll certainly come back next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel Roma”
Reviews.Author: Taffman49
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the Sofitel last week and had an amazing time. Took my girlfiend there as a surprise and she was blown away. Staff are probably the most helpful I have ever met! With the room surpassing our expectations! Can't say a bad thing about the hotel! Will recommend it to all our friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: steviecanada
Reviews.Content: I can't say any bad about this hotel. Location is great, rooms are nice and clean. Unfortunatly the rate was very high compared to what I got from other hotels I stayed during my vacation in Italy, that's why I don't give it 5*.

Reviews.Title: “4* looks and 1* service”
Reviews.Author: LoLo29
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at the Sofitel Roma but not for lack of trying. Long story short the front desk personnel have no courtesy to prospective guests. I provided my credit card information in order to book a room as required. To my surprise a staff member replied curtly asking if I am still interested in booking my room; email message was unsigned. When I replied back that I changed my mind as obviously the staff did not even bother looking at my previous email containing the credit card information all I received in return was a 'Cancellation confirmed' email message-no apology offered. For over US $450.00 per night I consider courtesy to be a given, but obviously the Sofitel Roma's staff could care less about this. I've had better treatment from 2* hotels honestly. However, I am definitely glad that I found out beforehand how rude the staff can be. And in fact, I've read another review citing poor service (from concierge) as well. So I'm not the only one to experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveler40
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a very comfortable hotel in a great location. When we arrived, they did not have a non-smoking room available for us but the front desk staff went out of their way to make one available and even personally saw us to the room. The rooms are elegant. And most important the hotel is in walking distance of major sights while still being tucked away in a quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect? It's Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmusicians
Reviews.Content: We completed out two weeks in Italy with a two night stay here and we thoroughly enjoyed every minute. The rooms are large and beautiful with the most incredible beds you have ever experienced in a hotel. Great staff (especially the doormen... great guys). If you can, stay here for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Roma is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: scienceteach14
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Roma is in the best location. Only an 8 to 10 minute walk (downhill) to the Spanish Steps. The lobby, bar, and restaurant provided a classy and beautiful setting. We were upgraded to a deluxe room and we were not disappointed with our accommodations! A corner room (409) was too great for words. We could have lived in the bathroom. Nothing was ever too far away for us and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: quatl002
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel Rome for 3 nights last week. Great hotel! Rooms and bathrooms are clean, staff is helpful and friendly, and buffet breakfast is more than adequate and tasty with attentive staff to bring you coffees and the like. Hotel is located in a quiet, upscale neighbourhood with many other five star hotels, and for the money is a real deal. Location of hotel near the Spanish Steps is wonderful, as is being near the Via Veneto which is lovely and has the Hard Rock Cafe if you long for the taste of North American burgers. Recommend a short taxi ride to Ristorante Gusto for dinner. Would return to Sofitel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: TomIm
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Sofitel for five nights in June 2007, and I can echo the positive reviews the hotel has received. Excellent facilities, and a very friendly staff. Just two comments that I have not seen in the prior reviews: 1.) A surprising number of cab drivers did not recognize the name of the hotel. I recommend carrying the address with you when you go out. 2.) If you like to travel by Tube, it is a long haul to the nearest stop. With that said, we would not hesitate to stay at the Sofitel again. Not as centally located as other recommended hotels we considered, but I liked being a bit off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mkhmiller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Sofitel Roma. We were a family of five and had 2 rooms. Both rooms were large and extremely clean. Bathrooms were adequate in size but again, extremely clean. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful and the buffet breakfast was great. Over our 2 week trip to France and Italy, this was our favorite hotel - You cannot go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sally6
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two day stay at Sofitel Roma. (after coming off a cruise). The staff is incredible! So accomodating! All personnel at reception desk were so friendly and had wonderful attitudes. Always a smile on their faces. Very knowledgable in suggesting restaurants etc. Outdoor doormen had same great attitude.- One of them suggested a great pizza place within walking distance to the hotel. Had a beautiful suite on the 7th. Floor, with a huge balcony with great views of the Vatican. The female bartender in the bar was so lovely! Buffet breakfast is very good with many choices. About a 10 minute walk to Spanish Steps. Overall a great experience at Sofitel Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: AAflyerSeattle
Reviews.Content: Our first time at the Sofitel Roma. It is a beautiful hotel in a great area. It reminded me a of Ritz Carlton. Staff very helpful and accommodating. They gave us very good restaurant recommendations (Piccolo Mundo for one) and suggested the mini bus to get us to the Vactican for one Euro each. Our room was on the smallish side, with beautiful furniture. Very comfortable bed with great linens. Bathroom was large and had great amenities. Breakfast was included and great. Very fresh breads, meats and they had fresh fruit. Definitely a splurge hotel. The staff take care of you. Don't book the Carrani Tour to Naples/Pompeii. The Carrani brochure was given to us at check in. Tour was substandard. If you are looking for a lively lounge for drinks in the evening, this isn't the place. The bar/lounge was again beautiful but no one was around.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room!”
Reviews.Author: Royal_Oak_Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for the last few days of our honeymoon and we were completly WOWed by the Sofitel Roma. The room was amazing with high ceilings. It was absolutely luxerious! The staff at the hotel was very helpful and the breakfast selections were impressive. The only drawback is the hotel has internet on the TV which I found difficult to use (but still better than no internet option at all).

Reviews.Title: “Made our Rome stay”
Reviews.Author: catwilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our 25th wedding anniversary and we would definitely come back. The ample buffet breakfast was worth the extra dollars we spent on the room (included in the room price) and the service was quite good. We were treated like special guests - when we were getting ready to leave I asked how I could check our flight status and the front desk allowed me to use their office computer to print my boarding passes. The room was lovely with a nice view and a little balcony. Great, great, deep tub with lovely scented Roger & Gallet soaps and shampoos. Nice quiet location with some good values in restaurants close by (and expensive, also, just look at the menus and browse a bit). Beautiful view on a mostly empty terrace at the top of the hotel. I bought some silk scarves and happened upon a great dress shop only 2 blocks away on the main street leading into the Villa Borghese park. Better area than the shopping around the Spanish Steps by far, and a better value. I highly recommend the Galleria Borghese museum...just order your tickets at least 2 months in advance on selectitaly.com and you'll see some unforgettable Bernini larger than life marble masterpieces.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: murfieSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel, Roma three nights at the beginning of our Italy vacation and liked it so much that we booked it for our last two days. We were given the same room, which was nicely , traditionally, appointed and large, by Rome hotel standards. It was appointed with two twin sized beds (we were given the choice of a king); desk and chair, seating area and a quaint sliver of a balcony overlooking Via Lombardia and the aging but picturesque villa across the street. Villa Borghese is just across the adjacent Via Pinciana and the Spanish Steps a short, downhill walk. The bathroom was large and well equipped, but the tub/shower needs a better means of preventing leaking onto the floor ( a minor inconvenience). The included breakfast was taken in the basement restaurant space and was more than generous, with a variety of selections tailored to suit large and small appetites. The service was excellent as was the espresso and capuccino, which was delivered on request with a smile. For us, the bonus of our stay was the incredibly friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff at the front desk. Massimo even assisted us with a difficult purchase, which he agreed to return for us the day we left. Michael and the rest of the staff were equally helpful with museum and restaurant suggestions. ( The seafood at Aurora, around the corner, was quite good). I would agree with other contributors to try the restaurants on the side streets rather than on the Via Veneto. For orientation purposes, Sofitel is located between the Splendide and the Eden. We've stayed at the Eden before, but preferred the more intimate treatment we received at Sofitel. We'd stay Sofitel Roma again, in a heartbeat. M. Thompson

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DBUG14
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It's in a great position, only 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps. Staff were very helpful, booked restaurants for us from the Lonely Planet guide. Nice bar where you can sit and have pre-dinner and post dinner drinks (if required!). Concierge were great, organised a taxi to the airport for us and when I telephoned to say we would be late as we were still having lunch, they sorted it with the taxi driver without any problems. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean and comfortable. All in all a great stay, very good value for money - would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “quality at the right spot”
Reviews.Author: Pantera_rosso
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in a classical room The rooms are big enough en very well equiped, with marble in the bathroom and a nice wooden decor in the bedroom all the things you need are there including a small desk and a table with an extra chair the hotel has a restaurant in the basement, did not use it just breakfast which was in buffetstyle and had enough choice to satisfy all our needs, the location of the hotel is very good, at the edge of the borghese park and about 10 minutes from the spanish steps (as with all the hotels in the area it is on a hill so any trip ends with a walk uphill) the area has a lot of restaurants etc incl those at the via veneto (which you should avoid as they are very very expensive, just go into the sidestreets) had a perfects stay in one of the most beautifull cities in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: Kakiebell
Reviews.Content: I debated between the Sofitel and the Intercontinental which is by the Spanish Steps before we went on our trip to Rome. I definatly made the right choice staying at the Sofitel. Yes, it is a little further from the Spanish Steps but I think that is a plus as it is on a side street which is quiet. We could leave our windows open and had fresh air and no noise from the streets and tourists on the streets. Do not worry about the linen sheets, they are changed each day and are not uncomfortable. The pillows were very hard though. There was turn down service each evening with a chocolate on the pillow. The breakfast buffet was the best we had on our two week trip to Italy. There is no internet service in the hotel. There is something on the television which is supposed to be internet, but we could never get it to work so if you are a business traveler, I suggest you bring your laptop if you have one. This hotel met all of our expectations for a quiet, restful place after a very long trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bardel98
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 3 night stay in this lovely hotel. We booked it based on the great reviews it had received on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and friendly and our room was great (a good size, comfortable king size bed with a lovely bathroom). The hotel's location is also excellant, just a few minutes from the Spanish Steps. We also enjoyed taking our time and walking back from the Vatican to the hotel. It's a long walk but with great sights along the way and we actually found the hotel to be so central that everywhere was within walking distance. The breakfast was very nice, with lovely fresh pastries and it filled us up for the morning's sight seeing. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone as we felt it added to our wonderful weekend break in Rome and we plan to definitely come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: Travel789
Reviews.Content: ROOM: The room is bigger than the usual European hotel room. We had a classic/standard room and it's spacious. Enough room to lay out your luggages and walk around. Bathroom was very clean and had all the extras --- clean white towels, hair dryer, shampoo, soap, etc. STAFF: The doorman was very helpful in helping us map out which roads we should take to go to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, etc. The front desk staff were also helpful in giving us updates about our missing luggage (luggage delayed by airline, not hotel). BREAKFAST: No need to venture out for breakfast. Breakfast here at the Sofitel was great. There were lots of selection and all of us in our group looked forward to breakfast every morning. ROOFTOP: Don't miss checking out the rooftop. It has a lovely view of the city. If we're ever back in Rome, I will definitely stay at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “could be perfect with one or two changes”
Reviews.Author: MorganP
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a week in the Sofitel Rome. Last time we had stayed in the Hotel del Corso but though the location here is great were put off by the poor breakfast and the soundproofing in the bedrooms.The Sofitel is in a different class with a five star rating in almost every category. Staff-Always friendly and helpful particulary front door staff. Room-we had a standard room which was generally excellent.The bed was very comfortable-linen sheets changed every morning/plenty of drawer and wardrobe space/ a small table and 2 chairs /good lighting for reading .The bathroom was compact and had everything you would want including Roger Gallet toiletries though the shower could have been stronger. Room cleaning was excellent. Breakfast- If you like to eat ham/cheese /cakes/eggs and bacon at breakfast you would enjoy the breakfast more than we did. There was very little fresh fruit, canned peaches and pears instead of cut up fresh and cooked fruits which are available in comparable hotels elsewhere, and the cereals were limited. My coffee and my wife's tea were often luke warm. We have been in other Sofitels and other 4 star hotels were the breakfast was much better. Hotel facilities. The one facility I want in hotel-I generally don't use room service or the bar-is a free internet facility which is available in the lobby of most comparable hotels.This Sofitel does not have this. Location. It's a ten minute walk from the Spanish steps and up hill on the way back.This may put off some people.It wasn't a big problem for us even in the high temperatures of last week. We would recommend 2 local restaurants.One in the same street-Via Lombardia-on the same side as the hotel an which is not open at night.It is called Gargano's. You choose your meal inside from a wide range of vegetables /salads / ham and meats etc The price is based on weight and you eat outside.It is mostly frequented at lunch time by staff working locally-would highly recommend.Also would highly recommend Girarrosto Fiorentio off the Via Veneto on the other side of the road from the Via Lombardia. It's pricy but of a very high standard. Would also recommend highly a pizzeria -il Leoncino-in the Via del Leoncino which is opposite Via Condotti off the Via Fontanella Borghese. We had 2 piazzas,a mixed salad , a litre of water and a half litre jug of red wine for 22 euros.It is always full which is a good sign. Overall we were very happy with the Sofitel-more healthy options at breakfast and a free internet connection in the lobby would have made our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Roma is simply the BEST”
Reviews.Author: Scuba024
Reviews.Content: Okay, first of all after reading many reviews on this website I could go either way but I was nervous after I had already booked the Sofitel in Rome as my husbands Christmas present. I decided to go with a higher end hotel that we're used to. Well, can I tell you that we were greeted happily upon arrival. We have showed up at the hotel about 9am. They had a room ready for us. It was 2 double beds however they assured us that the maid would fit them together like a king and she did. They said we could have waited for a king bed but we looked very tired which we were, so we went with it. After being led to our room, they came in showed us around the room which was very large might I add & beautiful as well! Just don't forget a converter to plug in any essentials. Then as far as all of the hotel staff were very eager to please us. The breakfast is served every morning from 6:30am till 10:30am with everything from soup to nuts. Everything was delicious. The comfort without leaving home yet the classiness of a five star hotel. The housekeeping staff was very cordial, as they came to clean the room everyday . They had turn down service as well. We had a nice balcony overlooking the street which was very nice. Make sure you get to the top floor for a look off the roof as it is absolutely breathtaking. The bar is wonderful as the staff is tentative to your every need. The doormen are very attentive and helpful in finding restaurants or attending to other needs. Overall a five star staff!

Reviews.Title: “superb standards of service”
Reviews.Author: jusielah
Reviews.Content: We can not rate our service at this hotel highly enough. we were a groupe of 8 and contacted the hotel for a special rate and to our suprise we were upgraded to superior double rooms with breakfast included for 206 euros per night. one of the party had a 2 year old baby and the hotel made up an onsuit room with a bed and a TV for the baby. the breakfast was fine and the barstaff were verry friendly, the rooms are beautifull. A special mention must go to the hotels doorman. he was so informative and helpful, from tourist info to ordering our taxis for the airport(ensuring we paid the right fare) . one warning is reserved for a resturant close to the hotel. i think it was called the white elephant, TOTAL RIP OFF. tried to charge us 480 euros for tomatos on toast and a beer, we refused to pay it. That apart, the sofitel was a true gem of a hotel with great staff and the fact they gave us a deal when we emailed them was the iceing on a sweet cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: N.Ston.Trav.
Reviews.Content: My wife, seven year old son and myself stayed at the Sofitel for five nights in February, 2007. We had a very enjoyable stay and would highly recommend the Sofitel. The room was very well appointed and large by any standard. The bathroom was also large and well stocked with supplies. We had a non-smoking triple. There are few non-smoking triples and our room was on the second floor. It looked out over a small dark courtyard, so there was no view. The good thing, however, was that the room was very quite. We never heard any noise. We would come back most afternoons and have a snack on the rooftop. It has a great view and we were the only ones up there. If you want a view from your room, you should specifically ask. Our tiple room consisted of two large twin beds pushed together to form a king size bed and a small couch made up into a bed. It was perfect for a seven year old, but would be uncomfortable for an adult. We were able to check in early (around noon), the staff was very helpful and the location is great. It is a short walk to the Spanish Steps and other areas. The breakfast was fine. The Borghese Gardens are not far away, and provided my son with a place to run around in. We rented a pedicab for an hour and he had a ball. The hotel is also not far from the Via Veneto. There is an ATM around the corner and a small fruit stand. Both of these we found very useful. If we go back to Rome, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Swedish36
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! The staff (every single one) was so nice, polite and helpful. The hotel is so fantastic and beautiful that it´s impossible to describe! The trip to Rome was my 12-year old sons first trip outside of Sweden and the stay at Sofitel really helped to make the trip a wonderful experience for him (and me of course). We got chocolate every evening too... I can´t say anything negative about this hotel. If I must it would be that the breakfast could have more healthy alternatives. But breakfast was good! I would recommend this hotel to everyone, but I think honeymooners have the perfect hotel here...

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: kara7374
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews to find the "perfect" Rome hotel, I decided on the Sofitel. It was my first trip to Rome and I brought a very unwilling mother. After a long trip and a 45 minute trip from the airport, we were greeted by a more than helpful staff and large, clean, comfortable room. The location is the best - off the beaten track, yet only minutes from the Spanish Steps. Everyone at this hotel from the doorman to the front desk to the bartenders were nothing but stellar. I felt so welcome every time we returned to the hotel. Each night, our beds were turned down and often times, we found our pajamas folded and placed under the pillow. Also, after a day trip to Pompeii and meeting many other fellow tourists, we realized the gem we found. Please feel free to contact if you have any questions (kphilipps@rcn.com). I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel even better staff”
Reviews.Author: Abjohnst
Reviews.Content: Just returned from taking my parents on a 70th Birthday Trip to rome. We spent ages trying to find the right hotel for them and have to say reading TRIP ADVISOR was spot on. A quiet hotel, set in a luxurious location of rome. Plenty of excellent restaurants within walking distance as well as the spanish steps and the trevi fountain. (Better to get taxis if going further afield with older travellers, otherwise ok). The staff were absolutely magnificent, my father was in a wheel chair and we also had our 1 year old. The staff were very attentive to our every need from reception, door staff, restaurant and maid service. The sheets were fine, beds excellent, mini bar full and room service swift. I really couldnt praise this hotel highly enough. If your going on a city break, why spend well over the odds for a hotel you spend sleeping time in? Its the small things that count and this hotel delivers. Beds turned down, sweets on the pillow and clean towels twice a day. Just a tip. I booked a hop on hop off trip with Viator, the stop is just around the corner from the hotel on the corner of via veneto and 2 mins walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: LEVEQUE
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights in February. Their staff was AAA plus. The room was immaculate. Some have complained about the sheets. We had no problem with the linen sheets. The bathroom is fantastic. It had two showers, one handheld and the other on the ceiling. Everything worked flawlessly. Any problem presented to staff was immediately solved. I tried to reach someone and couldn't so the front desk took on the task so I wouldn't have to waste my time. I am not easy to please and this hotel more than met my expectations. It was great coming back after a long day to a quiet area of Rome and find our bedsheets turned down with delicious chocolates on our pillows. We booked on the sofitel website (not the Sofitel Roma) and got a special rate for North American travelers. Wow!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJCharvil
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews on trip advisor, we booked 3 nights in this hotel in February on a special Valentine's package. Despite the website saying that they did not do rooms to accommodate three people, we were allocated a triple room - a room with a king size bed and a separate adjoining room with a single bed for our 8 year old daughter. It was perfect. The staff were great, the hotel was spotless and rooms very well appointed. We were made to feel really welcome. Excellent location for exploring the sites. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel - Mostly Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Rockemsockemrobot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our traditional February trip to Europe and we chose the Sofitel Roma because of prior great experiences at Sofitel’s throughout Europe (Amsterdam especially). The desk staff was responsive but a little cool when we first checked in. They did warm up eventually and we received some wonderful recommendations from one of the female desk staff (forgot her name, but my wife says she looks like a young Demi Moore.) The room was large enough with a nice view and small balcony (6th floor). However, I understand that the 7th floor has the best views and there is a terrace up there, we never got a chance to look at it. Shower was somewhat awkward as it had a large rain type shower head that never heated up to much and a hand held shower head that was intended to supplement the rain type head. Location was good, but not quite central. It was an easy and quick walk to the Spanish Steps, the Borghese Gallery, and to the shopping districts, but it was a long haul to the rest of the tourist attractions. You can walk to the Forum, the Colosseum, and the Vatican, but it will take a long time to get there. The hotel is very willing to call a taxi and they take your information down when the taxi comes in case you lose something in the taxi. Overall, it was a very nice experience and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I expected sth more...”
Reviews.Author: nassos
Reviews.Content: After having read all the comments about sofitel rome I booked through the website of sofitel a double room. The truth is that I found myself in a small but luxurious room that didn’t go beyond my expectations.. For 214 euro per night (I stayed three nights) they would definitely give me a much bigger room and surely with a nicer view [they gave me a third floor room that had balcony through which you could visit the other rooms in the same floor (???)-unacceptable..]. I keep asking myself why I haven’t lied to the staff of the hotel, saying for example sth about birthday, as I have understood upgrades you without any other question… I went for the third time in Rome and the truth is that all I wanted this time was to go shopping and get the best out of the stores that had sales 70-80% (!!!). Although I bought lots of things I didn’t have much space to place the bags in the room… The breakfast was o.k., but coming from greece where we have maybe one of the best cuisines in the world, I wouldn’t say that the breakfast was 5 star.. An omelete, eggs, ham, bacon, croissants, and cheese… I wouldn’t say luxurious.. About the places to be for dinner, I was suggested 3 different from the staff in the hotel.. Avoid the restaurant ‘Le grotte’ that they proposed, near piazza di spagna.. Having tasted dishes in more than 2000 restaurants in all over the world (because of my profession) I wouldn’t suggent it if you would like to eat sth special.. Maybe, prefer ‘piccolo mondo’ which is nearer to the hotel… And try to book for ‘piperno’ that they proposed, but couldn’t book.. As they said. Rome is one of the loveliest places I have never been in my life so far, and I would be glad to give information to anyone who would like an extra hand..

Reviews.Title: “Rome with a View”
Reviews.Author: mooresontour
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome and the Sofitel which we booked over the internet. Read the reviews and wondered about some of the comments but decided to book anyway. We have never submitted to Tripadvisor before but were so please with our experience in the Sofitel/Rome that we felt it warranted a submission. The hotel was excellent, from the moment we arrived at the door and Luigi took our cases we felt at home and very welcome. All the staff were helpful and eager to help - even without being asked eg: concierge telling us about a small church with Carvagiio paintings which we would never have gone to see if he hadn't told us that they were just five minutes away! The hotel is spotless, the room was excellent, sumptious, wondered if the photos on the internet were of their best rooms - if they were we got one - robes, chocolates at bedtime etc. Breakfast - not to British/Irish taste but you are in Europe and choice is typical contintential - you will find something! We ate well every morning. Location: am so glad we stayed here and not at some of the others we looked at. eg near Termini. - didn't know at the time but you really need to stay in and around the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain. Sofitel is in an excellent location - 3mins from Spanish Steps/8mins from Trevi Fountain. Could go on but suffice to say we would have not hesitation in retuning to Rome/Sofitel. If you book this hotel you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chewy-chewy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as the first place on our 2 week honeymoon to Italy. All we can say is "wow"! We booked an incredible rate on the internet, and they upgraded us to a suite when we told them it was our honeymoon! The staff is incredibly friendly, and the place is sparkling clean. The location is great--very quiet area and very close to the Spanish Steps. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Best, Best, Best”
Reviews.Author: WhatNameIsntTaken
Reviews.Content: Best location, best breakfast, best staff. My husband and I married in Italy and stayed at the Sofitel for almost 2 weeks! I contacted the hotel directly to get a feel for their customer service and was so impressed, we decided to book directly with them. The wonderful staff, especially Eliseo, made sure we received top notch service, something you rarely experience anymore. If you can splurge, book a room on the 7th floor, the largest most beautiful rooms and views await you. Stop reading this and book a room with Sofitel. :-) Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Viva the Sofitel Roma!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jorge&Jeanette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Roma for 4 days in December during our Honeymoon and we thought it was the best hotel we had throughout our entire Honeymoon. The service in this hotel is 5 star, our airline lost all of our luggage when we got to Rome and then when we got to the hotel the concierge took all of our luggage info and said we will get your bags back for you. After 2 days of constant phone calls and tracking by the staff at the Sofitel they found our luggage and sent it to our hotel intact. We didnt have to do a thing, they did it all for us! The rooms are large and very clean, the bathrooms are large and luxurious as well. The location of the hotel is perfect, not to far from anything yet not close enough to swamp you in the tourist herds. Breakfast is well stocked and delicious and we enjoyed it everyday. All in all our stay at his hotel was superb and we would without a doubt stay there again. This hotel really raised the bar for the service and comfort of your stay. It is well worth the money!!!! A+++!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: IronMaidenYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the sofitel Roma - one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Spent New Years Eve on the roof terrace watching the fireworks all over Rome - unforgettable! Staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat5573
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a good location. We stayed here for a couple of nights just before Christmas and couldn't fault a thing. The room, including the bathroom, was spotless. We will definitely be using this hotel again and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a quality hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth paying extra for”
Reviews.Author: TiggerDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel, which I booked on the recommedations from the reviews on this site. After reading reviews about a number of hotels in Rome we could only find this one, which was a bit more than we wanted to pay, that could give us what we wanted. We weren't dissapointed, the staff are very friendly and attentive. The room was gorgous, large and very clean. Breakfast is well worth having as there is a selection of hot and cold dishes to choose from. The sheets and pillow cases are made from linen which creases very easily, but each night when we returned to the hotel it looked like the bed linen was changed daily. A good night verse and a chocolate each added the finshing touch. We were talking to another couple at the airport who had had a dreadful time at their hotel, with stained bed covers and paper thin walls which made it very noisey so we were very pleased we'd paid the extra and had comfort.
