I e-mailed the hotel before and asked for a smoking room on a high floor and they e-mailed back within 48hrs to confirm my request. A note for the ladies the toiletries don't contain a body lotion so remember to take your own.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: anticorpo
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in an excellent location. Staff very friendly and attentive, clearly a result of a dedicated effort by the general management. Overall sparkling clean, without being "clinical". Bathrooms excellent with "Roger Gallet" products.Rooms spacious and extremely quiet (at least mine). (Bed-linens are not that scratchy: they are made , precisely, in linen, which is a material more costly and even more healthy than cotton ). Beautiful breakfast with prosciutto crudo sliced on the spot. Two or three PROBLEMS. Room-service hours , for hot dishes,are way too short : from 19:30 to 22:30. I was sold a three-bed room , but one was actually a rather uncomfortable chaise-longue, which my senior relative did not appreciate too much (I know, I should have used it...). My bed was creaking (revenge by the senior relative ?). Very good place overall.

Reviews.Title: “It should be a 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: tnghi121
Reviews.Content: Being a Sofitel fan, I reserved this hotel without reservation for our trip to Rome in September 2006. Long before our arrival, I have corresponded to the hotel directly to ensure that 2 non-smoking rooms on high floor and are close to each others are confirmed. They have always responded in a timely manner to every question I had. Here are a few points about the hotel: 1. LOCATION: Within short walking distance to Spanish Steps, Via Condotti, many restaurants (both expensive and inexpensive), many shops, subway...but on a quiet residential street. 2. CLEANINESS: THE BEST REASON FOR STAYING HERE. Spotless clean room, bathroom, crisp (I would disagree if someone called this hard or scratchy) sheets (a sure sign that a clean and pressed sheet was changed-some 4 stars hotel do not change the sheets often). I was shocked that the bathroom doesn't have the urine smell like some other hotels (4 and 5 stars) that I have stayed at in Europe) 3. SIZE: Nice/comfortable size of bed and bathroom for Rome. 4. DECOR: As always, the lobby and rooms are tastefully, artistically decorated with marble and paintings. 5. SERVICE: They never cease to amaze me with the attentive service: from calling taxi to handling your luggage, to the room orientation tour, to giving direction and making reservation. The front desk staff speak 3,4 languages. 6. BREAKFAST BUFFET (try to book the room with breakfast): Quite generous in selection (yogurt, fruits, cold meat such as ham and turkey, boiled egg, scamble egg, sausage, bread/croissant, juices, cereal, cheese...). The breakfast area are nice and cozy. The staff are extremely attentive without demanding tips (in fact, most people do not leave tips) OVERALL: I am amazingly surprised that this Sofitel is not on the list of 4 stars hotel in Rome although the price is of a 4 stars hotel. It is truly a hidden treasure. In fact, I truly think that it deserves a 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chickenlittle1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for three nights during our honeymoon to Italy. You can't beat the location, walking distance to both the Spanish Steps as well as lots of nice cafes and restaurants, but at the same time it's located in a quiet spot so you're away from the crowds. The room was beautiful, and the bathroom was total luxury. I have to agree with the post below about the sheets, I definitely noticed that they were on the rough side, but we didn't mind it too much. All in all it was a magnificent trip and we would do it again. We LOVED the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “A+ to Sofital”
Reviews.Author: RSIERRA
Reviews.Content: Arrived Nov 1st for 3 night stay, part of a tour. Lovely location, great rooms, even got skimmed milk for my cereal. Sheets were scratchy, but this was a momentary laugh. Staff very accommodating. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb”
Reviews.Author: JRG1972
Reviews.Content: Great location near to Spanish Steps. Fabulous room and classy hotel. Staff very friendly and couldn't do enough to ensure our stay in Rome was truly unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “nice but.....”
Reviews.Author: vtroos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Roma in Oct. we booked two rooms. The hotel itself is beautiful and in a good location. They offer a nice breakfast which was included in our rate. The staff was fine, nothing outstanding. We had to track down the bartender each night to get a drink. The rooms are neat and clean, but the sheets are made of burlap. Ok, not really, but were so scratchy and stiff that we put towels down to sleep on! I booked the hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor, so I thought it was important to note the sheet problem for others to be aware of. vicki- London England

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Marcine
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel. We stayed for three nights in mid-september. My husband had called ahead and told them it was a special birthday and they had upgraded our room to a de-luxe, corner room on the 6th floor with a view across the roof-tops to St Peters and the Vatican - and a little balcony! The large room and scrumptious bathroom were beautifully furnished with antique furniture, a bed big enough to sleep sideways on and luxury soft furnishings. The location was just a short 2 block walk to Via Veneta and a short walk to the Spanish Steps approx 5 minutes to the top and just a bit further to the Trevis Fountain. One morning we got up early and walked to the Vatican City, an easy walk taking about 30 minutes from the hotel. We took an open top bus around the city jumping off at the Colloseum and other places of interest . But back to the hotel, friendly staff, great breakfast (actually one of the best I have ever had in a hotel outside the UK) included in the room rate. Would definately stay here again when we go back to Rome and would recommend it wholeheartedly. PS. Great products in the Bathroom too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: becsterhawkeye
Reviews.Content: Fanastic Hotel, fantastic location! it really made our stay in Rome perfect. Concierge were really helpful and gave us excellent tips for all avoiding all the queues to the main attractions. Couldn't fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: DJTAJS
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week at the Sofitel Roma it was incredible. I have been to Rome and throughout Italy many times and this was the best. The location was great and the rooms were large by Italy standards. The staff was very helpful. We had a wonderful time and I would stay at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: JAKE007
Reviews.Content: Great Rooms ,friendly staff, immaculate bathrooms, excellent service and location. high recommend this place. The breakfast was top noch. We wil stay again and again. Joe Kozaya PA USA

Reviews.Title: “Pure Perfection”
Reviews.Author: daleceo
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I booked Hotel Sofitel and was still pleasantly surprised. The Sofitel did not come up on many Web sites so it is a bit of a secret. We wanted a great hotel for our last night in Italy which we were spending in Rome. We did not want to spend a fortune so the Sofitel seemed the best luxury hotel value. After arriving we realized that the Sofitel is right next to the Splendid and down the street from the Hotel Eden, the Westin Excelsior, and several other luxury hotels that were much pricier however, the Hotel Sofitel was elegant and classy, not gaudy like the Splendid and others. The room was beautiful with a balcony and a gorgeous bathroom. The bed was heavenly, the best we had in our two week travels. The room had every amenity. The price included buffet breakfast and had lots of selections. The staff was very gracious everytime we needed something. The hotel is perfectly located by the Villa Borghese gardens, Via Veneto, and the Spanish Steps. Their service was wonderful, and their entire staff was always warm and friendly. We have traveled a lot. We checked out the other luxury hotels in Rome out of curiosity. Pick Hotel Sofitel. You will find "Pure Perfection"

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: westender
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three enjoyable nights at the Sofitel. While the staff aren't the most attenttive in the world we found them charming and helpful in their own Italian way. The room was typically Roman with lots of rich coloured furnishings. Although it was quite small, we found it cosy and more than adequate for our stay. The breakfast (included in our rate) was a well presented buffet with cured meats and pastries The coffee was unusually weak for Italy but they will politly get you a pot of local lava when asked! The hotel is very central, only five minutes from the Spanish Steps. The only minor complaint we had was that there was no business centre so we were unable to access the net on site. Having said that, next time we're in Town we'll definitely stay here! If the net is essential I would advise you to bring a laptop and access it in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Lovely Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: dmorcareers
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sofitel July 27 for three nights. The experience was truly wonderful. The doorman was so helpful and basically planned our day showing us in detail where to go on the map and what to see at each stop. The front desk was very helpful and tried to accomodate our needs. The lobby bar was lovely and I enjoyed a capuccino and the lovely waitress brought me an entire plate of shortbread cookies to munch on (not ordered). There is a food market in the subway about a ten minute walk and we were able to buy some items including drinks. The location was great as you were near both the Spanish steps and the Bernini area. One evening we ate at an amazing family style restaurant at the suggestion of the front desk. The name started with a P, someting like pompanello and the food was very good. Not a romantic type restaurant. The room was very clean and the turn down service a nice touch. The walk up the spanish steps and up the hill to the hotel in the heat was a challenge but doable. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kdluvbug
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy, and actually, our first trip to Europe, and we picked the Hotel Sofitel based upon the reviews here on TripAdvisor.com - we were not disappointed. In fact, it was so beautiful, and so wonderful, we didn't want to leave, and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to everyone. We arrived at the hotel late at night, around midnight Italian time, and they escorted us to our room, and it was beautiful, with high ceilings, and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was gorgeous, and I enveloped myself with bubbles in the tub every day. The buffet was perfect, with lots of different cheeses, and fresh fruit, and was included in our hotel room price, and therefore saved us some money. Even room service, which we ordered on our first day in Italy upon waking up was impeccable and delicious. They provided us with maps of the city, and highlighted where we were in location to everything else. The hotel is located in a truly wonderful, residential part of the city, just a few blocks from the top of the Spanish Steps. We walked everywhere and Rome was just an incredibly warm, inviting and vibrant city. We will definitely be going back, and will absolutely, positively stay at the Sofitel. Their service was wonderful, and their entire staff was always warm and friendly. Grazie Hotel Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mwilkins
Reviews.Content: Had to contact the hotel directly for details of a room for 2 adults + child. What we got was a half price deal 240 euros instead of 570 per night. Our room was actually 2 bedrooms one with a double bed the other with a single. The whole hotel was excellent, right from the very helpful doorman to the cleaner who gave my daughter a stuffed toy. The hotel has a great position just to the north of the traffic free zone, meaning you can drive to it. It sits on a one way street so if you are driving there, get a map in advance. The hotel will park your car for you, but one road over is a public car park which charges 18 euros a day.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance June 26, 2006”
Reviews.Author: MistressofthePark
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Roma is in a very quiet location, but within an easy walk of metro station and major attractions. The rooms were clean and bathroom was comforatble for 2 persons. Ask for a hairdryer, the one in the room stinks. The hotel staff went out of their way to assist us with special requests, tours and restaurant recommendations. When we were unable to secure tickets for a Vatican Tour via the internet, Alfredo at the front desk found us a private Vatican tour guide on 2 days notice. The quality of the breakfast buffet was superior to the other 4 hotels visited during our trip. The combination of the quiet location and the superior staff make this an easy hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Luneytoons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome on July 1st and we stayed in the Sofitel Roma. The location is ideal. You are within walking distance of the Spanish Steps and not far from Piazza Navona. Our stay was more than I expected. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We had the unfortunate luck of being in Rome during the taxi strike and the wonderful people at the Sofitel Roma went out of their way to find us transportation to the train station so we could continue our vacation. Thank You!!! The rooms are large, clean, and beautiful. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was a nice bonus. I highly recommend this hotel. If I return to Rome I will gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitleylass
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel using trip advisor and was not disapponted. . This hotel is in a great spot for all the main sites, although does involve a steep hill walk at the end of the day. Facilities and room was excellent - we had one of the best bedrooms we have ever had in a hotel. For breakfast there was an extensive choice and food was of a good quality. The staff are discreet but are more than happy to help if you need their assistance. It is typical of a hotel dealing with tourists and business clientele. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very low value for money”
Reviews.Author: clubsnap
Reviews.Content: The location is not great, it's not near to a metro. The staff were not as friendly as others have said here. The aircon did not work well (worst of all the hotels we stayed in Europe). The breakfast was ok. Overall I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone as it is very expensive. I would never come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VegasDan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the sofitel in Jul 2006. Very elegant and luxurious rooms. We were a family of four with two rooms, which were interconnected by a private hallway. We loved this arrangement. The bathrooms were very nicely appointed and modern (as the other reviewers commented, water does splash out when taking a shower due to insufficient barrier but this is a rather minor inconvenience). The hotel is located close to the Spanish steps and a short walk from the Trevi fountains. Access to bus and Metro stations was also convenient, which allowed us to go to all the sites during the day and retreat back to a quiet oasis after an exhausting day of sightseeing. There were also many dining options near the hotel. Our expectations of hotel rooms are very high, and I would say this hotel is comparable to many top resort hotels in the US in terms of room size and quality.

Reviews.Title: “A exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCFLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: On this, our 4th trip to Rome, we decided to stay at the Sofitel because it was offered as part of a package with a travel club we recently joined. Our 5 night stay far exceeded our expectations. Our room on the 5th floor was very spacious and handsomely decorated. It was also extremely quiet. We never once heard other guests in the hallway or from adjoining rooms. We also had a small balcony overlooking the street which added a nice touch to our stay. The bathroom was large and well appointed. As other reviewers have noted, the bath had a half shower door which allowed some water to hit the bathroom floor. Was this a problem? Absolutely not. That's what bath mats are for. Breakfast each day was hearty. Prosciutto, other meats and cheeses, breakfast rolls, pastries, hard cooked eggs, etc. are just fine with us. When in Rome ...... Everyone on the hotel staff including housekeeping were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a nice, quiet neighborhood in a sort of triangle with the Spanish Steps at one point, Via Veneto at a second point, and Villa Borghese at the third, each a ten minute walk away. However, it's also hilly. The walk from the Spanish Steps after a day of shopping and sightseeing can be arduous. Ask for directions to the Metro entrance (about two blocks away) at the top of Via Veneto near Villa Borghese. Inside you'll find escalators and moving sidewalks which make for a much easier walk to and from the Spanish Steps. It's also a great shortcut on a rainy day. The stop for the #116 bus is also outside the entrance. The 116 will take you to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Campo Di Fiori, etc. We almost always take public transportation (have never had a problem). For one Euro it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Just about as perfect as one could get”
Reviews.Author: magnet1125
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and could not have been more pleased with the overall experience...except for the surprising revelation (not confined to the hotel) that travelers checks are not too welcome....even though I brought them in Euros..the reaction ranged from not accepting them at all, to charging large percentatges for converting them to actual Euros..... as to the hotel itself.....the staff is excellent and extremely willing to please....the rooms are elegant, clean and much larger than one expects in Europe....the location is good and makes most of the tourist attractions reachable fairly easily.....

Reviews.Title: “Good service, beautifully decorated, near Spanish Steps, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: butterfly00
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in Rome is beautifully decorated - the lobby gorgeous and the rooms small (as is typical in Rome) but very classy (gorgeous curtains and bedspreads, every detail a bit different but tastefully put together -- they even put a fresh orchid in the bathroom!). The location is quite good for the tourist sites (all are walkable), but just a bit off the main road for a more discreet location - it's just a few blocks away from the Spanish Steps. The service was very good - the staff helpfully answered all of our questions and ordered taxis for us, etc. upon request. My only real complaint is that the breakfast buffet was awful -- it was 80% meat (all pork, from what I could tell) with no fresh vegetables or fruit. They had a couple kinds of cereal and dried pastries and that was it. Not at all the variety of foods Americans are used to (particularly those who do not eat meat at breakfast). I also note that the rooms at the Sofitel are much smaller than those at the suites at the Dei Mellini, which we got for the exact same price later in the week (around $400/night). Around the corner from the Sofitel is Restaurant Aurora, which I highly recommend (one of the best places we ate at in Rome), but note that it is pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, ok location, no shower curtain!”
Reviews.Author: mkhollis1
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of its rating, location, and the pics looked nice. Americans, be forewarned -- there is NO shower curtain, only a small divider, not large enough to prevent the rain showerhead and hand-held showerhead from spraying water everywhere!!! This and the fact that the bidet took up valuable bathroom space (only room for 1 person at a time), were our biggest disappointments (& a hard bed, but that seems to be the norm in hotels). The location was ok, not really near the Spanish Steps like some say (several blocks away & you're at the top, not the bottom!). The metro was about a 5-7 minute walk, so not too bad. It is close to Via Venetto, which was good (lots of restaurants & shopping). If were to do it all over again, I would have stayed there (the Marriott & Westin both looked nice, so check them out!). The staff was very nice, always trying to help with directions and quick with getting your ice. Turndown wasn't much to write home about, but they did get us fresh towels and leave a little chocolate, so that was nice. We arrived a bit early, so our non-smoking room wasn't ready. We were given a smoking room, but the manager took us up to the room to smell it before we accepted it (this without our having to ask -- BTW, it didn't smell at all, and we are very sensitive to smoke). We also had 1 of only 3 balconies on our side of the hotel, so that was quite nice as well. We had an issue one night with the air conditioning waking us up, and they "fixed" it -- if you have that problem, just turn the fan on medium instead of high -- lol. One good thing was the breakfast buffet was included with the room (we weren't told that checking in and only found out by accident). So, ok location, friendly staff, but I would stay at Westin or Marriott on Via Venetto next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Wonderful Rooms, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: traveller1959
Reviews.Content: This hotel is officially rated 4 stars and has 4-star-rates but certainly displays 5-star-luxury. It is located in one of Rome's best neigbhorhoods, between the Spanish Steps and Via Veneto, adjacent to Borghese Park. The location is both central and comparativly quiet (for Rome). For our family, we had three rooms, which were located on both sides of the building, and both had nice views in the adjacent parks and over the city. The rooms are - as the public rooms - lavishly decorated in historical style but are brand new. For Rome, where even 5-star-hotels have smallish rooms, the rooms are quite spacious. The bathrooms are all marble, very beautiful and stocked with good toiletries (Roger & Gallet) and bathrobes. The hotel's service is excellent. Everybody, the girls at the reception desk as well as the porters, are extremely helpful and friendly. Also the maids are very friendly. Of course, there is a turn-down-service at night. The limo service from and to the airport was efficient albeit expensive. Breakfast (which was included in the room rate) was good, with some excellent Italian specialties (like fresh cut San Daniele ham). However, I can understand that some Americans did not like it, because the special things for Americans (scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon) were rather mediocre (maybe on purpose?). One night, we had dinner in the restaurant, which was medium-class, not bad, but not really good (e.g. tasteless truffles). However, in all directions there are hundreds of restaurants in walking distance. Very recommendable for a rustic, typical Roman meal was Tempio di Bacco (just down the street, 200 meters from the hotel) where we were served a wonderful 4-course-menu including a bottle of wine and limoncelli for 36 Euros.
